Review_Date: Denise D wrote a review Mar 23
Review_Title: Lovely hotel, friendly and attentive staff - only one disappointment
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at La Maison Arabe for 3 nights during our visit to Marrakech. We found the hotel to be lovely and in beautiful condition the staff friendly and helpful and our room very comfortable. The breakfast was excellent and we especially enjoyed being able to dine by the pool on a beautiful spring morning. Our room also had a balcony overlooking the pool which we took advantage of in the evenings.    I took the cooking class sponsored by the hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. The leader of the class had excellent English and the chef (who the leader translated for) was clearly a pro in the kitchen. The kitchen was well-equipped for learning and everyone had their own workstation. I learned several new techniques and recipes and I enjoyed dining on the fruits of my labors with my fellow classmates.    Here's my one disappointment: we also booked an excursion through the hotel listed under the "Experiences" menu of their website as "Scenic Morocco." It is an all-day trip to the Atlas Mountains visiting 2 kasbahs and the villages of Imlil. When our driver picked us up he did not introduce himself to us or even say good morning. All he did was confirm that we were the right people. He did not speak to us for the entire 1 1/2 hour drive to our first stop. First I thought this might be because he didn't speak English but later learned not only was this not the case but he was actually in tourism school. Anyway after an hour and a half he stopped in a village in front of a shop and started talking on his phone After a few minutes we finally said: "What are we doing?" He said "Oh we are waiting for the man to come take you up to the kasbah." After a while the man showed up and we hiked up to the first kasbah to have breakfast. It is stunningly beautiful and we enjoyed it. We wandered around there for a while and then asked someone at the front desk what we were supposed to do next. He said: "oh you know the way back to the village right? Just walk back down." So we did. What we didn't realize was that this village of one street and a few shops represented the entirety of the "wandering through the villages of Imlil" listed in the itinerary. We finally found our driver waving to us from a car park and got in the car.    We asked him "what next?" He said "I'm taking you to your next stop." So we drove 30 minutes to the truly fabulous Kasbah Tamadot. It is now about 11:30 and we have finished breakfast about an hour before. The people at the front desk asked us what we wanted to do. We said: "What is there to do?" They said: "Well you can go hiking but it will take at least an hour for a guide to get here. Or you could do spa services. You are really just here for lunch which starts in an hour." Having just finished breakfast we weren't too keen on lunch. So we wound up hanging around their admittedly beautiful terrace for an hour and half waiting to be a little bit hungry. We finally relented and ate something then got in the car and headed back to Marrakech. The driver never spoke more than a few words at a time the entire day. So I will say that we did see the Atlas Mountains but the day was nothing like I expected. Nor did I consider it to be worth the $540 we paid for it. Re-reading the experience description I fault myself for not asking more questions. But I think the hotel could do a better job of setting expectations.    All that said we still had a wonderful experience at La Maison Arabe. I would highly recommend it. Hopefully future travelers will do a better job than I did of asking questions before booking excursions.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Carol P wrote a review Mar 21
Review_Text: Wonderful hotel. Adjacent to the bustling Souk but quiet and peaceful. Wonderful foodservice and accommodations Hotel arranged guides taxis and airport transfers. Loved our stay Great place to begin our Morocco adventure

Review_Title: Morocco people are very warm and kind - Maison Arabe is a testament of it.
Review_Text: We wanted a boutique hotel with the Morocco style instead of the other bigger hotels. It was a won bet as the intimacy and coziness is present the moment you open the door. The staff is always available nice warm and you feel their genuine interest to make you have a great experience. So Kudos first of all to HR as this team is fantastic. They help you on reservations hire a guide so you can go to trusted stores taxis etc. I also have a great story as I forgot my IPODs in the safe and already on the airport asked it they could send it to Portugal by mail. I was surprised to get a call 20m later mentioning the airpods were at the airport for me to pick it up outside. Thanks Ishmael. They are true ambassadors of the Morocco culture and heritage. As for the hotel it´s very nice clean tidy and silent. We do suggest you have breakfast in the hotel and try if for lunch or dinner as well. We felt a little bit ashamed to go out to other restaurants and then discover the quality of the hotel service that is 5*. As for the rest it´s very close to the Medina you are very safe to walk alone as a tourist as no one will rob you . Tourism is very important in this country and they take it serious. Thanks again Maison Arabe life is experiences and this one was fantastic. I stayed at a superior room with balcony to the pool and a suite - well worth it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brian T wrote a review Mar 20
Review_Text: What a wonderful place! The location was great and right in the middle of the Medina (old town) and couple blocks from their market.  The suites were absolutely fabulous with both an outdoor seating area and a rooftop seating area.  The place was decorated in local rugs and Moroccan decorations.  The staff was amazing- great service and super polite.  I HIGHLY recommend this place when in Marrakech.  One note- La Maison is a Riad and not a hotel. Big difference. Riads are like house with different rooms of different sizes. They are much smaller than an hotel and the layout is completely different. If you expect a traditional hotel this is not the place for you. If you are looking to stay at a 5 star local authentic place this is it!

Review_Date: Bavly K wrote a review Mar 19
Review_Text: Absolutely recommend La Maison Arabe. The staff was great and not pushy. They speak Arabic English French and other languages to accommodate. They have a beautiful restaurant jazz bar pool and musical entertainment every night. They have a beautiful hammam and other great resources to get you around the city. I highly recommend it for your stay at Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Deshayne F wrote a review Mar 17
Review_Title: Maison Arabe is an outstanding Marrakech riad!
Review_Text: My husband and I spent three days at Maison Arabe in early March 2023. Originally we were only going to spend two nights but extended it to three and I'm so glad that we did! This was such a beautiful and relaxing hotel and the service was outstanding! We ate dinner in the poolside restaurant twice and really enjoyed our meals (we are vegetarian and found there were lots of options). We also took advantage of many of the activities they offer including: hammam (not to be missed) massage private walking tour of Marrakech (the guide was excellent) cooking class (on Morrocan salads) and a trip to their country club pool (about a 20 minute free shuttle ride from the hotel). I only wish we'd had another couple of nights to spend there!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is its own mini oasis there are so many ways to relax here in the middle of the busy city. Would definitely recommend the spa. Each morning the food was delicious and the staff was excellent!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Classic and original Marrakesh much better than any modern remake
Review_Text: We were at La Maison Arabe for my wife birthday and a 2 nights week end stay early march. The preparation of our week end was already done via email with the concierge and receptionists and when we got there it was even better than what we expected.  The place is 'real' Marrakesh's riad full of beautiful plants and trees 'used' rugs with the best traditional colous and texture and a wonderfull all maroccan team who is smiling at you every time they see you walking around the charming and a bit 'misterious' corridors and spa.  Food is really good we enjoied the 'asian' dishes but also the more traditional tajines.  The location is superbe very central but quite and secluded.  Service at '6' stars level we were able to look at different rooms for a possible choice but finally we staied in our pre-booked large junior suite. The director is a wonderful person very helpful and available he is thruely rare in the fast moving Marrakesh hotelerie.    We reccomend the hamman with a scrub done by local ladies who know exactly what to use and how to make you feel welcomed and still leave you in your personal 'bubble' during the whole experience.    A well known place where you feel at home and in the hart of the culture of this wonderful city.

Review_Date: Kristin A wrote a review Mar 10
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel with excellent service and food. The hotel is located in walkable distance to the Medina.  I would highly recommend this hotel for comfort service food and also a beautiful spa located in the hotel. I stayed for 3 nights at the hotel and enjoyed every minute!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: prefer 5 stars :-) wrote a review Mar 9
Review_Title: Lovely riad style hotel in great location
Review_Text: the property is exceptionally well positioned close to the median souks and many of Marrakesh’s attractions. We were able to walk to many of the places we wanted to see. The staff are unfailingly polite and attentive and offer excellent service. Our room (standard courtyard) was quaint if a little small. Being on the courtyard it wasn’t the quietest and you could also hear a little of the hustle and bustle outside but overall was very nice and comfortable ( however the shower soaked the bathroom unless you were very careful). We didn’t eat in the restaurant but it did seem very popular and the bar has a nice ambience and again attentive service. Overall a very nice hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A classic place. THe place is adorable the staff is super professional. From calling them directly for my booking to the arrival and departure. I travel for a living and not very often an hotel gets 5 stars from me. I give them 5 without hesitation. Nice job.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: We totally agree with all the amazing reviews this hotel has. From the moment we stepped through the door we were so well looked after. The food was AMAZING the rooms really comfortable but the hotels true success is the incredible staff. They were all so friendly happy and helpful.  We loved going to the secret garden and swam in the huge pool. We used the spa several times and enjoyed the treatments. We went up to the mountains on a day trip again with a fabulous driver.  The hotel was a complete sanctuary away from the busy streets.  Well done on creating something very special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brian L wrote a review Mar 6
Review_Text: A great experience and exceptional staff. Everyone was incredibly friendly and accomodating. The staff seemed to know us after only a day and knew how to make sure everything was taken care of without feeling overbearing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Second visit, the same quality experience.
Review_Text: This hotel is fabulous.  Once experienced in November now in February.  Just inside the Medina. In superb location with Berber souk on doorstep spice for the senses.  The hotel is peaceful and calming.  Delightfully appointed creating a relaxing environment.  The reception managers are excellent attended ably to our every request.  The Hamman divine atmospheric relaxing a must do experience with very experienced staff.  Homely cocktail piano bar. Romantic dining experience quality of food a treat.  We also enjoyed a private Moroccan bread making tuition we were thrilled by the skills shared with us. Thankyou Dada.  Such a wonderful group of staff so ready and happy to meet the needs of visitors.  La Maison Arabe is one of my favourite places it feels like home. I will return I hope but it's so popular I will be fortunate.  Thank you to EVERY member of staff who make it their goal to deliver superb service along with friendship and kindness.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrew H wrote a review Mar 5
Review_Text: This hotel was excellent. A mixture between an Alladdin's Cave and a beautiful maze. There were different features on each floor that keep one interested. It has two wonderful open air patios with central water features. The dining area positioned by the swimming pool has a beautiful ambience. The Hammam was professional and provided a very nice environment for relaxing.    The staff couldn't do more they were eager to help and friendly everything ran smoothly from the reception to the cleaning staff and the restaurant (the food was very good).    Thank you for a wonderful time in Marrekesh.    Andrew & Malgosia
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bill W wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: We really loved the cookery class. I love cooking and enjoyed the useful knowledge about cooking with a tagine. We ate our own dish which was delicious and gave us a goody bag to go. Very tasty and could compare other food we ate in various places around town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Maison Arabe is a lovely hotel in a good location for getting into the souks Majorelle Garden and the local sights in the centre. We did the cookery class with Hamid which was excellent thank you for the free gift! Well worth visiting the country club on the free shuttle bus only for hotel guests and a short drive away if you want a break from the city bustle. Initially we were allocated a room which wasn’t what we’d booked but this was quickly fixed staff were really friendly and helpful. Loved the history of the hotel Churchill and Jackie Kennedy have stayed here. Would definitely recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rich B wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Outstanding experience in a wonderful hotel
Review_Text: My wife and I visited Marrkech for the first time recently (we are from California in the US) and stayed at La Maison Arabe and we had a fantastic experience. Lovely hotel with wonderful helpful staff and a really excellent restaurant. Our room was spacious and beautiful the entire hotel was also. The location was just right - within the walls of the old city walking distance to the Souks and the market square but far enough away and down a side street to have peace & quiet. Highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Katie R wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: The most magical hotel the staff amazing the setting  Wonderful the log fire in the bedroom and of course  The Cookery School will be returning this year .  The swimming pool was lovely before breakfast  And the hotel resteraunt was great we ask took advantage of room service  Found the piano Bar  Great cocktails a wonderful time .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Hadn’t been to Marrakech for 15 years and wanted to return with our kids (aged 12 and 9).    Had a royal suite which was perfect with the kids and the sitting room on the ground floor had been turned into a lovely little bedroom. Room was exquisitely furnished and bathrooms were stunning. Outdoor terrace with bath was spectacular.    Little swimming pool in the hotel patio was beautifully warmed so was very usable even in cold weather. Country club was a lovely trip one afternoon even if the pool was as bracing as a glacier!    Guides and cabs organised by the charming staff were all great location is idea for taxis to the new town or to walk to the medina. Lovely little neighbourhood very local and vibrant but with no hassle at all.    Dinner in the restaurant was traditional Moroccan fare and was very well done the piano bar felt like something from the 1940s and was fantastic for a nightcap. Breakfast was probably the only very mild disappointment. Not quite to the standard of the rest of the hotel all felt a bit crammed and lots of lukewarm non-labelled food. OK though.    Spa was fantastic and we had great massages. Overall nothing too much trouble for the staff we felt brilliantly looked after and the kids loved our short stay.    Look no further this is the best place in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Ari G wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Stay here and have an amazing trip!
Review_Text: Not only is this an absolutely beautiful location near just about everything you will want to see but the staff is top notch! I could not suggest anything that would make it better. Great food wonderful spa and the welcome drink of pineapple juice ginger lemon and mint is to die for. The piano bar was a wonderful way to end the day. The cooking classes rounded out the stay and changed our home cooking forever. I can't say thank you enough for everything they did to make our trip the best it could be.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Valerie i wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Fabulous location for a city break
Review_Text: We had an amazing time in La Maison Arabe. We were a party of 2 adults plus 3 children and we stayed in 2 x Standard Suite Pasha Side which was not in the main Hotel/Riad but in the building opposite. The entrance to our building was about 10 meters from the main Hotel/Riad entrance and it had it's own front desk which was manned 24/7. While I would have preferred to have been in the main building this building was very quiet and peaceful.    We booked directly with the hotel for the best deal.  All the staff we encountered from booking to check-out were extremely friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble from organizing taxis guides recommending restaurants etc    The location is great for exploring the Medina.  We visited the country club one afternoon using the free shuttle and it was a great place to relax and have a late lunch. The pool there was not heated though which would be my only complaint.  We did their cookery class which was good fun and I would say suitable for anyone from aged 11/12 upwards.  We also enjoyed using the Spa.    All in all its a lovely hotel and is perfect for exploring the old town and getting the most out of a city break to Marrakesh. I would recommend it to anyone planning a trip.

Review_Title: Fantastic luxury riad in the middle of the old town
Review_Text: La Maison Arabe is a very beautiful hotel very well located and with an excellent service. The hotel staff was very attentive and always with a smile on their faces. The room was spacious and well decorated. In the Spa you can take a massage perfect to relax after an intense day walking the Medina and the food at the restaurant was delicious. Highly recommended!

Review_Date: Shirley Z wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: This is a shockingly beautiful riad. It's one of the larger ones and it's just amazing exploring all the nooks and crannies of this place. All are beautifully decorated and the attention to detail is amazing. The rooms is super comfortable the staff very attentive. The cooking class was also really great experience.

Review_Date: Ali B wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: We had the most amazing time. The hotel is beautiful the staff are so friendly and helpful. We enjoyed sunbathing on the roof top terrace and swimming in the heated pool. The country house was a fantastic surprise - after wandering around the souk with a guide that the hotel organised we hopped on the free shuttle bus from the hotel and relaxed in the shade. The restaurant and staff were super an excellent range of authentic food - we also spent a morning in the cookery school learning how to cook with a tagine. Special memories we’ll be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christine T wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Excellent Riad - do book you won’t be disappointed
Review_Text: This is a really lovely Riad. We just booked a basic room but it was beautiful and actually had a rooftop terrace for just our room and a couple of others. We used the terrace each evening and were generally the only ones there. The breakfasts were very varied with all you could wish for and we loved the free afternoon mint tea and pastries every day! In the early evenings exempted a gin and tonic in the Jazz bar which had pianists playing and a really lovely atmosphere. We felt that all of the staff would go that bit extra for you - helping us with change taxis and suggestions for our enjoyment. We would definitely come back and stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Phillip D wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: I stayed here for 5 nights with my wife and did the 3 hour Moroccan cooking class and had the 45 minutes hammam treatment and 45 minutes massage which were all excellent. There was a wide selection of different foods for breakfast the cakes and pastries were especially good. The hospitality of the staff was brilliant everyone was so friendly. Special mention to Mourad on reception who couldn't do enough to help us. Only negatives were that I could hear the prayers from the local mosque quite clearly and our room in the douiria was quite small so would suggest staying in the main hotel if you like plenty of space.

We stayed in the hotel for two nights before we headed back home. The room was amazingly big and the decor was impressive. The restaurant was above our expectation and the service was equivalent to a 5 star hotel here. They served free afternoon tea with small snacks. Overall the Royal treatment by the staff was unforgettable.

Review_Date: Colin Q wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: The hotel lived up to expectations and the staff surpassed them!
Review_Text: Stayed for 3 night's with my wife. The Hotel is really good and the restaurant was excellent but on the pricey side. 3 course meal for 2 with a decent bottle of wine will set you back £150 approx. The Hotel is known for its food and so I signed up for a 3hr Cookery Class. It was fantastic Wafa was a great host very friendly knowledgeable and spoke good English. Fatima the Chef with her beaming smile and relaxed approach (No Gordon Ramsey type rants from her!) Was an excellent tutor. I prepared a Chicken Tagine with an Aubergine Salad and another salad made with Harissa. I also made a type of Bread called Bakbout and a desert called Pastilla (similar to Mille Feuille. I had lots of explanation of the culture and importance of food in Marrakech plus information on all the different spices. This was followed by a tea demonstration from Sukina and again it was very good. The 3 hours passed very quickly and then I got to sample my 3 course meal with my wife. I thoroughly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Inny Lyn wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: La Maison Arabe Marrakech was an amazing experience. We learned about that history of Moroccan food cooked and ate and laughed! Wafa and her team of strong women were amazing! Would definitely recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My stay at La Maison Arabe was only spoilt by the fact that it was just too short!! I was treated like Royalty during my visit and was upgraded to the most incredibly luxurious Suite - such a generous and wonderful surprise from the fabulously welcoming Reception team!  The entire staff at the hotel went out of their way to make every moment so special and memorable during my short stay!  The cuisine was superb - a gourmet dining and breakfast experience in the most beautiful surroundings.  I cannot recommend this hotel enough and will be doing so to everyone I know in London.  I will most certainly be returning very soon although next time for longer!  Thanks so much to everyone at La Maison Arabe!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: I came here to do a 3 hour cookery class. I can honestly say it was AMAZING. First we learned about history of food culture spices and tea. Then we (7 of us) got to see a few demonstrations before we set to work making 3 different dishes. The work stations we used were very extremely modern and clean. There were video screens so we could each see close ups very clearly. Then after we'd made our delicious dishes we sat down to eat them together. This is really not to be missed. Informative very friendly and SUCH GREAT FUN. Loved it. Shukran Wafa and Fatima. Definitely a huge highlight of my stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Richard Rees-Davies wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Wow. Just stayed for 4 days at this magical luxury Riad.    Location: Perfect. In the heart of the city - a hidden oasis    Room: Clean; traditional; well equipped; QUIET    Relaxing: Stunning restaurant amazing spa relaxing solarium and hidden roof terrace. And the Jazz bar is just gorgeous    Staff: The team could not have been better! Attentive caring and personal in their approach. Made me feel like a very special guest and Raja & Hakim were just fantastic    Value for money? YES YES YES    I’ll be back! I’d happily live there!    Richard
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: An absolutely amazing experience. Unlike any other hotel I visited in Marrakech this warm authentic and charming riad exudes old-world class and grace from the moment you walk through the front door. La Maison Arabe is in a perfect location just a few minutes walk to the souks main square and Koutoubia Mosque. Breakfast is abundant and delicious the spa is quiet and delightful and the rooms are clean spacious and beautifully appointed. What really sets La Maison Arabe apart however is the hotels's extraordinary personnel from the bartenders at The Jazz Bar to the the entire dining staff who greet you every day with a smile and simply cannot do enough to make your experience memorable. And last but not least kudos to all my friends at the front desk especially Mourad and Raja who responded effortlessly with every request and made me feel like I was part of the family. My advice: Don't even think about staying anywhere else!

This is one of the best hotel's I have ever stayed in my life....  Where do I begin...    The staff is super friendly and nice...    The Hotel director M/s Nabila Dakir went out of her way to make us very comfortable. Her team members Mr. Mourad Mr. Yassine and Mr Abdel Hakim were equally friendly and made our stay super memorable.    I would not even entertain the idea of staying at any other place if one wants to get the true flavor of niceness" and amazing hospitality in Morocco...    Thank you so very much!!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Kerry K wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Loved our cooking class.  Delicious food and so much fun !  Staff very welcoming and informative as they made our class all hands on !  They even made as we watched a few extra dishes - wonderful bread and potatoes  After we finishes cooking everything was served at a wonderful dining area!  All wonderful

Review_Date: Kendra W wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: This was another recommendation of Jana from Your Morocco Tour and we are glad we gone with it . This riad is beautiful  located practically in the Medina  large beautiful suites and even a swimming pool which is rare for Marrakech riads. We loved our stay and recommend it

Review_Date: Michael H wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Great service beautiful rooms and great location. I would highly recommend this hotel. It also has a great spa and restaurant. The location is great in that it is in a quiet spot but a short walk to the market and the main square.

Review_Date: Max M wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Our stay at Maison Arabe was fantastic. The hotel itself is a beautiful series of riads (homes with central courtyards) which have been connected. The room restaurant and pool are exquisite. The hotel came recommended by our guide and we stayed 5 nights at the end of our honeymoon. Each hotel was more fabulous than the last but Maison Arabe was particularly awesome. While the hotel is gorgeous and intimate the real highlight is the staff. Three in particular deserve praise: the manager Yassin is charming and attentive. Whenever we had a question or a specific need Yassin was just ‘there’ like magic. If I were in the hospitality business I’d ask him to name his price! Said who is chief bartender at ‘Le Club’ (the jazz bar) was wonderful. His cocktails are delicious and unique. He’s also a fascinating and engaging person. Said entertained my wife and I endlessly and even helped us with our Arabic! Finally Abdellah our waiter made us feel very special (to say nothing of the excellent food at the restaurant). Excellent sense of humor! All said Maison Arabe is an oasis of peace in the bustle of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff was excellent! We were greeted with smiles and checking in was quick. The room was exquisite. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom spacious. We didn’t get a chance to visit their other pool and gardens. The location was perfect! Breakfast was more than generous. It was a great stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kari D wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: My family of 5 loved La Maison Arabe! It was a perfect home base for us in Marrekesh for 4 days. We had a deluxe room and a standard suite for our 3 kids (older teenagers). Both rooms were lovely. The suite was especially nice because the 3rd bed was in its own little niche so it wasn't so crowded in the main space. Rooms were good-sized and clean. Beds were very comfortable with soft sheets. Bathroom was nice - clean spacious and good products with fluffy towels. I have read a few comments about the hot water - we had no problem at all. Plenty of hot water and good water pressure (weak water pressure is a pet peeve of mine).    The hotel itself is very unique & charming with lots of different areas to explore. The bar was old-school with dim lights and dark furniture. We loved going there after a day of exploring for a drink and some delicious appetizers. Breakfast by the pool was lovely - good coffee and eggs made to order. My kids say there was a pancake station. Plus the usual Moroccan buffet. We only ate dinner there one night and it was fabulous. Food delicious and excellent service.    The location of La Maison Arabe is in my opinion perfect. Technically it's "inside" the medina. I will be honest...I was hesitant about that at first. Our first stop in Morocco was Fes and one night we had dinner at a lovely riad in the medina. But it was pretty deep in and seemed sort of...inconvenient for more than a dinner. In contrast La Maison Arabe is about a block or so into the medina so you can indeed walk out the door and head further in to the stalls and reach the main square easily. But it's also near enough to a street that if you are dropped off by a taxi you don't have to hike in the dark for several blocks. It was ideal. The best of both worlds.    The staff was excellent. Front desk always had warm greetings and very helpful with questions. Restaurant staff very efficient. Housekeeping responded quickly to our request for more bottled water & the room always very tidy when we returned after a day out.    We did not take advantage of any of the spa services or cooking school simply because we didn't have time. There is so much to see and do in Marrakesh.    I would recommend La Maison Arabe to anyone with no hesitation. It is a real gem in Marrakesh the perfect blend of old-school charm and modern comfort!

Review_Date: Ronit S wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Excellent hotel and top quality service
Review_Text: We had an amazing stay at this hotel. The riad style (Morrocan-style house and courtyard) makes for a truly authentic experience. It is beautifully decorated and the location is excellent with easy walking access to the shouk and center. The restaurant is delicious and we also took a cooking class which was an amazing experience. The service and attention was incredible. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Natalie P wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Excellent hotel. The rooms were great with tasteful Moroccan decor a comfortable bed and a nice shower. The location was perfect. We were able to walk to many attractions. We enjoyed the piano bar. Staff members were professional and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just back from a week at this fabulous hotel. Stayed in a standard room which was of an excellent standard in terms of comfort cleanliness and location. We paid for a deal including breakfast which was great as choice of food was fantastic including a brilliant egg chef and local pancake lady. Definitely worth every penny. Had a couple of meals in the restaurant which was delicious.  Throughout our stay the level of service and friendliness was outstanding - better than pretty much any other hotel I’ve stayed in.  Location fantastic - turn right out of door and the main square and soukhs are a short walk away turn left and the new town area is equal distance.  I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel - and if you’re going to Marrakesh I honestly don’t think you could do better.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis in a bustling Medina
Review_Text: The hotel is an oasis in a bustling Medina. Located down an alley we were welcomed and well taken care of every step of the way. The staff is excellent. If you want an authentic interesting experience I highly recommend this riad.

The wonderful instructors at La Maison Arabe were informative and fun. It was such a pleasure to learn about the history spices and techniques used in traditional Moroccan cooking and then implementing those techniques to make a delicious meal which we ate at the end of our class. Enjoying the fruits of one’s labors and sharing it with others can be very gratifying. We would like to thank Wafa our workshop coordinator and also Soukaima and Kauter who showed us the techniques. They were wonderful to work with.  A shout out to Abercrombie and Kent for making this experience possible. They created a lifetime of great memories for us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: La Maison Árabe is a fabulous hotel with amazing service. It is managed by the best hotel manager in Marrakech maybe in Morocco Mrs Nabila! The restaurant food is exquisite the service is great and one gets the real Moroccan experience of staying in a Riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris B wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: We loved our stay at Maison Arabe. Staff were helpful and accommodating. Shower was excellent. Breakfast was delicious- Moroccan pancakes are a must! We would thoroughly recommend the Maison Arabe! Best place in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My family and I had a great time learning about Moroccan cuisine smelling the spices pouring the tea and cooking fish tagine moufleta taktouka and milk bastilla. It was a highlight of our trip. The chefs were very accommodating with our dietary needs. Delish!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We would like to warmheartedly thank all team members at La Maison Arabe in particular the front desk personnel (Mousad Rajaa Hakim Ismail Youssef and Idiss) for an awesome stay. My partner and I (we are a same sex couple) were treated by each of them like family. We stayed in Marrakech a total of 6 nights (5 nights at La Maison Arabe and 1 night at the Royal Mansour). We found the service at La Maison Arabe to be more intuitive and warm than at the Royal Mansour. We are looking forward to our next stay. Good job!

Review_Date: Sophie B wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: My family and I are staying in Marrakesh. Today we did a cooking class which was amazing. The people were lovely and truly so passionate about their work and love of others. We learned all about the history of the dishes we were making. Our chefs were Wafa and Habibi they were amazing. Being around them all you can do is smile. And on top of all of that the food was DELICIOUS. Truly I have been to my gate share of good restaurants and this was amazing. And I made it myself. They send you home with the recipes that you cooked. And a gift… which you will see when you go. All in all you should definitely consider going to this cooking class the grounds and kitchen are beyond beautiful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Allison B wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: You DO NOT WANT TO MISS THIS!!
Review_Text: My family and I did a private Moroccan Food Cooking Class. It was an INCREDIBLE experience. Absolutely FANTASTIC! Wafa and Habibi were our instructors and couldn’t have been kinder/nicer and more hospitable! We were taught all about the history of Moroccan food and it’s influences in a BEAUTIFUL setting w gardens and a traditional Moroccan kitchen where we all had our own stations to work at. We had delicious tea and then went on to cook and eat a traditional vegetable soup two salads tagine and desert. The food was incredible and the experience was outstanding! I would HIGHLY recommend this as it was a highlight of our trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Nicolette N wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Amazing! Beautiful and the most friendly staff - I will definitely be coming back. I was also amazed that the cooking workshop and the massage I received were one of the best! I will absolutely be coming back here again in the near future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: After a very disappointing night in a Riad my wife and I wanted to find somewhere else to spend our last night in Morocco.    After a bit of research we found La Maison Arabe and went to have lunch there and check it out. We booked a room there and then and had a perfect 24 hours.    We had an excellent room good food and fantastically welcoming friendly and attentive staff. Nothing was too much trouble.    We are very much hoping to come back and would definitely book into La Maison Arabe for longer next time.    Highly recommended.

Review_Date: larry E wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Had the pleasure of staying here with my family and all I can say is WOW.  An absolutely amazing place with the best staff everyone made us feel so welcomed the service is by far one of the best I have ever experienced from any of the finest five star hotel I have stayed at.  I highly recommend the Hammam after a long day walking around the city This was a absolute gem.  To all the hotel staff and management please what ever you do  Do not change the way you treat guests all of you are unbelievable and made our stay such a wonderful experience.  Thank you !!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Amazing start to finish from the warm welcome...to the impeccable service....amazing surroundings suite spa and cuisine. A total gem. We will be back. A huge thank you to all the team for making our stay so special. David and Tracey
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Enrique M wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: The hotel is gorgeous upscale yet still maintaining the feel of a riad. Compare to other hotels/riads it might be a bit more expensive but the price quality you get from this hotel is fenomenal. The staff is super friendly and helpful and the location is incredible. If I ever go back to Marrakech I will deferentially stay again in this hotel.

Review_Date: Vince L wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Luxurious stay and made me feel like a royalty! I had a two night stay and it was a bliss. Obviously the prices here including the food dinner spa and etc. adheres to the luxury label of the hotel but it's all worth it. The spa is wonderful and had the best hammam/massage. The dinner is amazing while the breakfast buffet is one of the best I've had.    The service is what really counts and they really made sure I'm perfectly well and pampered and all attained to my needs. Will definitely come back for more days! 2 nights aren't enough.

Review_Date: Paul R wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: My wife and I have stayed in 5 star hotels around the world and this one ties with the Four Seasons Bora Bora as our favourite place. It is charming  elegant and luxurious. The staff really bring this hotel up to the next level of service. The restaurant excels in local dishes done with perfection. My wife loved the spa and some sort of treatment I didn’t follow but she was ecstatic. The cooking school is the perfect was to understand the culture  traditions and spices. And bonus there’s a private club with pool and off shoot of. cooking school.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were here five years ago and may our memory failed us but this time (5 couples) we all found the cleaning very sub standard the carpets all need changing the toiletries were awful water went from hot to cold to steaming so irritating but also annoyingly it must operate on low voltage so hard to charge the phone and my Apple Watch couldn’t charge at all. Internet patchy. We can live with all that but not with not being super clean with super service at £400 a night. Just not right. They said they had a new wing but why would they not put us there then? They also need Organization and better management. Hotel is finally quite noisy. Location is great and staff nice. Breakfast need upgrading in quality not in volume.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We were on a private tour with Youssef of Morocco Expert Tours. He booked La Maison Arabe as our riad in Marrakech. What an excellent choice! The riad is exquisite with stunning Moroccan decor. The rooms have all the modern amenities. We ate dinner twice in the gorgeous indoor/outdoor dining room. The menu is diverse with traditional Moroccan as well as western dishes. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The riad is about 10-15 minutes walk from the main square for shopping. I wish we had stayed longer I would have loved to try their hamman.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Tara F wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: Traditional & beautiful boutique hotel situated in a perfect location
Review_Text: So happy we chose this over other more modern hotels and those further out of town.    A very traditional charming and historic boutique hotel situated inside the medina but close enough to walk to the modern parts of the city.    We booked a regular suite with access to a forecourt but got upgraded to the three storey Chem suite which was fabulous with a private rooftop terrace complete with a cabana & jacuzzi. It also gave us the convenience of two bathrooms and a huge living room.    The hotel itself has lots of beautiful space nooks crannies and historic artefacts so be sure to explore.    We tried the pool side Trios restaurant which serves a fusion so there should something for everyone on the menu. On the pricey side portions aren’t that generous and a bit too quite out of season to hat we felt we had to whisper. And there are similar restaurants nearby but you cannot take away from the convenience and tranquility of being by the stunning pool area and the menus light up so no need to use your phone torch which is par for the course in many places in Marrakesh.    The reception staff are extremely polite and efficient and offer good advice when it comes to navigating the medina. They will also offer a guide if you’re not confident exploring the medina alone.    However our suite is not recommended if you’re unsteady on your feet or have arthritis as the stairs are pretty steep. My knees were creaking after a day out walking the city. The shower and tap water are also a little temperamental going from very hot to cold in the shower and had some warm toothbrushing with all taps running hot. And okay some of the bedroom decor is a bit worn tricky to open a wardrobe a huge lamp bizarrely blocking the TV but it all sort of added to the charm of the place. Although don’t expect a very early quiet night as the hotel is echoey so you can often hear noise from other rooms and the reception.    But overall for the price location amenities & ambiance we’d not choose anywhere else. Next time I’d definitely take advantage of the hammam & spa treatments.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: sharl l wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: I’d give a 7 out of 5 if possible  This is the most spectacular hotel and room we’ve ever stayed in anywhere in the world! Our room is staggering. We have the entire floor including a balcony with chaise lounges and covered canopy. There’s a living room with fireplace and desk. Wine with crystal glasses as well as water in silver tumbler. The bedroom is out of a movie and the bathroom could be in a design magazine. Carved wood walls and a walk in closet built larger than most homes in Canada. The hotel is a maze- think Harry Potter meets Aladdin with intriguing nooks and cranny’s everywhere. The restaurant offers fine dining at reasonable prices. Did I mention the cooking classes? Omg! And there a spa that’s just WOW! Oh and happy hour in the courtyard.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Small cookery class in a 5* hotel.
Review_Text: We discovered that this 5* hotel offered cookery classes when one of my friends visited it several years ago for some mint tea so we booked it. The class was brilliant with the cookery demonstrator Houda and the workshops manager and interpreter Simo both being exceptional. We watched flatbreads being baked in a wood oven and drank mint tea while Simo explained how the day would progress. Off to the kitchen to meet Houda and bake some cookies before getting down to business. Everything was really well organised and explained and help was on hand while we cooked the chicken and lemon tagine a hot tomato salad and an aubergine salad. There were 4 of us so easy to watch the cook and easy to get help if necessary. We learned how to make flowers from the tomato skin - a case of waste not want not? Anyhow it was illuminating as I’d never managed to make flowers successfully before. We then got to eat what we’d prepared as well as a dessert and some of the cookies. It was a fabulous 5 hours or so made extra special when we were given a tagine dish and the recipe cards to take away. I would highly recommend this experience to anyone who has an interest in cooking and enjoys spiced and seasoned food.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Roxa N wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Excellent hotel with a really cool history and phenomenal staff. We booked a suite which was nice and spacious and the decor was wonderful. The only ding is that both of our rugs would definitely benefit from a deep cleaning (not just vacuuming). Other than that this place was a lovely oasis in the medina and the breakfast was unbelievably good. We'd definitely stay again.

This is an amazing place in central Marrakech. Nothing was too much trouble. Room and restaurant were superb. One to stay at if you are in Marrakech! Haman was very good and the cooking class was one we would repeat again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Yotum A wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: A beautiful stay with unparalleled Moroccan hospitality and the best food in Marrakech
Review_Text: My stay here was a dream. There’s a spirit of generosity and hospitality here I’ve not encountered anywhere else. The riad was built in the 1930’s and I couldn’t help but be swept away by the hotel’s history - oh the things and people it has seen! I made sure to venture out to eat hit the top spots recommended by Trip Advisor but at the end of the day the best food I had was right here in the hotel.  I had a blissful Hammam/massage experience here ten out of ten and had a blast in the cooking class they offered. I’m usually an Airbnber but this is one experience I’m so glad I went for. Thank you La Maison Arabe for bringing such care and kindness to the art of hospitality.

very good hotel at the marrakech medina 10 minutes walk from jemaa el fna square.    i had booked a standard room but was upgraded to the royal suite which was superb. thee floors with luxurious decor: low floor was an impressive living room with a fully equiped bathroom with jacuzzi sofas large tv... second floor was the bedroom with a king size very comfortable bed under a wooden ceiling coffered a large tv a full bathroom. third floor was a large courtyard with a big jacuzzi and deck charis and small garden.    we had very good bathrobes and excellent towels slippersa nespresso coffe maker ipad dock large wardrobes a good safe box free water and a complimentary blottle of moroccan wine.    lightning was good. soundproofing could improve: noises from the corridor were heard.    the tv channels selectin could improve (no channels in spanish).    the staff was professional and very polite.    the free wifi was good.    the swimming pool by the restaurant was very nice.    the spa was small but the hamman services were excellent.    the restaurant was very good and the breakfast buffet excellent.    the room service offered all the restaurant menu and came very fast.    complimentary tea was offered all the afternoons.    the music bar was very pleasant at the evenings.    i did not use the small business centre.    the prices for drinks and food were reasonable.    all in ll an excellent experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Toni T wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: We had a lovely stay at La Maison Arabe and would not hesitate to recommend this riad to future guests. The location was superb. The staff were excellent and accommodation very comfortable. The restaurants offered a good choice of food to cater for all tastes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anna R wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Highly recommended beautiful riad in the heart of Marrakesh!
Review_Text: Beautiful riad in the heart of Marrakesh. Staff all very welcoming and friendly and helped us everyday with booking/confirming tours guides and taxis. The location was perfect for us as it could be accessed by car but was also only an 10 min walk from the main square.  Our room was in a beautiful internal courtyard with stained glass windows. There was also a lovely spa and amazing cookery class offered by the hotel.  Highly recommended for first time travellers to Marrakesh who want a lovely base from which to relax and explore!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Julia Kerr Henkel wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: A truly authentic Moroccan hotel with beautiful rooms courtyard tea areas bar and restaurant. I didn't get to the hammam but wish I had - the space is magnificent and felt very private and intimate. The pool area is picturesque although loungers are on a different level. A bonus is this hotel is within walking distance of one of the main entrances into the medina (souk/market area) which was useful.

This hotel is a gem. It is restored tradition architecture and design. Each room is different and charming.  The towels were amazingly soft.  The jazz bar is cool.  The restaurant is good; included breakfast is great.  The spa is gorgeous!  The location is decent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Rob Z wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel combining multiple Riads in the heart of the City. Character +++.  First rate amenities including jazz bar and restaurants. Cooking school was incredible with very nice cooking stations and amazing chefs. The staff was very friendly and the level of service was as good as it could be.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kristen B wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Love this riad. It is gorgeous well appointed and located in a perfect spot. What really makes this place special though is the staff. They are amazing. Such incredible service. They went out of their way to ensure a great stay and we appreciated them very much!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Enjoyed very much the cooking class literally felt like a chef we then ate the food we made was amazing and yummy I didn't know I had being a cook in me ;D the staff was very knowledgeable they knew how to speak many languages and history and origins of herbs and spices and Moroccan cuisine. Very recommended experience 👌
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: joanne R wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Lovely protected garden setting delicious food with an interesting menu traditional and Mediterranean. Top talent music throughout the evening. Definitely high end but not exorbitant. Our waiter could not have been nicer

The staff at this Riyadh La Maison Arabe compliments the relaxing atmosphere you will experience at this location. The waiting staff at the restaurant are extremely attentive. Amin Fatiha and others on the staff have been exceptional. Thank you all for your care.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ranna A wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Best thing you can do amazing experience and Hamid was a great addition as a translators and wonderful helper with a great smile 😊…  This class is a must and you get a special gift…the information that you learn is a gem…Hope you get Hamid if you go!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Where do I start!?? This place is EXQUISITE!!! The maison the decor the experiences….AMAZING!!    We took the cooking class and it was the most informative empowering and loving experience. Waffa and all the chefs were so informative and fabulous teachers!! Who knew I could make Moroccan food and it be delicious!!  The chefs create such a fun loving and bonding experience all while you cook. It was one of my favorite experiences while in Marrakech.    Soukaina gave us a great tour! We also had lunch visited the Jazz club and most especially had the Hammam experience at La Maison Arabe. No words can describe how fabulous this treatment is. It was life changing. I was reminded that I’m a Queen and was treated like one. It is the most beautiful spa ever I’ve ever seen.    I loved all the staff there. So sweet welcoming and professional. Can’t wait to go back and visit everyone again!💕
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Would give them 6 stars if we could.  Room was quite large and comfortable  with a lovely balcony overlooking the  pool. Public rooms are extensive. Staff  couldn't have been more helpful...at  checking checkout and mealtimes.  Excellent spa facility. Fabulous meals...  both breakfast and dinner. Great bar.  Super location. Easy choice for lodging  in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for 5 nights. We had an issue with our initial room but Abdil was very customer orientated and came to our rescue and did a great job by taking care of the room situation. The food is very good and so is the breakfast. Lots of variety. The hotel is close to almost everything you need or want to do in Marrakech. We had a hammam at this hotel and it was bliss. The hotel has a shuttle bus that takes you to a resort that's roughly 15 minutes away where it has a beautiful pool and great service. You can order lunch and drinks here. It was very relaxing and peaceful. We also participated in a cooking class which was excellent. We did a tour of the medina on our first day through the hotel and the tour guide was great. Would definitely recommend!!!

Review_Date: Megan O wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: La Maison Arabe is an incredible riad and escape from the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh! The riad is stunning and each room is a safe haven (we had 2 different rooms due to our travel plans). Being the first riad in Marrakesh gives it an authentic magic. The jazz bar with the live pianist is a perfect way to slow down and unwind the tea foyer is a great spot to take a break and relax and the restaurants are delicious! The spa was amazing and I highly recommend a hammam/massage here. We also took a cooking class here that was so fun and special. But what stands above everything was the staff! They were so welcoming and attentive. Every time we walked through the reception area we greeted with warm smiles and hellos. They are extremely helpful with any questions/needs whether it’s storing your bags navigating the city or just welcoming you back from being out. This is the spot to stay at in Marrakesh for an authentic riad experience that feels like home!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We cannot recommend La Maison Arabe too highly. Down a narrow passage off the road stepping into it is like stepping into an oasis of calm and tranquillity after the madness and chaos of the souks of Marrakesh.  A labyrinth of intimate cosy spaces leading off from the central courtyard each decorated in the Moorish tradition and carefully lit to bring out the best of the rich colours and textures. The cosy lounge area has a large picture of Sir Winston Churchill who was regular guest. The jazz bar has music as befits its name.  Everywhere is immaculately cared for and maintained.  Our room was on the compact side and the suitcases easily got in the way. But the room itself was very good and the bed super-comfortable.  One small problem was that the bathroom was up an unguarded flight of steps which needed careful negotiation with a torch in the dark to avoid an accident. The windows looked out over the central courtyard and let in lots of natural light.  The restaurant and pool were in the newer part of the Riad with tables also set among some small trees and along the side of the pool. Lit by candlelight it was lovely. The restaurant itself was beautiful with rich wood panelling and carefully lit to create the right atmosphere.  The food was excellent the service likewise. Surely the largest breakfast menu we had during our stay in Morocco and beautifully presented.  The staff were excellent nothing was too much trouble. A small complaint we did have was swiftly attended to.  If you should tire of the restaurant food then you can try your own hand at cooking dinner in the cookery school belonging to the hotel. Unsure of what to expect we were very impressed by the very modern cookery area and the tuition on offer. However they do make sure you don't fail which is a relief.....  Then together with your fellow "chefs" and a good glass of wine eat what you have made downstairs in the dining area. A great and fun experience.  La Maison Arabe is a first-class address in Marrakesh!

We travel a lot with kids (7&12) and never comprise on quality. We were not dissapointed here :-) Very kind and helpfull hotel team. Good location just 5 min walk to the center of the Medina. Good breakfast and dinner. Loverly with a cool pool. And dont forget to spend an afternoon in the hotels garden/pool just 15 minutes drive away.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Amazing stay at La Maison Arabe
Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 day’s on our first visit to marrakesh. We traveled with our two children 7 and 12 years old and stayed in the royal suite highly recommended. Big thanks to Everyone around at the hotel for giving us an amazing trip. Always ready to help.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Phil S wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: La Maison Arabe is a wonderful hotel and its location in Marrakech is perfect The management and staff provide the highest quality of service! The rooms are very comfortable and the public spaces are beautifully furnished in Moroccan style. The restaurant garden is a great place to enjoy a delicious meal. We loved the unique tasty breakfast buffet and the Moroccan dishes at dinner. We loved our stay at the riad.  Philip and Ellen Stout
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jane S wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Lovely hotel within the Medina a tranquil oasis away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Great location for all the sights all walking distance and of course the souks. Very friendly staff extremely helpful and attentive. Excellent room very comfortable bed plenty of hanging space and lovely bathroom.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Myself and 13 other ladies stayed at La Maison Arabe in October 2022. Everything about this place was fabulous. The cleanliness of the hotel and rooms the exquisite décor the beautiful public areas to relax and unwind fabulous dining and the exceptional service. The staff are polite friendly and very attentive.

Could not recommend this hotel more highly. It has history and charm but more importantly it is run by Adil and his passionate team. This team effort and obvious enthusiasm sets it apart from other hotels and riad's in Marrakesh. Close to the media  with excellent Spa and world class cooking school.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A wonder for all the senses.
Review_Text: Stepping into La Maison Arabe is like stepping into Aladin's cave one treasure followed by another. Each room is unique and beautifully decorated and appointed. We were delighted with our private little courtyard for late afternoon cocktails. From our delicious and refreshing welcome drinks (very welcomed) to any and every request being fulfilled the staff were helpful and gracious. The spa and hammam were huge hits with several of the group booking multiple and repeat treatments. The dinner selection was wonderful and each meal was out of this world delicious. Breakfast had a large selection of almost everything immaginable.    The location is a short walk to the medina and very central to the highlights of Marrakech.    Word of caution like many riads in the medina there are lots of stairs and winding staircases. We got lost more than once but even a wrong turn was fun.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: sharon f wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: From the minute we were greeted at reception in a most opulent setting we knew we had chosen a very special place for our 2 nights in Marrakech. Our 2 suites were immaculate spacious and well appointed with a lovely view of the swimming pool and courtyard. We enjoyed the beautifully presented breakfast buffet situated in the courtyard near the pool. The dining room for dinner was absolutely breathtaking the service and food was exceptional including the delicious mango sorbet!  This is the only place to stay when you come to Marrakech!

Review_Date: Matthias O wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Outstanding residing in a historical palace, an architecure-artwork.
Review_Text: La Maison Arabe asked me to write a review about their house. I am happy to comply.    To say it's just a historic riad would not do it enough credit. It is truly a venerable architectural work of art right in the centre close to the souk alleys a hidden gem. There is also modern technology in the house the wifi is absolutely stable flat screen in the room but if you are looking for minimalist contemporary furnishings this is not the place for you. This riad has aged gracefully and wants you to continue to see its age. Nevertheless everything has been neatly restored. The staff place a very high value on cleanliness. Even under the carpet tables they are always wiped. Of course every now and then there can be a small mistake a little something can be forgotten. But with this stay I didn't notice anything.    First of all the gastronomy. If you're looking for star cuisine with the last haut-cuisine invention you should go somewhere else. But if you're looking for really good quality lovingly prepared food that doesn't have to hide from other big restaurants this is the place to go. For example we had spicy grilled prawns with a kind of red curry as a starter and "pineapple salad" as a side dish and the beef tajine (really outstanding) as a main course in its broth caramelised almonds and dried fruits. The other dishes at the neighbouring tables also looked very tasty. And you should not be afraid of Moroccan wine e.g. Chateau Roslane they are good even if not top world wines. Here I would have liked more experience from the staff also because I asked. Here I would also like to see more courage from La Maison Arabe. Are there special wineries with special vintages that one should have drunk? Here I would have been willing to pay more money. But perhaps as a wine lover and collector that is asking too much. I used to talk to Sommeliers. I am complaining on a too high level. And please with the temperatures in Marrakech always order a wine sleeve even with the red wine. Our wine was well tempered.  The breakfast is really okay no…. it is really very good; the pouched egg was perfectly prepared. You can find all the usual things at the breakfast buffet. It's very good quality the yoghurt homemade freshly made Moroccan crepes fresh juices. But somehow I felt the final touch was missing here the final icing on the cake. Because with this unique courtyard terrace by the pool if there was a spectacular buffet…. Maybe complaining on a very high level. Generally let me say…. You have a very good breakfast there.  The Jazz Bar give you a perfect finish nice piano playing and good classical drinks.    About the room. We had a suite. I don't think La Maison Arabe has too many rooms maybe 30 I think I read somewhere. It is a small boutique hotel. The bathrooms were classically elegant there are no modern minimalist bathrooms as we know them today. However the bathrooms are beautiful very well maintained (as if this classic furnishing had been installed only recently) and meticulously clean. Not a single smudge or fine hair was to be found. Otherwise our suite was typically Moroccan. It would be difficult to furnish it with modern furniture. In Europe not only the house would be listed as a heritage but also the rooms and their furnishings. Nevertheless it was very pleasant and cosy. The mattress and the bed linen. A dream from the Arabian Nights.    About the country club: definitely use it definitely go there. The drive is really not far. Forget the hustle and bustle of the old town for a few hours wash off the dust. You find there a nice pool in a lovely garden beside an old Moroccan manor house. Even the food there is fresh and delicious. We had a classic club sandwich which was with wholemeal toast and very tasty and the St. Pierre fish with an insanely delicious sauce. Again not star cuisine but excellent quality.    The hammam. I think we had the Royal Session which is a classic hammam scrub down masks and a 45-minute massage. My wife another anti-age care. It's worth every penny. Definitely try it. This is a traditional hammam not a sprawling bright spa temple. Not every last in-treatment every super-modern beauty session is included. But does it need to be? Everything important can be found and in good quality. And it is absolutely beautiful in this architectural building. This is how you imagine a luxurious hammam from the Arabian Nights. The staff are well trained and extremely courteous. Therefore a visit to this hammam should be a must.    About the staff: La Maison Arabe does not only try to provide a good service but they also really try to fulfil every wish if possible. The staff is discreet but always ready to help when needed. They are very nice and polite. You also notice that the staff are trained as is usual with such a house. Of course you can look for mistakes and you will always find some. It's not really relaxing is it? You can always improve. Just let me say it to you from a professional point of view (because I used to work in upscale hotels and restaurants myself as a young man learned it from the bottom up so to speak.)  Apart from French of course all the staff speak English and if they don't they immediately get another staff member who does. Also the staff really try their best. That is enough for me as a guest. I am not looking for perfection. I just want to have a pleasant relaxing stay. And her it was outstanding. You can observe that they try to be perfect so that you can have an unforgettable stay. What do you want more?    Therefore I can only say that La Maison Arabe was the right choice for 2 nights. It doesn't want to be super modern even if it has all the modern amenities. It just wants to be La Maison Arabe. A historical institution in Marrakech. A hidden palace close to the old souk alleys beautiful and absolutely central. Where you can experience ancient history where they try to do their best. There are always things to improve as I mentioned above but my wife and I were absolutely happy to stay here. La Maison Arabe also takes requests and reviews very seriously. Because they know what their responsibility is. If we were to travel to Marrakech again La Maison Arabe would be our first choice.

Review_Date: Joachim P wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Best service. I am traveling now for nearly 40 years. The service was simply not topable. Thanks for the wonderful experience. I would recommend to take the suite instead gab normal room. The investment is really worth because the jacuzzi and the patio is the perfect way for the pure Marrakech experience
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah R wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Our hotel concierge recommended Le Maison Arabe for dinner and we are glad he did. A short walk from our Riad we managed to get lost but two local friendly children soon showed us the way! Glad we found it as it was quite simply superb from start to finish every course was excellent and our first time trying Moroccan wine did not disappoint. Our server was excellent and made our evening very enjoyable would thoroughly recommend this excellent restaurant.

La Maison Arabe - a beautiful riad with fantastic customer service. From the moment we stepped into the riad we were greeted by the friendly staff and offered a delicious non-alcoholic drink. We were upgraded to a spectacular room with a balcony overlooking the garden pool and restaurants - such a pleasant surprise! The decor of the hotel is beautiful throughout. The food in the pool-side restaurant was perfect. Unfortunately we ran out of time and did not have an opportunity to experience the other restaurants but if the one we ate in was any indication... The staff were pleasant and very helpful. Thank you everyone at La Maison Arabe for making our stay such a wonderful experience!

Review_Date: Angela S wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: We absolutely loved our stay at La Maison Arabe.    When we first arrived the outside (like most in Morocco) didn't look like much but step inside and it is absolutely beautiful!    The staff without exception were so helpful and friendly. They knew guests by name and went out of their way to help.    We used the shuttle bus to visit their country club one day - definitely recommended. It was a beautiful oasis away from the bustle of the city.    The restaurant around the pool had a lovely atmosphere and great food. We also enjoyed nightly drinks in the cosy jazz bar.    Don't stay anywhere else if you visit Marrakech.

Review_Date: Richard K wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: We have just returned from a three week stay at La Maison Arabe - of which we cannot speak highly enough. We in turn were recommended it by friends who also appreciated the spotless housekeeping exceptional food magical hamman stunning decor proximity to places of interest and extremely helpful staff who suggested ideas to ensure we saw the best of Marrakech. Add to this a courtesy shuttle to take you at your request to the annexed Country Club and you have the recipe for a perfect holiday. Nothing was too much trouble - even when we arrived late at night they ensured we had something to eat. Thanks for you customer care throughout - it was much appreciated.

Review_Date: Mary D wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Title: Quality and class from start to finish.
Review_Text: Fantastic traditional Moroccan riad with the best quality everything and amazing staff througout. Big shout out to Yousef and Hakim on front of house and the fabulous ladies who looked after us so well at the poolside restaurant.  The food and wine were top quality the rooms were spacious and in keeping with the style of the hotel. There were lots of little extra touches to make our stay extra special. Quality and class from start to finish.

Review_Date: Med L wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: La Maison Arabe has a Nice atmosphere and authentic decoration that reflects the richness of the Moroccan culture it's definitely one of the best addresses in Marrakech Morocco.  I highly recommend it.

Review_Date: Fabienne W wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: We had such a memorable stay at La Madison Arabe. The rooms were spacious and clean and the service was best in class. We also enjoyed a romantic poolside dinner where there was live music and the most delicious salmon and lamb. The entire staff was kind and made us feel like we were the only guests at the hotel- paying attention to every detail. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We started our two week Moroccan advanture in Merrakesh and at La Maison Arabe. The few nights we stayed at this riad were beautiful. Located at the entrance to the medican made it quite easy to navigate our sightseeing during the day and return to a pleasant and quiet oasis. The team members were very friendly and accommodating. While I had one of the lower category rooms (since I was the single traveler in our group) the room was still extremely comfortable. The bed was comfortable and the shower pressure was great. The meals we had were wonderful. Breakfast was included in our room and was quite a delicious spread and able to eat outside poolside. The one group dinner we had was wonderful and delicious as well. The gym is very small and limited but I was able to locate a slightly bigger facility inside the medina and 10 minutes walking which was a good substitute. Would certainly stay at this place again.

Review_Date: Don K wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in the beginning of our trip in Morocco and should have stayed here at the end of our trip as well.    Upon arrival we not only received an upgrade of our room but also a bottle of wine and large bottle of water was included. Our room was large with good lighting and plenty of outlets for charging devices.    Everything about this riad was excellent. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was beyond excellent. Although not included in the price we ate dinner at their restaurant every night because the food was phenomenal. In addition to the various tagine's (which everyplace in Morocco has) the dinner menu included other dishes Despite the fact we didn't use it the La Maison Arabe also had a hammam thereby eliminating the need to look elsewhere for one. The price as compared to some other high end hotels is very reasonable.    We would definitely stay at this hotel again when we go back to Marrakech.

Review_Date: Edward M wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Title: An amazing hotel staffed by amazing people
Review_Text: A hotel where you are treated as family and the staff each have a unique personality that adds to the effortless service they provide you. Adil and his team work tirelessly to make sure you have the best possible experience while staying in Marrakech. The food in the two restaurants in the hotel have an almost Michelin feel and presentation - if you come to this amazing city you must make this hotel central to your visit
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Leslie N wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: LA Maison Arabe was the perfect location. It is located centrally to get to all the souks really great restaurants and other activities. A charming boutique Riad with all the amenities to fully luxuriate and enjoy the magic of Morocco. The staff was top notch and very attentive. I especially enjoyed the daily breakfast of fresh farm to table foods.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: La Maison Arabe and their staff were absolutely wonderful. They made you feel welcome and were genuinely happy to see you. The service they provided was top notch every room was full of intricate beauty and no details were overlooked. From the guest rooms common areas restaurants cooking classes spa etc. everything at La Maison Arabe was 10/10.

This is a beautiful Riad that is located very close to the Medina and Square. The building is gorgeous and the rooms are wonderful. The beds are extremely comfortable as well.    The food in the restaurants is delicious. I had the opportunity to take advantage of the spa with a Hammam treatment and a massage. Both were wonderful and I would absolutely recommend.    I also had the opportunity to take the 3 hour cooking class offered with 5 friends. It was awesome and I would recommend this as well. The chef and translator were both delightful. Overall an amazing experience !

Review_Date: katrina s wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: One of the best vacations I've had
Review_Text: I was traveling in Europe for weeks I finally had a relaxing vacation in Marrakesh thanks to La Maison Arabe. I picked this wonderful piece of paradise to stay at since it had everything - a riad that we got to explore a hammam where we got a royal treatment in a world-class cooking school where we learned to make traditional Morrocan dishes two pools to lounge at a sumptuous restaurant that served French Morrocan and Asian dishes and best of all the friendliest most helpful and delightful staff. We stayed at multiple 5-star hotels throughout our journey and this staff is the best yet. They arranged our tours for us to share their food to teach us their rich culture and to take instagram photos.
