We booked a standard room with a garden view. We were upgraded to a suite with a garden view which was very nice. However the next morning we woke up to construction banging and lots of noise. We complained about it to the front desk and they apologized profusely. That was the business next to them who were renovating. In any case by the time we had finished our breakfast they offered us a change of room and this time to the royal suite :). That was surprising and very sweet of them. They have two royal suites and we stayed in one of them. The suite consisted of three levels; the first one had a huge sitting area a big screen TV and a complete bathroom. The top level had the bedroom overlooking the first floor another big screen TV and another complete bathroom. By complete I mean toilet double sinks bathtub and a shower. The bathrooms were well stocked. They made sure to go in and freshen up every time we left the room. The third level had a private terrace with a jacuzzi .  When you check in this Riyad they offer you a drink by the pool while they process your papers. Then they would take you for a tour of the place and give you a little history about it. There are two restaurants and a bar as well as many courts and sitting areas.  Our stay included breakfast which was served outside by the pool or at your room and afternoon tea served wherever you want. Many choices and a variety of food for breakfast served by wonderful staff.  We had our dinners there too. We've enjoyed every bit of it tremendously. We decided not to eat in the market to avoid any unfortunate food intolerance etc.  This Riyad is located in the old Madina and within a walking distance of Jame al Fena Bahia palace and other historical areas.  It is a good idea to order a pick up from the airport or the train station wherever your point of arrival is. We ordered it it through the Riyad.  If we ever visit Marrakesh again La Maison Arabe will be our choice of accommodation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Desiree Fish wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: This restaurant is in a Riad in the old town and we had heard great thing so had to try. So glad we went. It's a beautiful Riad and you walk through beautifully decorated rooms to step into the restaurant in a sunken room that is all red. The tables around the room are positioned to face the center and the musicians played traditional Moroccan music.    The food is traditional too. We order the Moroccan salads many small plates of cooked and sautéed vegetables. All spiced perfectly. Then I ordered the lamb tajina (different from a tagine) slowly cooked lamb in its own clay pot for hours. It was SO tender and delicious! My husband had the chicken couscous with vegetables. Huge portions and all wonderful. We had a rose Medallion Moroccan wine and we were too full for dessert. But we finished with mint tea.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent Riad, take a day trip to the Atlas mountains
Review_Text: Beautifully decorated has three restaurants with excellent food very comfortable rooms and friendly and very attentive staff. It's an oasis of calm in the middle of the medina. as I would like to recommend a day trip to the Atlas mountains for For anyone visiting Marrakech.  After a couple of days in the hectic city we realised we wanted to escape and experience a little more of the scenery and culture of Morocco .  Going on line to look at day trip possibilities I found Trekkinginmorocco.net who appeared to offer just what we needed . I emailed them and had a very swift reply from Ahmed who described the day visit to the High Atlas mountains it would cost 130 US dollars for both of us and no money need be paid in advance .  We were picked up promptly at 0900 from our La Maison Arabe in a roomy vehicle and started our drive out of the city . Our first stop was at a traditional village and an argon oil cooperative . The process was explained to us there was no pushing to sell and everything was relaxed and friendly . We then continued our climb up into the mountains with amazing views and had an opportunity to ride a camel which was included in the tour cost .  After a couple of minutes we reached our destination Imlil a small village nestling amongst the highest peaks of North Africa . Walnut and apple trees and snow on the mountains  made it very special . We were met by the owner of Trekking in Morocco.net and our guide Ibraham and given a warm welcome .  Tea and cake on a terrace and Ibraham asked us how we would like to spend the day . There were options for length of walk and a vehicle drive to a higher village . We could trek on foot or ride a mule . We walked for about one and a half hours through small Berber villages to a waterfall meeting many local people and our guide explained the local customs and culture whilst we were surrounded by incredible views .  Lunch was splendid . On a terrace high up above Imlil . Berber cuisine tajine salad fruit and mint tea and nothing rushed . We then continued on a short walk to experience life in a Berber house met the family and my wife had a Henna tattoo on her hand . Ibraham interpreted our questions and explained clearly to us the Berber way of life .  About 1600 hours we met our driver and started our return journey to Marrakech. On the way back we detoured to a remote village where the driver explained saw few tourists and was a very special place for the Berber people . We felt very privileged .  Arriving back at our hotel about 1830 hours we paid the agreed price to our driver And a tip for his excellent safe driving and courteous manner .  My wife and I agreed this day trip was the highlight of our Morocco visit . For the price it was fantastic value and gave us a personalised experience everlasting memories great photographs and an opportunity to meet the Berber people and learn about their culture and customs .  We recommend TREKKINGINMOROCCO.NET for anyone visiting Morocco.

Review_Date: R L wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: Outstanding! Cannot imagine finding a better place to stay in Marrakech!!
Review_Text: I had the pleasure of staying at this historic riad the first one in Marrakech I am told. This has to be the one to set the standards for all other riad-hotels. Frankly I did not know a riad from a hotel when making the booking. I was looking for a place to stay that had good customer service and strong wifi because of my business needs. Well this riad's wifi was indeed excellent. But what I did not expect was the amazing lodging experience. The location was in my opinion perfect. A short walk to the famous market which was an adventure in itself. The riad itself was simply beautiful and clearly someone put so much thought into the design of each and every room including all the public spaces. The front desk staff were always on the top of their game as was the housekeeping staff and all the waiters/servers. The breakfast was outstanding both in terms of food quality food choices and the quality of the staff members. Their smiles each morning and their customer service orientation were second to none. And dinner. What a positive experience as well. The food was outstanding . . . and impeccably prepared.    If you want to have an outstanding lodging experience I strongly recommend La Maison Arabe. You will not be dissapointed.    Rich
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Paul R wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: Just returned from our 4 night stay and all I can say is that we had a great time. The staff were amazing both restaurants fantastic and the free suite upgrade incredible. Despite not telling the hotel they notice when we checked in that it was my birthday and so they arranged a cake with our evening meal and also drinks in the bar completely free. This level of attention to detail shows a team of people that want to excel at their job. The whole ambiance is just what we were looking for and we will certainly be back. Both myself and my wife rate this riad/hotel as one of the very top places we have stayed ever. Long may the standards of service and food continue.

Review_Date: Walid S wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: FABULOUS! Best Place to stay in Marrakech!
Review_Text: Stayed there for a week with my girlfriend in August 2015 was simply amazing. One of the best hospitality experience I've ever had The quality of the staff and service is absolutely outstanding they are friendly professional and always here to help & assist.    The hotel itself is a true luxurious Riad with a legit history decoration is fabulous bedrooms are amazing spacious extremely clean view from balcony is sweet. Seriously it even looks better than in pictures.    Welcoming drinks are a courtesy of the mixologist of the place Rachid awesome dude by the way. Restaurant is ... wait for it....Delicious!!!! Moroccan food at its finest and famous for that in the city. Loved the breakfast there as well.    Location is perfect and very convenient literally 5 minutes walking distance from the Jemaa El Fna place you're in the heart of the city area is VERY safe had many walks around any given time of the night.    The country club of the Hotel is also exceptional a driver can take you there any time of the day (10 minutes driving distance). Large swimming cool surrounded by a beautiful garden. Service there is also amazing and the restaurant is very affordable. Shout-out to Mohammed the Manager of the country club his hospitality skills are truly amazing and his kindness is hardly beatable.    You can also enjoy relaxing spas and massages for about 50$ the hour back to the Hotel. We have been upgraded in a suite as soon as we dropped our luggages on the entrance.    Cherry on top of the Cake? We even made new friends visiting Marrakech and staying in the same hotel!    We definitely found a home in Marrakech would strongly recommend La Maison Arabe to anyone staying in the city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: One of the Most Charming Places in Marrakech
Review_Text: We had lunch at La Maison Arabe and the setting and food were so good that we went back for dinner. Unfortunately there was a private party and the restaurant was closed that night but it worked out well because we went and sat in the enchanting old world bar had cocktails and listened to music. Because I was so enamored with this place I asked the manager to show me a room. It was absolutely charming and I know that this is where we will be staying when we return. I have stayed at some of the best hotels in Marrakech but for it's authenticity and it's intimate feel this is the place I would like to return to.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marion B wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel/riad. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They arranged guided tours for us in the soukes and other places of interest in Marrakech as well as a daytrip to the Atlas mountains. The guides/driver was the best. We ended up having dinner at the hotel nearly every evening because the food was excellent together with the service and atmosphere. We strongly recommend the cooking class arranged by La Maison Arabe. The hammam is a must. This is the place to stay in Marrakech the location is perfect and you get the xperience of staying in a beautiful riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris F wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: A most wonderful restaurant in old Marrakech. The scenery was excellent the Moroccan only wine list is superb.    The food was fantastic. The atmosphere was exotic !    Make reservations early and if the concierge says they are full call the restaurant direct yourself! (understand...)

We are currently sitting at the airport after spending a long weekend in Marrakech staying at La Maison Arabe.  What can we say?? It's been nothing short of amazing!! Wonderful setting lovely rooms beutiful hammam and most importantly INCREDIBLE service! All the staff are amazing and really do go out of their way to make guests feel welcome and enjoy their stay.  We will most definitely be back!    Ps: do visit the hotel country club! It's beautiful and it's only 15 mins away from the hotel and they provide a complementary shuttle service every hour. When we went we had the whole place to ourselves!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Fabulous dinner by the pool ( make sure you ask to eat by the pool the restaurant didn't look as lovely)    We started with cocktails produced by the charismatic barman before being taken through to a candle lit oasis for a feast of delicious food and wine.    Can't wait to return !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Love this place - want to come back!
Review_Text: Jan 30 to Feb 6 2014 - Everything about this hotel is excellent (staff service rooms food)! We stayed at La maison arabe for a total of 3 nights (2 nights on arrival and decided to come back for our last night since we loved it so much). Both times the staff and service was excellent from the moment we walked in. We were greeted upon arrival and they served us Moroccan mint tea in the parlor. Adil and staff assisted us in every way possible. I read rave reviews about the hotel on Trip Advisor books other travel sites/magazines and this place did not disappoint.    Location and Rooms - it's within walking distance of all the main attractions inside and outside the medina. It's also located right next to the second largest mosque in the city so the announcement for the call to prayer broadcasted over the speakers can be loud. The neighborhood doesn't look like much and neither does the exterior facade but inside its very well decorated with ornate Moroccan details at every corner. We booked at the last minute and got the ground level room 210 with the private patio (no view). The room didn't have a lot of natural light coming in but was beautiful and very clean. Bed was super comfortable with clean white linens and a soft fluffy white duvet (real rose petals were scattered on the bed and throughout the room on our initial arrival which was over the top but thoughtful). Bathroom was very clean as well with all amenities. On our second visit they gave us the balcony suite (room 245) overlooking the pool for just slightly more than what we paid for our first room. The upgrade was a courtesy since we came back. The room was excellent! Same comments as above and even better. Room was much bigger and had a lounge area and the bathroom had a separate shower with 2 types of shower heads (one was rainforest) and a bathtub with shower. No rose petals scattered in the room this time but probably because we showed up last minute without a reservation (we initially planned on staying in Imlil for our last night but I got sick from the altitude so we came back early to Marrakech).    Wifi service - There was free wifi throughout the hotel pool and inside the rooms. Once you connected to the right SSID the connection was good (my boyfriend was able to work remotely from the hotel).    Food - The breakfast buffet was amazing on the gorgeous pool terrace one of the hotel highlights. In addition to the selections of pastries meats fresh fruit juices etc. they had crepe and omelet stations. Do try the homemade vanilla yogurt in the cute glass jars - yum! The staff also made every effort to remember what kind of tea or omelet we had the day before (the hotel serves Tchaba brand tea which is amazing wish I had bought some to take home as the tea is only available in the Middle East and Marrakech). We also had dinner twice at the hotel's restaurant which was also excellent! I had the chicken tajine with stewed tomatoes both times and my boyfriend had the beef tajine with orange and cinnamon on the first visit and same dish with lamb on the second visit. The meats were super tender (chicken falling off bone). By far the best meal during our entire Morocco trip. Both restaurants also accommodated our gluten allergy and made us fresh cornbread in place of their regular bread offering.    Sure this place is on the pricey side but you get what you pay for. If we come back to Marrakech we would no doubt stay here again and would love to take the cooking class that they offer. We highly recommend la maison arabe for any kind of visit to this exciting city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here after reading the great reviews and learning we could use our credit card points to book.    We were given a junior suite that overlooked the pool.    Thanks to prior tripadvisor reviews we brought a couple bottles of wine from duty free. The room included a small bottle of wine gratis. A large bottle of water was free daily too.    The room and bathroom are amazing. The shower has a couple options for rain shower vs regular. Pressure is great. The soaps and lotions smell divine.    I took a bath in the separate tub which was lovely.    We spent some time on our terrace drinking wine and appreciating the weather.    We took the cooking class one day which was great and quite modern. You can specify if you're gluten free or veggie etc.    At their satellite site they have a much better pool with better lounging space. The shuttle is free to get there.    We opted to use the hotel taxi to get there which worked out perfectly. It was 200 dhr but worth it for peace of mind.    Souks (shopping) is walking distance.    The hotel lounge and restaurants are great. They'll serve you food anywhere.    The only downside was the proximity to the mosque resulted in loud prayers that could wake you from sleep. Turn on the AC and it'll drown out that noise.    Would definitely go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Simo I wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: We had 2 nights and was beautiful nights with a jazz bar and with 3 levels of the suite the 3rd floor was with jacuzzi but i didnt like doors were bit loud when i open it or neighbors door and front desk were very respectful and understanding the prices of food was ok  About pool they drive you like 15 mins to another area with a big garden
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We booked ten days at Maison Arabe after reading its TripAdvisor reviews. We like small hotels with character and great service and Maison Arabe certainly didn't disappoint.    Its best feature by far is its staff. Friendly and warm nothing is too much trouble for them. They truly want guests to enjoy their stay and will go out of their way to make it so. After I shyly asked if they would have gluten free bread it appeared at my table every day and also fabulous GF cakes. The waiters always serve you with a smile the ladies who prepare the omelettes and pancakes at breakfast are lovely and the staff who clean the rooms do so with a warm smile.    The managers at reception always check that you are satisfied with everything and they arranged a trip to the Atlas Mountains with a super attentive driver who got us there very safely (important when the roads are narrow and winding up steep mountains).    Everyone onsite speaks English and French and quite often other languages.    The hotel is a Riad with a lot of personality. Our room (Aladdin 216) was on the top floor and was comfortable and spacious and had a little private terrace which made afternoons reading the papers quite nice.    We tried both restaurants the Moroccan one and the international restaurant by the pool and quickly settled on the latter for most of our dinners. The hotel started its life as a restaurant and it shows; the food was great (my husband enthusiastically recommends the chicken and preserved lemon tajine).    The hotel really comes alive in the evening. With superb lighting dinner is a lively yet romantic affair with live music and a jazz bar for a post-dinner drink.    In short from the moment you arrive until you leave you are incredibly well looked after. We booked the airport transfers through them and they took care of all the details from checking us into the hotel while we relaxed with a refreshing drink to preparing our disembarkment cards for us before we left sending us off with a great smile and a bottle of water for the small journey to the airport.    We recommend Maison Arabe!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed 3 nights at La Maison Arabe for our 10th wedding anniversary. Everything was perfect. It's a lovely hotel - it's like a giant riad and has Marrakech's oldest restaurant within it. Room was great and had a small balcony & seating area. Breakfast was delicious. But most of all the staff were super friendly and the standard of service very high. We spent an afternoon at La Moumounia hotel and whilst it was a much more grand hotel the staff all seemed thoroughly miserable! We would definitely return to La Maison Arabe for another stay in the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David M wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: having used trip adviser to help pick the perfect hotel  we could not possibly have chosen better. I have stayed in quite a few hotels but this was by far the most memorable comfortable picturesque friendly hotel of them all. The minute we walked in we were greeted with a cool refreshing drink and then shown round the stunning oasis of a mini palace. For a smallish hotel it had 2 restaurants and a piano bar  all extremely stunning and live music every night. On top of all that a hammam (spa) which must be indulged . Every member of staff was incredibly friendly and helpful and did everything that could to make us feel like royalty but not in a pompous uncomfortable way. Food was out of this world and so tasty  and 3 course meal with wine every night was less than £60 !!. Ideal location for visiting the famous square and strolling the souks especially great for a barter if your a salesman like me .  a must do thing if time is to visit the waterfalls at the atlas mountains  well well worth the journey .  a special thanks to Morat who could not have done more  we will be back !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  in our opinion No 1 raid on trip advisor.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Katherine M wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: We spend a week in Marrakesh at this hotel and we had quite a wonderful time. The location is great most of the sight seeings and markets are in walking distance even the new part "Gueliz" can be walked to if you don't mind a longer walk. The rooms and bathrooms could use a freshening up however everything was in good order and nicely done. What I really would like to mention is their excellent level of service. The staff is very friendly and helpful and their approach is: If it can be done it will be done. Quite amazing better than in many 5 stars hotels worldwide.  Therefore they get the highest rating from me.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: james g wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: TEA / COFFEE IN A FANTASTIC SETTING!
Review_Text: While on holiday in Marrakech we visited La Maison Arabe and asked if we could have morning tea / coffee - we were non-residents. From the relatively unassuming entrance you could never guess what a fabulous riad this is. The staff were so friendly helpful and attentive. We were shown to a beautiful courtyard where we had tea coffee soft drinks and pastries. We were also given a guided tour of part of this magnificent riad. This was a special treat in a really sumptuous location. Just superb!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: CristinaF F wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: Very Disappointed, it is a rip off!!, It doesnt make me to come back
Review_Text: the hotel look much bigger and nicer in the pictures The hotel is very old and small the welcome bottle of wine you find in the room is undrinkable horrible the room very strong smell of humidity. I could not sleep the swimming pool very small is more for a decoration pool they do have another swimming pool like half hour in car from the hotel it is annoying because you spend 30 minutes going and 30 minutes coming back. It is a nice pool but the water is frozen the water should be heated. the hotel is very expensive 132Dh for a cold sandwich 283.25DH for lamb ribs. It is a rip off!! I don't understand how can be so expensive when the medium salaries are around 3000Dh/4000DH a month and living in Morocco is much cheaper than Europe.  I spent less money in 5 stars hotel by the beach and getting much more in Tenerife.  it doesn't make people to come back. You end spend so much money and getting nothing not much in return. No entertainment for adults nothing for kids the hotel is very small no place for kids to hang around. The breakfast very limited choices the coffee horrible the food is not great and very expensive you get more for your money in hotel in Europe than in this hotel which it is not understandable when the cost of living in Morocco is much cheaper.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Everything was wonderful! Room (had 220) breakfast (the spicy crepes was great) dinner (was at the traditional restaurant) SPA (had the royal treatment) the employees and the riad location... Everything was absolutely 5 star!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Judith C wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: What an amazing, friendly place to stay.
Review_Text: This Riad is right in the centre of Marrakech so close to all the sights and sounds of Morocco. It is steeped in the local culture and the most beautiful place to stay. The rooms were really comfortable and all the staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble. We ate in the restaurant each night and the food was delicious. My 13 year old daughter has an allergy to dairy products but by day two all the waiting staff knew who she was and the chefs cooked for her accordingly. She has never been to any place where she can have more or less what she wants.    I would recommend this Hotel / Riad to anyone of any age if staying in Marrakech. I will certainly be visiting again in the future. As you can tell we loved it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I can only echo the superlatives previously used to describe La Maison Arabe. My family and I were blown away by the attention to detail at LMA and the focus given to customer care. Every single member of staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed and couldn't have done any more to make us feel at home. You truly feel like guests of honour. The decor is wonderful with lots of handcrafted finishing the rooms very comfortable and the location very convenient but it is the attitude and effort of the staff that makes a stay at LMA so memorable. Hope to return again soon and would recommend to anyone without hesitation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Mike W wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: I have been fortunate enough to stay at some of the world's best hotels ( Raffles in Singapore Claridges The Plaza etc). The service in Maison Arabe is certainly equal to any of these & in some cases better). The hotel ( more like a Moroccan house really ) is extremely comfortable and well furnished. The restaurants are good with a very high level of service and the food also good quality. It has a very good location in the Medina & the main square is about 10 mins walk away. This was our 2nd stay and will have no hesitation in returning should we return to Marrakech which we probably will.  I would give it the highest recommendation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Over the course of our 4-day stay La Maison Arabe found a place in our hearts.    I travelled to Marrakech with my 73-year-old mother and 2-year-old son and remain completely indebted to the staff at La Maison Arabe for making our stay memorable stress-free and wonderful.    From the moment we arrived at this magnificent property and were greeted by the effortlessly gracious Morat to the moment we left 4 days later no request was ever too much and more often than not we did not need to make requests as staff had thought of our needs even before we knew we had them.    We stayed in the Kamar Junior Suite which was ideal for us: ground floor private patio quiet part of the hotel generous bathroom and wardrobe well appointed bedroom. (Note: the dawn chorus of birds in the trees on the patio is impressively loud and can be a nuisance if you are a light sleeper but we found it quickly passed).    We chose to have breakfast at the beautiful poolside every morning. The buffet was extensive and included home made pastries and juices as well as Moroccan pancakes and your choice of eggs etc.    We ate dinner at the poolside restaurant several times. The quality of the meals (both Moroccan and Western) was simply phenomenal - everything was absolutely delicious. The room service menu seemed relatively limited but the hotel easily and happily arranged for restaurant food to be brought to our room at no extra cost.    We were able to visit the hotel’s sister site (a 20 mins free shuttle ride away) which is an oasis of calm and beauty. It’s worth making a trip there if you want a little respite from the dusty medina.    The location of the hotel is excellent for anyone who wants to stay in the medina within walking distance of the sights (it’s a 10 mins uncomplicated walk to Place Jemaa el Fnaa). The hotel sits in a little pedestrian alleyway bordered by two main thoroughfares and is easily recognisable from these main causeways – i.e. you don’t have to wind your way through interminable indistinguishable alleyways to reach the hotel. We always felt safe when returning at night on foot.    As I was travelling with a toddler I was particularly grateful for the hotel’s invaluable support with the smaller details of our stay such as securing taxis at an appropriate rate giving directions and reliable advice about the locale sights and customs all of which rendered our stay as smooth as it could be.    On our first day we took a guide recommended to us by the hotel for three hours. Whilst the guide himself was of medium quality (he seemed slightly tired and unenthused) it was absolutely the right thing to do as he was entirely at our disposal for three hours led us through the maze of souks took us to some sights and gave us some history all of which gave us time to aclimatise ourselves to the pace and atmosphere there and ask as many questions as we wanted in a relatively trusting context without the usual tourist pressure. On our last day the hotel also arranged for a horse-drawn cart ride for us which cut out some of the fraught negotiating that can sometimes take place when purchasing a service or item in the city.    We were particularly grateful that the hotel was able to lend us a room for an hour whilst we waited for transit to our next destination so that my mother and toddler could rest in peace.    La Maison Arabe is of course one of the higher end hotels in the medina charging accordingly (bear this in mind when eating at the restaurant). Nonetheless it’s worth noting that whilst some establishments charge these sorts of prices they can fail to deliver on service and you walk out feeling slightly done over. This is certainly not the case with La Maison Arabe.    The most important aspect of my stay there with my family was the people who work there. Every single member of staff from the porters to the waiters to the managers go out of their way to make you feel welcome to help you with every little matter. Nothing is too much trouble and they are extremely forthcoming with thoughtful suggestions and guidance on any matter. We found their customer service faultless sophisticated refined courteous and warm all at the same time. When we left there we missed them. Thank you Adil Morat Rachida and your female colleague who was at front desk whose name I do not recall and all the staff at La Maison Arabe for making our trip to Morrocco as beautiful as it was.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Catrina R wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: A wonderfully welcoming hotel in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at La Maison Arabe from the 24th October 2015 for 4 nights. From the moment we walked through the door we realised we were in for a luxurious experience in a building that was beautiful. We could not find fault in anything this Riad had to offer. Every single member of staff was attentive to our needs no matter how big or small. This is a fantastic hotel in the heart of Marrakech's Old Town. Our only regret is that we didn't stay longer. We really recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It's hard not to repeat what many others have said about this lovely Riad but here goes?  First is the staff who are the key element in making your stay so memorable they were very efficient and always had a word or kind smile for you. They seemed to know exactly what you required before you asked cannot praise them high enough.  We had a standard room which was perfectly adequate for our needsthe bed was very comfortable and had all the modern amenities required nowadays.  There was coffee machine in the roomhowever you can phone reception in the morning and get room service to bring it to your room. The only improvement l would recommend is that the lighting in the room and particularly the bathroom could be improved.    The ambience is fantastic and you will love all the corners to unwind after a hectic day of sightseeing.    The breakfast in the morning was the best we have had in any hotel we have stayed worldwide. The food is fresh imaginative and tasted great. You can have your eggs anyway you like and there is a lady who makes Moroccan bread fresh each morningplease try it you will love it.    We ate dinner in both the hotel restaurants and we were quite disappointed with our meals. The general manager Nabila Dakir arranged for a special meal to be provided for us unfortunately this was also not to our tastehowever we thank her for all her efforts.    Please try the country club after a day in the souks it is a haven of peace in a hectic but beautiful city.    Lastly hopefully you will get to meet Adil Chain who is the front office managerwho ln our opinian is the best in the business.    We will return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: You walk down a narrow alley; then there is a little door in the wall and a small sign that says "La Maison Arabe." When you walk through the door you are transported to an astonishing place..... pools tiles cedar carvings incense interior courtyards alabaster wall decorations intimate spaces jazz bars traditional musicelegant restaurants fabulous food and a staff for whom your happiness is their best reward. This was a remarkable find in every way. Tours and cars were easily arranged. We are experienced world travelers who stay in 4-5 star places everywhere; and this was exceptional. Be sure to ask for Ismail (pronounced "I Smile") when you arrive. He is a terrifically talented young man who will help you in every way.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lisa K wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: We unequivocally recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Marrakech. Customer service is the best we have experienced anywhere! The hotel is like an oasis beautiful inside rooms are clean and everything from wifii TV air conditioning was exactly what you expect from this 5 star hotel. Any issues and the staff were on top of it right away - the best part of our Moroccan experience was staying in this hotel. Thank you to Adel and his amazing staff! - The Canadians
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is a place to treat yourself. The staff are very friendly and go out of their way to help you. It is not cheap but worth it. We had dinner at both the restaurants and both were excellent. The breakfast are really good enjoyed next to the pool. We booked to go on the cooking course and it is well worth it. Some building works were taking place next to the hotel with banging starting at 7. A quick word with the reception desk and this was sorted out to start a little later. They even offered to pay for our cooking course . We also took advantage of the spa as well as the "country club".
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: clive w wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: The Maison Arabe redefines 5 star quality and service - so often these days a star rating is given to a hotel based on facilities rather than service this is definitely not the case with the Maison Arabe. From the moment we arrived we were greeted by our host Ishmael who escorted us to the open air Riad courtyard for a welcome drink whilst he took care of the 'check in' process after which we were given a tour of the hotel (much needed as the building has so much history and has evolved over many years into a quirky hotel with many different levels).    During our 4 night stay we wanted for nothing the hotel staff were all personable and no request was too much trouble. The Jazz bar was particularly notable with live music every evening and Rashid (A master of cocktails!) ever available to share his knowledge even to the extent of demonstrating how too make his own creation house cocktail and also writing down the recipe - We will definitely be enjoying this back at home whilst reminiscing on a perfect holiday.    Finally I would also recommend the cooking school where we spent a pleasant afternoon at the purpose built facility under the wonderful tutelage of Mohammed. A full hands on cooking experience with the added pleasure at the end of enjoying traditional Moroccan cuisine that we had prepared and cooked and would rival much of what Marrakech has to offer (although still not quite the quality of the Maison Arabe's two spectacular restaurants)    We will definitely be returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cassandra S wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: We had a lovely stay at La Maison Arabe. After spending two weeks of traveling the country what a great finish in a unique Moroccan style hotel in the middle of the city. Staying here is like staying in a luxury private home with family that is how the staff makes you feel. From the moment you arrive a friendly greeting and a welcome drink is your first experience. After a day of touring and shopping it is great to come back and head to the Jazz Bar for a drink and music with the most friendly waiters. No need to search every night for a restaurant  as your hotel has one of the best. The rooms are really comfortable and quiet as well. I don't want to forget to mention how helpfully the reception staff are. Enjoyed a massage in the Hammam which is a must to see.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Loved the room! It reminded me very much of sleeping in a castle. We had our own little private terrace -- a nice place to have the bottle of wine included with the room. I can't rave enough about the hammam and massage my husband and I shared one evening. It was very luxurious and the staff were very friendly and professional.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dan L wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: Out of this world customer service
Review_Text: I have stayed at so many 5-star hotels around the world but this one exceeds all my previous experiences with both hotel charm and the customer service.  Location is great - right when you enter Medina so it is accessible by car and you are not too deep in Medina's because it can get hectic with visitors and locals.  So much design detail was given to this hotel/riad so I got to experience a real Moroccan design.  Customer service as my review's title suggests was out of this world - it was superb. I have not experienced this anywhere else yet.  I definitely recommend this riad to anyone going to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Amazing place and service. Beautifully decorated and interesting layout. The special rooms and treats go on and on. The breakfast is first rate and dinner was excellent. And additional bonus is the country club 15 minutes outside of the hotel that is a sanctuary from bustle of the city.

My mum (61) and I (30) visited this delightful riad/hotel in October 2015 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay predominately due to the quality and friendliness of the service.    The location is very good being just a short stroll from the medina but in a quiet and pleasant area. The front desk staff are very willing to advise on places to eat activities to undertake customs to be aware of and to order taxis and to escort you to them as well as negotiating the fares.    Nothing was too much trouble for the team - particular "wow what great service" moments included providing us with chilled bottles of water for the journey home completing our departure forms for us and remembering what we liked to drink for breakfast.    One especially nice aspect of this hotel is the country club/kasbah a short drive away. The hotel provides a free hourly shuttle service to this total paradise where there is a pool with shaded loungers lovely lunch and drinks a cookery school and a little gift shop. For us this meant that we could enjoy the sights and attractions of the city whilst also taking time out for some sunbathing and relaxation a really distinctive offering!    The facilities and food were all good but really it's the friendly and accommodating service that makes this place. I would definitely go back and would definitely recommend it to anyone wishing to explore the exciting city of Morocco from a very friendly and welcoming base.    Hope to see you again Maison Arabe!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Neal B wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: A late review as I have only just thought to add this we stayed for a week and it was fantastic the service was impeccable and food was equally as great! The addition of having the country club to retreat to was lovely as it is a very busy bustling city. Would definitely recommend staying here for a break in marrakesh and I would certainly go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Penny Light wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: Excellent stay raid absolute paradise. The staff very helpfulcould not do enough for you. We ate in the resturant a couple of times the food was suburb the surroundings by candle light very romantic. We also visited there country club an extra bonus couldn't fail anything would highly recommend

It's difficult to know where to start with La Maison Arabe.    From the moment we arrived for a birthday surprise long weekend when we were unexpectedly upgraded to the royal suite (over three floors including a stunning sun terrace) the staff couldn't have done more to make our stay more enjoyable or memorable. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble.    As others have said the hotel is situated off a quiet side street in the Northern Medina but the unprepossessing exterior is hugely misleading. Made up of six roads pulled into one complex the hotel is beautifully and tastefully decorated and laid out.    There were so many highlights of our stay. Here are just a few:  - breakfast offered a fantastic range of local and international dishes. Served in the central court along the hotel pool and not least given the hustle and bustle outside it's an extraordinarily tranquil and relaxing setting;  - we took the opportunity to try the spa both enjoying an invigorating hamman. Service here too was superb;  - the 'country club' - reached by an hourly shuttle from the hotel - sits on the edge of the Medina. Once we'd visited it once it was difficult to tear ourselves away with its huge freshwater pool fantastic gardens and superb poolside service.    But the memory we will take away more than any other from our fantastic stay at La Maison Arabe was the level of service offered by its staff. We were greeted everywhere with friendly smiles and an incredible level of attentiveness in particular from the brilliant manager Adil whose efforts to meet our every wish bordered on the superhuman.    All of this comes at a price of course but for the experience it was a small consideration.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful small hotel. Every possible comfort and amenity. Good central location but quiet and peaceful. First class restaurant (especially the Moroccan restaurant. A third of the price of La Mammounia and three times better !).    Excellent shuttle to their rural country club if you feel like a break from the city.    Above all charming staff - relaxedhelpful and efficient. One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brian M wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: This hotel lives up to the reviews. One of the best services we have had in a hotel.    Pros:  - Top service from every single member of staff  - Close to the main attractions in the Medina  - Offsite pool is relaxing and quiet  - Breakfast outstanding  - Room very comfortable  - Good wifi    Cons:  - The room was a little dark  - No tea making facilities    On checking in we were introduced to a member of staff that was taking care of us for the checkin process. We were taken straight to the bar area where we could relax and drink our welcome drinks while we waited for our room. When we were ready we were given a tour of the Riad before being shown our room which they had upgraded for us free of charge!    The room was large lovely bed and air conditioning that worked really well. Wifi was good as each room had a router although one minor point was that it was a little dark in places at night and the TV could have more english channels.    Breakfast was very good with their own bakery making the best tasting pastries we've had! The setting was beautiful by the pool with not many tables so the service should be good. They have a traditional Berber woman serving traditional baked breads right in front of you and a good selection of hot plates as well as cold meats and fruit. The staff was impeccable in their service from welcoming you to your table to offering to take an egg order back to your table. Couldn't think of a better way to start a day.    The Riad has a pool but it's not really private as the restaurant surrounds it. To address this they have an offsite pool which is about 10-15 mins drive away via their free private shuttle bus. This was nice and relaxing and for us was very quiet as there were only 2 other people there! The staff there was also a pleasure to speak to.    The evening restaurant was also in the same setting and it was beautiful. A bit pricey but the food was very good and as always service outstanding.    The Riad also provided free tea in the afternoon in their tea room which was a nice touch.    The Riad is close to the Djemaa El-Fna and souks which is around a 10 minute walk away. For a calmer walk we suggest you walk right from the hotel to the larger main road which have bigger and better pavements than going through the smaller roads with the shops on either side as it gets pretty busy with the small pavements.    Checking out was smooth and we even received the immigration exit cards filled in for us! Before checking out we emailed our next hotel to pick us up with their taxi. After some time while waiting for the taxi in reception we were given free bottled water by the porter. After 30 mins the receptionist offered to call the hotel and to enquire where our taxi was. He found out the hotel gave me the wrong hotel contact number and he proceeded with finding the correct one and proceeded with chasing up where our taxi was.    Outstanding Riad that has their staff to thank for!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were in Marrakesh mid September. We ate a few meals at La Maison Arabe as well as doing the cooking class. It was brilliant. The service exceptional and staff outstanding. thought we didnt stay the night  we were very welcome and the facilites were stunning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When we got picked up in the airport in a Mercedes I said to myself the hotel must be very nice.... When the taxi stopped I said where is hotel? He said he will call hotel porter to come and collect luggage....  My first reaction this is not happening..... Especially when I followed the porter to this unattractive hotel frontage....  However when I entered....... They called my name without even checked in...  Through out the stay every staff greeted you by your name...! Very personal touch..!!  I will leave the praise aside for you to experience ..  All I can say is the cooking class was interesting and even the Four Season's Regional Manager was there to enjoy the cooking class...

Review_Title: Best Customer Service Ever! Gorgeous Boutique Hotel.
Review_Text: The moment we arrived we were greeted by charming Ishmael brought to the lovely garden patio and given a refreshing beverage. After a brief tour of the facilities we were taken to our beautiful patio-side room. Tons of windows and a private large balcony with couch were high points but the Moroccan details and luxury of the room made it superb.    This hotel is small but has the amenities of a much larger hotel. Breakfast either the extensive and delightful poolside buffet or room service is the best I had in Morocco. Special note: even though our flight out was hours before breakfast is usually served we received a tray to our room at 4:15 with everything we ordered the night before. Our driver was prompt and delivered us to the airport with perfect timing.    The cooking class at the offsite facilities was a real treat. I recommend planning to swim before or after the class and making a day of it. The shuttle back in the evening will come for you later than the posted 1800 time if you do the afternoon session (usually fewer participants). Leave space in your bag for a fairly large tagine (the same one used in the class) or you will be forced to leave it behind. The gardens and small gift shop are well worth a visit.    To be clear I love spa treatments. The spa here is gorgeous and my hammam treatment was fabulous. They have several options and I recommend extending the massage to an hour at least! I also regret not getting a facial. If it was even half as good as the treatment I received it would have been worth it. And the eucalyptus in their black soap was so refreshing.    The restaurants are exceptional. The poolside option has two menus and the risotto is the best I've ever eaten. The traditional option setting is very romantic and intimate. Reservations at peak times is recommended. The jazz bar is the perfect sumptuous and cozy retreat. Rashid mixes up refreshing Moroccan inspired cocktails. Ask what he is mixing before placing your order!    We requested a tour guide for our visit to the medina and had a great experience with him. Invest at least 3 hours for this there is really no way to opt out earlier. Too much to see! Also be aware that many of the educational opportunities you will be offered will become hard sell moments before you leave. Be sure to speak with your guide as to what you are looking for and what you do not want. I ended up buying a rug! I didn't intend to leave with such a large purchase but I'm certain I will eventually be grateful I did. Also be sure to ask the guide whether the shop you are entering is open to negotiation. It can be difficult to tell sometimes.    This hotel is beyond compare. You will not regret staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel and restaurant in the centre of Marrakech is well worth a visit.    As always in old Marrakech the building is entered through an unprepossessing door from an equally unprepossessing. Once inside you are transported into an exquisite very Arabian building.    The restaurant is beautiful with tables outside by the pool area available.    The food is excellent and reasonably priced by international standards.    The service is good and attentive.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A beautifully appointed restaurant in one of the most elegant and welcoming hotels in Marrakech. Maison Arabe does authentic Moroccan cooking in a classical presentation to delicious effect. To start we shared a mini pastilla trio (three varieties each with a delicate flaky crust—wonderful) and traditional Moroccan salad of some 10-12 small salads including spiced carrots fragrant and tender aubergine a lively beet medley quinoa with tomatoes and cucumber to name only several. I had bites of my dinner companion's dish—a roasted lamb shoulder which was impossibly tender and delicious and I had a beef tagine with dates figs and apricots. So so good. The meal was accompanied by the finest live traditional music we heard in Morocco a vocalist and a guitarist pair that made the whole evening come together beautifully. Truly one of the highlights of our trip. A sensational experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Oasis of tranquility in manic Marrakech
Review_Text: Fantastic Riad hotel that just oozes character and charm along with the most helpful and friendly staff ensuring a truly 'magical' experience. The outdoor restaurant surrounding the pool is extremely picturesque and romantic in the evenings with lovely lanterns candles and live musicians etc. The food is of a high standard especially from the Moroccan menu but maybe a touch 'bland' to cater for all tastes. I requested extra spicing which they happily obliged transforming good dishes to excellent! The Moroccan wine was a complete revelation good value and highly recommended. The charming Jazz bar cocktail lounge has bags of character serves great cocktails and the head barman really makes you feel welcome providing exceptional service. The additional 'country club' with a larger pool surrounded by gorgeous fruit and olive trees and lovely gardens is just heavenly -a perfect retreat to just relax and enjoy the wonderful weather! The 'Cookery Workshop' arranged post-arrival was enjoyable and great fun although again to cater for all they have a tendency towards assuming you've little knowledge and maybe make it a little too easy. The Atlas mountains trip also arranged post-arrival including the '7th' waterfall and lunch at Richard Branson's Kasbah Tamadot was superb and a highlight of our trip. La Maison Arabe is a truly exceptional experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jason A wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: My friends and I stayed here for 4 nights in Sept 2015. The experience was nothing less than phenomenal. The staff was amazing helping set up tours dinner in several different locations around Marrakesh. The rooms we perfect with great views of both the property and the surrounding city. We also had the opportunity to go to their country club which is off premises (and included). The staff grounds and pool were excellent and provided and quiet time away from the Medina. If I have the opportunity to go back I will definitely look to stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: An amazing hotel next to the medina in Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed in Morroco in a total of four hotels and this was probably the best! The room was very comfortable the meals superb the location (just outside the medina - 10 minutes walk from Jemaa el Fna) excellent and the service from the staff was wonderful.  At Breakfast we had a wide range of juices (grapefruit cucumber beetroot carrot orange lemon) cakes breads croissants etc. with cheese and meat as usual. We could also order a Moroccan pancake to be made or scrambled or boiled egg on request. One hint - check that the boiled egg is actually being made - once we had to wait 20 minutes for a 5 minute egg! They had simply forgotten!  There are two parts to the hotel - the older and the new. We were in the newer part but both parts are equally good - but it is quite a maze to find one from the other. We got lost twice!  The hotel also has an associated garden with a magnificent pool just outside Marrakech (about 15 minutes by free shuttle bus) where you can swim or dine in a lovely garden
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Have just returned from 4 nights at this fabulous read. A wonderful place to stay to really experience Moroccan hospitality. Amazing rooms and good food but the staff is what particularly makes this an excellent place to stay. Thank you particularly to Rasheed always greeting us with a smile and one of his delicious concoctions from his jazz bar. We also particularly enjoyed the country club. A little oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the souk and medina. The gardens are beautiful they grown their own aubergines chilli peppers herbs pomegranates and much more. I didn't take part in the cookery school as was enjoying the sunshine too much after a disappointing summer here but I will next time. My only negative would be to avoid room 214 as although it looks charming it has very narrow steps up to the bathroom which were a little tricky to navigate in the middle of the night. We were fortunate enough to be moved to 210 which is a suite with its own courtyard. A really lovely room. Other plus points: the transports worked well we were given water to take to the airport with us on our departure and it is within walking distance of the souk and main square.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Roz P wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: Beautiful place with amazing spaces decor and facilities.  Fantastic breakfasts - try the filled pancakes. Also magic of the evening meal next to the pool. All wonderfully lit with candles. And serious musicians too. More formal restaurant lacked character though sumptuous in features. Moroccan cuisine not really special.  Somehow could almost be a themed-luxurious hotel in another country. Maybe a little too polished in my opinion... Staff intrusively attentive at times especially at breakfast. Maybe over-trained and over-anxious to please. After all they have a reputation to maintain and positions to retain.... Guess it seemed a little souless to me!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Maison Arabe is fabulous! The staff are some of the most organised friendly and well trained as I have come across. The knew my name from the second I arrived and there was no request they would not try to accommodate. The hotel itself is small and charming with a very cosy feel. Having stayed at several hotels in Marrakech this one is now my go to hotel. Its not as flashy as some of the big ones but a quaint and memorable experience. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Emamul H wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: Well what can I say? From the moment we arrived at La Maison Arabe for our 1st wedding anniversary it has been a first class experience. Initially I emailed the hotel from London to which they replied immediately arranging our transfers. Upon reaching Marrakech the driver was already waiting. We were brought to the hotel in a AC mini van something you'll appreciate once witnessing the heat! We were welcomed by the Manager at the front desk - Adil Chaif. He checked us in early as we arrived before 3pm and gave us some refreshing mint tea and moroccan savouries. Amazing!! Adil explained the details of the hotel and showed us our room giving us a tour of the hotel.    The hotel itself is in an ideal location. It's a 10 min walk to Jami-Fina main square 15 mins to Souks. Also it's 20 min walk to Jardin Marjorelle.    All the staff at La Maison Arabe are wonderful very polite always smiling and helpful. Words can't do justice. The restaurant is a must and the breakfast buffet is amazing.    The Hammam at the hotel is one of the best I've experienced anywhere in the world. The lady at the Hammam welcomed us with mint tea and savouries gave us choices of which oil we like. Massage was beautiful. We felt very much at home. Truly amazing experience.    Adil was very helpful in providing us with maps of Marrakech. He recommended top restaurants mapped out our route to landmarks and souks. Without it we'd have got lost! We thank him so much!    Adil and Raja were very swift and helpful in arranging our coach trip to Agadir. They bought the tickets for us and arranged taxi to the station. We didn't need to do a thing.    The cooking class is a must! It was a wonderful experience and the Dada Amina and the translating man made it a wonderful experience.    The carriage horse is a wonderful experience. You are whizzed around amongst busy cars and motorbikes across landmarks. Do haggle a price though. 200dhs should settle it.    My wife wasn't sure about the experience we might have in a Riad Hotel but she's now left in amazement. Our anniversary has been made even more wonderful by La Maison Arabe and their staff. If we ever return to Marrakech then La Maison Arabe is the ONLY place we'll stay. I couldn't recommend it enough. Thank you guys and God Bless.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sally M wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: La Maison Arabe is fabulous! There are sitting rooms courtyards restaurants a pool Hamas a kitchen for Moroccan cooking lessons and an off site club available to guests. When the dining staff found out it was our 30th anniversary they sat us next to the pool and served us a wonderful dessert as a surprise!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bernard G wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: Having written a review for the restaurant and being very impressed with the food I decided to spend my last night in Kech here.    I made a last minute booking in person and a Standard Room was not available .  I was upgraded to a Suite for a very modest additional price.    The room although a little small is actually really pleasant.  On arrival I was given a non alcoholic cocktail and then given a tour of the hotel.  This was useful as the hotel son many levels with many corridors. To my mind this all adds to the charm.  The decor is traditional Marrakech / Morocco and beautifully executed.  The hotel is in an excellent location between the Medina / Souks and the "new town" (Gueliz). Everything is in walking distance.  The photographs do justice to the hotel.    The rooms have international TV (Mainly French) and the hotel has good internet widely available throughout the hotel.    La Maison Arabe is down a small alleyway and nowhere near as difficult to find as some of the Riads in the Medina.    This hotel genuinely deserves 5 stars and would be prefect for a short break in Kech.    If in doubt try for dinner first and then regret not staying!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Gillian C wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: On arrival we were greeted very graciously and given the good news of an upgraded suite. A tour of the hotel and its facilities followed a delicious welcoming and refreshing drink of mint ginger pineapple juice and limes blended with crushed ice. Our suite was beautifully decorated and everything to make you comfortable was provided. We enjoyed a number of excellent meals in the outdoor restaurant located around the pool and the live music provided by the resident guitarist. Service was exceptional and we found ourselves not wanting to leave! Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mary Ellen C wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: This beautiful property was everything described in the reviews. The staff is amazing and anticipates your every need. We were unexpectedly upgraded to a junior suite upon arrival. Our guide Ahmed was wonderful and made our stay so much more informative taking us off the beaten path to show us many of the artisans working their craft. An unforgettable place!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This boutique hotel is a fantastic place to stay. The high level of professionalism of every staff member makes it special and I was so sad to leave. Having lived in Morocco in the past I can truly rate the quality of their spa. Do not miss the opportunity to have a terrific experience and book a Hammam during your stay as not only the place is gorgeous the therapists really know what they are doing. I was also very impressed with the staff during breakfast. Specially a gentleman called Mohamed which I believe has been there since the opening. One great advantage of La Maison Arabe is that it was there way before the fashion started. Therefore they have highly knowledgeable management beautifully orchestrated by the charming Madame Nabila. She knows everything and everybody in town and will become the perfect hostess whether you are a single traveller or have a complex special occasion to organise. She is a truly old school hotelier and her attention to detail is noticed in the way the hotel is run. Would also like to mention Mustafa Nabila's assistant as well as Adil and his front office team. They sorted all my needs with immense friendliness and efficiency. I can't wait to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Mike C wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: The best place we stayed in our 2 weeks visiting Morocco. Great accommodations Very helpful staff. Romantic setting for dining next to the pool. Spa was very refreshing after a day in the low 100s. Enjoyable piano bar.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: Flat Rock, North Carolina, United States

Review_Text: STAFF  the staff were hospitable; very accommodating attentive and kind    FOOD  the food was excellent- even if you do not stay in this hotel I would recommend eating here at least once.    The menu is written in English and French    ROOMS  beds were comfortable  Bathroom was huge and room was well kept.    My only gripe was that coming from the U.S. we needed travel converters to charge our electronics.    I would have liked for them to have electric sockets next to the bed because we had to keep getting up to rotate devices for charging.    Another thing that I didn't like- one key per room. So it was horrible having to coordinate between the two of us when we did separate things or having to get up and lock the door and open the door for the other person because you had to manually lock the door and open the door for the other person of you wanted to stay on the room.    GROUNDS  The grounds were kept and maintained. Staying here will give you the traditional feel of Moroccan homes.    Beautiful architecture and decor- traditional.    You also must visit the off the grounds pool- BEAUTIFUL! They have a cooking class that is held here and the food is delicious.    DISABILITIES  While I still give this hotel 5 stars I would say it is not wheel cochair accessible. If you or the person you are traveling with are not able to climb stairs then this is not the hotel for you. No one in our party had disabilities so we were fine. But if you do then you will find this beautiful place a challenge.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: La Maison Arabe is one of the best
Review_Text: The first and possibly best Ryad in Marrakech. All the beautiful detail of a historic Moroccan home combined with attentive and friendly staff who make you feel the Four Seasons had something to do with their training. Excellent experience throughout our brief stay including amazing food tea and a drink they invented called a Morojito! Highly Highly recommend. We went for our 30th anniversary and it was fantastic. Also just a 10 minute walk to the square and the large Souk of Marrakech. Fantastic! We weren't able to take advantage of their offsite pool / garden but it looks like a great respite after traveling across the desert or escaping the heat after a long day walking the city.

Excellent hospitality!!! In this bouquet hotel allowing my rating to be 4.5 stars. However there is room for improvement.  1. Only one key is giving per room which makes no sense when the key is needed to lock the room door when your inside and when you leave. NOT TO MENTION A FIRE HAZARD... their way of fixing this issue is to send house keeping to open your door if someone in ur party is left/locked in the room for any reason. beware if you leave you key in the door house keeping won't be able to open it. Simple solution provide 2 keys.  2. breakfast/dinner was good but menu was the same everyday which may be an issue for some travelers  3. Wifi service was great however requires you to login every time you change location in hotel not a problem for myself but might be for others.  4. No iron or iron-board in my room however others who traveled with me states their room did have one.  5.No ice station in hotel at all you will have to call room service or front desk to get ice  6. TV only has news station n one movie channel thats spoken in arabic. I am not one to watch TV on vacation however the option is always great.  7. Lastly the shower head needs to be removed in order to wash off not a stand under shower also be careful with partial shower door it is not fixed to tub allowing for serious injuries if ur not careful.    Overall all the hotel was great as well as the top notch service thats why i give a 4.5 stars but if ur looking for a more modern feel of Morocco Stay in the newtown at hotels instead of a riad...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Had a brilliant trip. We had a suite with balcony that was lovely. Cannot emphasise enough how fantastic the staff are - helpfulfriendly and efficient at both the hotel itself and also the country club. We would definitely stay there again and are currently looking at dates in the near future to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eva K wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: We spent a part of our honeymoon at La Maison Arabe and we couldn't make a better choice. Everything was amazing from the big rooms and the central location to the delicious breakfast and the helpful staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: C S wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: Did not want to go home
Review_Text: Having spent three days in the desert and at the end of a 12-hour drive back to Marrakech we arrived at La Maison Arabe at 10pm tired dirty and very much looking forward to a bit of luxury. We had high expectations having read all the rave reviews.    We were welcomed and taken to the Jazz Bar for a cooling drink before being given a tour of the hotel and shown to our room. We had booked a standard room but were upgraded to room 247 a beautifully appointed room with a balcony overlooking the pool and a huge gorgeous bathroom with corner bath. Complimentary water and a bottle of wine helped to make us feel spoiled right away.    We asked if it was too late to dine in the hotel restaurant and were assured that would be fine so after a quick freshen up we headed down to the pool area and were seated at a lovely table. We knew the restaurant had an excellent reputation so decided to push the boat out and order three courses. The chicken bastilla was excellent as was the cabernet suggested by the waiter. The monkfish tagine was also outstanding. Unfortunately my medium-rare steak arrived medium well. We aren't the sort to complain or send food back as a rule but this was not a cheap meal and we were exhausted and had high expectations based on everything we had read so we asked for the steak to be re-cooked. In the 15 minutes I waited for the replacement steak my partner had finished his tagine. I eagerly cut into the second steak to find it raw in the middle. By this point we were both disappointed and I had lost my appetite and didn't care to wait for a third time. We were offered desert on the house which we declined. Eventually the manager appeared to apologise and offered desert again. By now I just wanted to go to bed. He did reappear a few minutes later to say that we would not be charged for the meal nor the wine which was an appreciated gesture and went some way to softening the disappointment.    Next morning we arrived for breakfast happy to start over again and we weren't disappointed. Fabulous spread stunning surroundings and excellent service start to finish.    Front desk staff were very accommodating and friendly (we stopped to chat a few times and found everyone to be engaging helpful and good for a laugh) throughout our stay and every request (whether for a map a charger cable for my camera or forgotten toiletries) was met with a smile and prompt fulfilment.    Location was ideal for us. We walked to the Jardin Marjorelle through the souks and it's an easy walk to the main square. If you use taxis you don't need to navigate a maze of alleyways so the likelihood of getting lost is reduced.    We loved the country club. We even had it to ourselves for a couple of hours one morning. It seems to get busier in the afternoon. Wifi was excellent. We enjoyed the cold white wine and beer but would have loved to have been able to order a cocktail.    The cookery class was fantastic with a superb atmosphere and knowledgable staff. We really enjoyed the morning and ended up purchasing the hotel's cookbook to take even more recipes home.    We also made use of the beautiful hammam on site. I had the Imperial Package which was very good value and all our treatments were of a very high standard. The spa itself is beautiful and so relaxing I nearly fell asleep at one stage.    My spa package included lunch which we took next to the pool just before leaving for the airport. I ordered the steak and frites from the lunch menu still hoping I might get a decent steak during our stay. Imagine my surprise when the waiter brought out the steak from the dinner menu I had ordered two nights earlier with such a disappointing outcome. Everyone - me my partner the waiter and the chef - paused with trepidation while I cut into the steak. I am delighted to report that not only was the steak cooked perfectly but the whole plate was one of the finest meals I have ever eaten. To top off a perfect meal the wonderful bartender who had stayed late two nights in order to fix us a nightcap when we returned from dinner out and who by now knew I was very much a fan of his mojitos brought us two on the house. Truly a perfect end to an incredibly luxurious stay.    So many other touches I haven't described made this one of our best hotel experiences ever. We truly felt special and pampered but in a way that never felt stuffy or pretentious. We hated to leave and I felt we were saying goodbye to friends. Thank you so much to all the staff who made our three days here so special. We've had a very tough year and it was just what we needed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: An excellent high quality hotel. Wonderful breakfast pool and sun loungers. Very good and interesting cooking course in hotel's outstation reached by mini bus. Well worth the visit. Hotel restaurants excellent the high end one and the simpler one around the pool. Very good service by staff.

Review_Date: Hamish A wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: We ve just arrived back from a fantastic short break at the hotel. The only thing that lets the place down is the website as we really weren't prepared for the quality of the surroundings and level of service that was provided. On arriving we were told that there was a surprise in the room only to be lead to the master suite instead of the room we requested as a free upgrade. Nothing was too much hassle for the staff who were attentive and most accommodating throughout our stay and the use of the country club was phenomenal which again I don't think was sold enough on the website. The hotel is within walking distance to the souks and if you don't fancy a brisk stroll the hotel will organise taxis for you at short notice.  I.d like to thank all the staff there for a fantastic weekend and going the extra mile where it wasn't needed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We decided on the La Maison Arabe as our holiday and to celebrate our daughters 21st Birthday and we were not disappointed! The Hotel upgraded us and we had a suite over looking the pool and the restaurant and the girls had a spacious bedroom too. Each room had its own wifi how great!  We had dinner at the restaurant and they presented her with a cake and sang for her and she loved it! The food was fantastic the flavours lovely!  The manager Adil couldn't do enough for us and as were all the staff we were treated like royalty throughout our stay.  They have a private country club and the shuttle leaves every hour (10min ride.) We used to spend a few hours here the gardens and the pool were in a lovely setting and again the pool service was brilliant.  The girls tried the Hamman in the Hotel and it was reasonably priced the treatments themselves were of a high standard and the girls still talking about it now a Week on!  We would definitely come back here and you would be crazy to not to
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Ate at this fabulous place for a lovely romantic meal.    You get to walk through the hotel to the courtyard which made me want to stay there instead!    The setting was beautiful....candles lanterns typical Moroccan architecture band playing the water glistening etc. You won't be disappointed!    The food was very good maybe on the bland side but that's Moroccan cuisine for you. We really enjoyed our evening and would recommend in a heartbeat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lenke E wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: it is an enchanted place to stay when you visit this bustling city. The staff goes out of their way to accommodate you even beyond expectations.  The rooms are luxurious and clean the food is excellentnot to mention the mint tea that is offered even when you wait for your taxi.  I have traveled with my husband and son this August to Mar.rakech staying at this hotel and we did not want to leave.  Highly recommend to stay if you want a taste of Moroccan hospitality!  Planning to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We have just returned from 5 days at this Riad- style hotel. It exceeded our expectations in every way! The bar courtyard restaurant and pool area are beautiful. The staff could not have done more for us; they were exceptionally helpful without being intrusive. The location is perfect - all the main sights are within a reasonable walking distance although taxis are readily available and cheap if preferred.
