When we first arrived at the street in front of the hotel I was having second thoughts as this was supposed to be a 5 starred hotel. We were escorted down an alley way with grave concerns.    When we entered the hotel it was something totally unexpected. We were escorted to an atrium and was given a chance to relax. The Morroco-hitos are very good and refreshing. Whilst we were relaxing with our mocktails checking in was done and our luggage was taken to our room.    Adil (front desk manager) showed us around the communal areas of the hotel before escorting us to our room. Every part was beautifully decorated and immaculately maintained. There was no dust on anything (I did check). This hotel was impeccable and we learned to never trust a riad by the alley way it is on.    We stayed in suite 222 and it was perfect. Dual sinks waterfall shower and separate bath in the bathroom; Separate toilet and bidet; Walk in wardrobe; Queen sized bed stereo and flat screen TV; Lounge area with settee a Nespresso coffee machine and refrigerator; Large balcony with sun loungers and a veranda area. Breakfast and afternoon tea on the veranda was lovely.    The hotel was only surpassed by the attentiveness of the staff. They were always friendly and very accommodating. We were most impressed with four particular incidences. The first was when I enquired where we might get some strawberries and oranges and they immediately went out and got us some. The second was when Adil was trying to flag us a taxi to the new town and ended up having a heated debate with the taxi driver. We found out that it should only cost 20 dirhams but the taxi driver was trying to charge us a "tourist price" of 50 dirhams and had a go at Adil for telling us that it should only cost 20 dirhams. We have never had this level of protectiveness towards hotel guest before. The third was when I was speaking to Hicham enquiring of where I might purchase a good quality Panama hat. He rang the shop for us and even offered to get the guy to come and collect us from the hotel. We have never had this level of attentiveness towards hotel guest before. The forth was when we asked where we might get some good quality sea food and was recommended to go to Al Bahriya. We later bumped into a member of the hotel staff eating at the same restaurant with his family. Honesty and transparency goes a long way.    The spa was an excellent way to start a holiday. We had the imperial package which involved a hamman with kessa body scrub orange blossom honey body mask facial mask geranium scented sea salt body mask a radiance facial 30 minute massage and poolside lunch. We added a manicure and pedicure and an extra 30 minutes massage. I have never seen disposable underwear before.    The cooking workshop was a fun and interesting experience. The workshop was clean and professional with individual work stations for each student. The chef gave a very informative and relaxed lecture on Moroccan food and spices. We cooked a chicken tagine baked bread and made two types of salads. We also had a demonstration of the art of Moroccan mint tea. Lucky for me my partner and myself decided to eat the others cooking.    The taster menu at the restaurant was excellent. The setting was beautiful and relaxed and front of house service was attentive. The kitchen did not disappoint as well. There was a huge mixture of appetisers bastille tagines and desert. The presentation smells textures and flavours were sublime. There were local musicians and I was presented a birthday cake by two Gnawa singers with their own rendition of "happy birthday" whilst spinning their tassels.    The country club a paradise away from the hustle and bustle of the medina. We had missed the hourly minibus shuttle so the hotel arranged immediately a free taxi to the place (fifth impressive incidence of service level). There was some building work but this did not interfere with the ambiance of the place. The place was spacious and serene and the garden was a pleasure to walk around. The kebab lunch was excellent.    We loved our experience so much that we extended our stay for two extra nights and was upgraded to the suite 227. This suite was huge and stunning. It had a living room and bathroom on floor one mezzanine bedroom with bathroom on floor two and a private roof terrace with jacuzzi on floor three.    We would like to send our thanks to the wonderful team at La Maison Arabe for giving us a memorable experience of Marrakech and are looking forward to coming back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: I will be back for sure
Review_Text: There is not one single bad thing i can say about this place. I didnt read the reviews before going and was shocked at the hopitality. Everything is perfect the interior designing is amazing food is good my favourite was the spa. Is is worth every penny and tops every other hotel i have been to by a mile of. Would definitely recommend it you won't be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: One of the most wonderful places we have stayed in I work in the travel industry and we are very fortunate to travel the world I have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending this property. La Maison Arabe is exceptional the standard of service hospitality and the dining experience is all excellent rooms are incredibly comfortable and exquisitely furnished. The combination with the Country Club works very well so wonderful to escape for the afternoon and relax by the pool and receive the continuous flow of high service standards.  I really am repeating what others have written! No doubt it will be repeated again and again and deservedly so!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael B wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: So many positive comments have been made about this hotel and they are all true. We had five wonderful nights here and cannot speak too highly of the general ambience of the hotel splendid country club and very good food. However what most distinguishes this hotel is the exemplary service from all staff whatever position they are in.    Thanks to all for providing such a memorable stay.We will be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This well known place in Marrakech is a real jewel in the medina. We spend a day at the spa (Merhaba package) and afterwoods had lovely lunch by the pool. The spa is perfect for a relaxing day and hideaway from a hectic day in the city. The tables by the pool are perfect for finishing the day off with nice dinner or snack. For sure will be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Anthony B wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: This is an exquisite riad. It is beautifully decorated has three restaurants with excellent food very comfortable rooms and friendly and very attentive staff. It's an oasis of calm in the middle of the medina. In addition it has a country club with large swimming pool and restaurant that provides a simple but very good menu
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Janet M wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: Three of us attended the cooking class offered by La Maison Arabe. Prior to leaving for the cooking class we enjoyed Moroccan tea served to us in the area around a lovely fountain at the hotel. Had we seen this boutique hotel before booking a timeshare in Marrakech we would have stayed here. The hotel is stunningly beautiful. The actual cooking class takes place outside the city and has a lovely garden. The cooking class was intended to be a special present for my husband. It turned out to be one of my favorite activities of the entire three week trip in Morocco. The woman who taught the class spoke excellent English and we learned a lot about the Moroccan culture by taking this class. The class started with a tour of the herb garden and a demonstration on how to bake Moroccan bread. After these events we went to a well appointed kitchen. Each work station included everything needed to prepare the meal. The cooking class offered an overhead TV screen so you could easily see what the cooks were doing. The class also had sufficient staff who were always available to help and offer guidance.The food we cooked was excellent. After preparing the meal we all sat down to enjoy a mid-afternoon lunch at a beautifully appointed table.. At the end of the cooking class each participant received a certificate and a tagine as a take home present. We also purchased the La Maison Arabe cookbook and are planning to make a Moroccan meal for our friends in two weeks time. Well worth the money. It really was fun and a nice break from the hectic pace of the medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: ANNA D wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Second stay as excellent as first visit in January
Review_Text: I stayed at La Maison Arabe in January with our grown up daughter and we had an amazing stay. This time I visited with my husband and everything was as enchanting and perfect as before. The hotel is beautiful - every aspect of it and immaculately decorated and maintained. The rooms are so comfortable every member of staff is utterly welcoming and efficient and the food is second to none both the pool side breakfast and the two restaurants. The country club is a wonderful place to relax in the afternoon after a morning of sightseeing and shopping. We will definitely return as this is a magical place. Thank you to Adil and all the staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent riad in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: Had a great five nights here at the end of March. The room I had was large comfortable and quiet (far from the madding crowd outside). Beautifully decorated with a large bed and rose petals everywhere to impress the missus. Service was exceptional. A free bottle of wine on arrival plus free refreshing drinks free bottled water for our excursions - which the hotel helped us to arrange - we went on two separate day-trips one to the Atlas Mountains and another to Ait Benhaddou. Our driver spoke good English and was able to tell us a lot about the history and locations - the car was a spacious clean and new Toyota Landcruiser (the excursions cost £90 and £150 respectively). The riad itself is decorated in the traditional Moroccan style and finishing is to a high standard. The breakfast buffet is excellent with a broad selection of hot and cold food to suit all tastes. In fact the dining area by the pool is fantastic and the food served is of a very high standard - though of course expensive by Moroccan standards. Frankly it's hard to fault this hotel which does everything to a high standard and is conveniently located just a short walk from Jemaa el fna. A very fine place to stay and highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I were on holiday in Marrakesh. I decided to pre-book La Maison Arabe after reading positive rumours about it.  We were not dissapointed - food was excellent entertainment was excellent and service was excellent. If we visit Marrakesh again then we will surely stay at this hotel with it's lovely taste for food.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing hotel and staff - one of the best I have ever stayed in.
Review_Text: Last year we went to La Maison Arabe and were totally enchanted by the hotel its staff and the town of Marrakech. So if we went a second time would it really be as good as we remembered - could it possibly be as wonderful again? The answer is a resounding 'yes'. The fabric of the hotel is truly magical - with a wonderful balance between ancient charm and modern facilities. We had a Junior Suite with a balcony overlooking the small pool and restaurant. Only having 23 rooms give the hotel a real intimate and friendly atmosphere. It is close enough to the centre of the town to be able to walk to the main historic sites. Walking through Marrakech is a true joy the architecture and atmosphere are superb - it is very different from European cities. Providing you are able to say 'no' with a smile or bargain with a smile then everyone is very friendly. On the second day we took a taxi to the beautiful coastal town of Essaouira - well worth a visit. The third day was spent at La Maison Arabe's Country Club - this is a large magnificent garden with a superb pool and mini-restaurant under the trees just out of town. The hotel provides free transport in both directions. As only hotel guests are allowed then it is never crowded. The restaurant at La Maison Arabe is truly wonderful providing both Moroccan and European menus - although within reason the chefs seem very willing to provide whatever is requested. Also it is worth remembering that in the 1930’s La Maison Arabe started as a restaurant and was one of Winston Churchill’s favourites. However the real strength of La Maison Arabe is its staff - they seem to be everywhere always helpful always smiling. Amazingly within a day or so they all seem to know your name - wherever you are in the hotel. For us a third visit is a near certainty - and there are very few hotels in the world that I would put in that category.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bill M wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: This hotel exudes old world charm with highly trained charming and helpful staff from the front desk to the people who clean your room.  Everyone not only remembers your name but your room number your drink preference.  Nothing is too much for anyone who works in this Riad. If you are considering a trip to Marrakech this is the place to stay.  The husband of our travel companions has been sick with tourists probably picked up from food in another part of the country and the hotel could not have been better from special medicinal tea to supplying Imodium and daily follow up.  Way above and beyond!    The rooms are great and the food in the restaurants some of the best that we have had in Morocco. breakfast is also wonderful with an assortment off rush fruit etc.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: The Most Breathtakingly Magical Place We Have Ever Stayed !!
Review_Text: We have just come back from this amazing country and this Riad is outstanding and by far the best 5 star accommodation we have ever stayed in! The original features have been magnificently restored and the ambiance is amazing. Our suite was magnificent and beautifully decorated. We ate at both the main restaurant and the pool side restaurant - both of which have delicious food and local musicians playing traditional music and both these really should be tried. We took the cookery class which was so much fun and in the stunning surroundings of the La Maison country club. and used the hammam facilities which are truly beautiful .    The location is perfect in a lovely quite lane yet walking distance from the soul of the city ie the souks and the historic landmarks such as Ben Youssef Madrassa  Kotoubia la jardin marjorelle  and our favourite which is a quaint little place called Al Kawtar on Rue Laksour  which is a workshop where beautiful embroidered items are hand made by disabled women.    But without a doubt the best part of this Riad are the staff. Every single one of them from the doormen to the waiters and waitresses and off course all the staff on the front desk were the most professional caring friendly staff we have ever encountered. They organised everything for us from day trips to the ourika valley to restaurant bookings and we cannot speak highly enough of them; in particular 3 gentlemen on the front desk named Aadil Murad and Ismail- wonderfully professional and courteous people!!    The only downside of this amazing holiday is that we are now spoilt and may not experience such a wonderful riad/ hotel or staff like this in any other place!!    A MUST stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Enjoyed an amazing 5 nights here. Great to be so close to everything. Only 10 minutes to Medina and you are in the Souk. It's an oasis of calm and as previous reviews have noted the staff are brilliant and so helpful and friendly. We had a room with terrace overlooking the pool. The only downside was the call to prayer at 4.30 am from the nearby Mosque but we got used to it and it added to the whole experience. The breakfasts were amazing with lots of fresh fruit and hot and cold options. The fresh Moroccan crepes were fab. If you want quality accommodation in a totally relaxed and non corporate environment this is the place for you. We also went to their own country club on the outskirts of the city which has a fabulous pool and offers lunch. Hope we can return some day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is perhaps our favourite hotel our family has ever stayed at. The rooms were gorgeous and huge clean bathrooms too. The public areas were beautifully decorated as well - the lanterns are gorgeous. The poolside lounge area and restaurant were nice for lounging. If we had one negative it was that the pool was not heated and was icy cold in spring so my kids could not swim but they sure tried!    Location is excellent and near enough to the main square to walk. It is very quiet except for the call to prayer at 5:00 am but that's Morocco!    We also ate at the restaurant 2 nights in a row. We weren't going to but the first night it was so good that we went again. Try the lamb dish with lemons - my husband swears I licked the plate. He and the kids also enjoyed the chicken bastilla.    Loverly lovely hotel and hopefully we can return one day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: First I must admit that due to some kind of error we were upgraded to the royal suite. All I can say is you need to hope this error happens to you too. The room consisted of a main floor with two twin beds a full bath couches and a desk an upper balcony with a king bed and full bath and a private roof top terrace (with hot tub). Rose petals were everywhere when we arrived and they were gone when we went to bed. There were heated towel racks showers and baths in the bathrooms and a nespresso maker in the living room. Enough said... The hotel is a warren of rooms due to the fact that it is several buildings that have been combined but each is lovely and warm. The staff was exceptionally kind and welcoming my only complaint being that at breakfast each day it took them a little time to get with the program. Since it was by the beautiful pool I didn't really mind waiting a bit. An evening visit to the bar provided some exceptional people watching although the stock of liquor is not extensive (I should be grateful for what they did have!). This hotel is as others have stated an oasis hidden down a plain passage and red walls. While within the Medina it is a little ways from the Square--don't let that deter you though! It is well worth the walk.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: An oasis of cool calm in a hot busy city
Review_Text: Personally I don't think this hotel can be bettered. Immediately you enter you become aware of the cool calm atmosphere of this beautiful place.  Our room was lovely with an outside balcony and everything we could possibly need scattered liberally with rose petals. After being greeted by the very friendly reception staff on arrival we were given a welcome drink in one of the many areas available to sit and relax in. Then a tour of the facilities - the restaurants and bar the pool and the wellness centre - before being shown to our room. This was followed by complimentary afternoon tea and pastries by the pool.  In the evening there are musicians in each of the eating areas. We ate in the Moroccan restaurant and the food was so good that we ate far too much. The tagines are so good - I had the lamb and have since bought their cookbook.  Marrakesh is extremely noisy and busy but you would not know it inside this hotel and it was very quiet at night - we previously stayed in another hotel in Marrakesh with street traders shouting above the drummers under our window until 3am every night!  We only stayed one night here (and I wish it had been longer) so left our baggage at the hotel while we explored the souks. When we returned they suggested we shower and change before our flight in the Wellness centre which was another bonus.  The staff are all very friendly and keen to help and we had a great stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mikhail V wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Luxury Boutique Hotel/Riad with Great Service
Review_Text: La Maison Arabe very nicely splits the difference between a riad and a luxury hotel. The service is very friendly and helpful but the hotel has excellent facilities including a beautiful hammam that tend to come with larger luxury hotels. We really appreciated the nice car that they provided to take us to Essaouira. Our room was a junior suite overlooking the pool which is stunning at night. The hotel is within the medina but not in the heart of it. It is nicely removed from some of the chaos. I will say that the food prices were far too high at the hotel. I do not like to gripe over pricing but we paid New York prices for food and that is too much in Morocco. (The cooking class is also too expensive.) I will say that the food is excellent at the hotel's two restaurants and it is clearly a point of pride.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our second visit and we weren't disappointed. Super hotel fantastic staff. Good food and a lovely atmosphere. Very relaxing. It was difficult to come back to reality! This is the only hotel we have ever returned to again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is full of character and positioned in the medina so location wise you will need to keep an open mind it is not so obvious in terms of curtsied appeal. having said that the hotel itself is very nice traditional and comfortable. The outstanding feature of the hotel is the standard of service which was really very good by any standards I have experienced - friendly and courteous without being formal or stuffy. The staff provided afternoon tea and wonderful traditional biscuits which made for a relaxing and cosy afternoon. It was cold during my stay so despite the sun you need some warm layers. We tried the country club which was charming and the staff there equally as polite and attentive the pool there is lovely and the gardens very nice. The cookery class was fun and well worth it fun and extremely well done I guarantee you will be impressed it is rather sophisticated - you can do it at the hotel or at the country club - the country club is a better more spacious location. The only weak point was the spa which was not a strength not worth it. Food was great although just like any international high end hotel so we felt rather expensive particularly the traditional Moroccan restaurant. The cocktail; bar on the other hand was great we eat there several evenings and the head barman was exceptionally good: fun a big personality - great service you must try. Overall very good and we would absolutely go back. It is not luxurious but it very comfortable and beautifully done.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Patricia C wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: A group of fourteen friends stayed four nights at La Maison Arabe during the first week of March. We have traveled all over the world and would put this hotel right at the top of our list of favorites. The hotel is French owned and is furnished with beautiful antiques and everything is designed for comfort. There are only 26 rooms I believe and they are all spacious suites. Ours had a living room. large bedroom very modern bath and a private balcony with bougainvillea blooming on it. We thought the food and the service were outstanding. We highly recommend La Maison Arabe.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A beautiful haven from all the hussle and bussle
Review_Text: We stayed here in March enjoying all that this fabulous place could offer but after four days felt ready to move on to the Atlas mountains for peace and tranquility. None-the-less we had fantastic food here and hammam was absolutely fantastic. The staff were all extremely pleasant and helpful especially the man on reception who gave us lots of good advice. My one quibble would be the fact we were charged for the coffee we made in our own room. I have never had this charge in any other hotel I have ever stayed in and felt it was rather 'penny-pinching'.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Isabel D wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We stayed in February when temperatures were expected to be about 14 degrees but the skies were cloudless and it was possible to eat outside with heaters moved to wherever our hearts desired if necessary or just by being sheltered in the lovely suntrap terraces.  It really was the most wonderful hotel I have ever experienced. The staff were delightful smilingwelcoming and thoughtfully provided every service with great professionalism and without being obsequious.  The place itself is a delight with open fires dotted around including in our suite(which was a free upgrade) beautiful decor with every modern facility whilst retaining a truly authentic atmosphere.  We had the three day package which included a walking tour(wear comfy shoes) which showed us places which we would probably never have found ourselves and if we had possibly would not have found our way back! Also included was the horse-drawn carriage tour in and around the medina which was great fun and expanded our knowledge of the city.  We struggled to leave this haven and I would return in a heartbeat
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Priya R wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Wonderful and Luxurious experience in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: I stayed at La Maison Arabe in March with my sister as a treat for her birthday and had a wonderful time. Our room was upgraded at no extra charge and it was magnificent. A three storey luxurious hideaway right in the heart of the Medina. The food was absolutely first class. Top prize must go to Adil Chaif the front of house manager - what a guy - customer service at it's best!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: BEAUTIFUL WELL LOCATED HOTEL WITH GOOD RATES AND NICE STAFF
Review_Text: Hotel is outstanding nicely decorated in every corner. The ammenities and the room are perfect. Best Riad in Marrakech for sure. Beautiful restaurants nice bars and patios. The manager is always helpful. price is more than fair for a place as nice as this. One tip though- make sure you stick to the check out time they value the incoming constumers as much as the outgoing ones. Will definitely stay here next time. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hetta M wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: This hotel is absolutely beautiful. It is Morocco at it's finest. They also have a property in the country which is also lovely. It is there that they hold their cooking classes. I highly recommend the cooking class even if you're not totally into food prep. It's great fun to see how Moroccan food is prepared. All of the staff is gracious and most speak multiple languages.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Fulvio C wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We spent three days there. In the Suite Royale. Difficult to comment simply fantastic  People working there were best we ever had in a Hotel  Very good Restaurant with good choice of wines but what remains in our minds is the Terrace over our room!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Wan T wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: This is my umpteenth visit to Marrakech and I've stayed in lots of different hotels and other riads. But La Maison Arabe is very special. Firstly the staff are excellent - from the booking experience to the welcome - this is service of an extraordinary standard.  Some of the carpets are getting a little tired (stairwell to the pool) but it all adds to the authenticity. It really is a beautiful vast riad that is made up of several riads that have been combined over the years. It was good to see the same faces as it's been two years since I last stayed here and the staff are still the same.  I had a cough on arrival but was promptly supplied with a ginger and herbal concoction to cure my ills.  You have to have a hammam! This is the best it gets in Marrakech - outstanding. Can't recommend this oasis highly enough - it's worth every single penny and probably more.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: We only ate in the restaurant but.....
Review_Text: It was fantastic. A real high point of our culinary visit to Morocco. It started out with a delicious fig/olive tapenade and carrot orange soup progressed to a fantastic monkfish tagine and chicken with preserved lemons and olives tagine. Everything was delicious and so richly flavorful and the setting by the pool was incredible. Out only regret was we didn't come every night for dinner and if it hadn't been our last night we certainly would have. The server was the sweetest and most attentive and I could kick myself that I can't remember his name but I did compliment him to the manager. I asked if it was possible to get any of their recipes and he brought me out a calendar/recipe book that I will certainly be using. I wish I could go back tonight.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: james m wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: La Maison Arabe was a fantastic hotel with 6 star service!!! We stayed 5 days and was impressed more and more every day. Every staff member was 1st class and caring. Stellar from the front desk to the restaurant to the car service.  The country club 15 minutes away was amazing. Great pool garden and lovely lunch.  Again service was top notch with HEART!    We highly recommend La Maison Arabe!    Jim and Suzi
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: matt B wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: This is a beautiful centrally located hotel in the middle of Marrakech. The rooms were very clean and the beds comfortable. There are 2-3 restaurants and they are excellent! Wonderful breakfast is included! The courtyard is gorgeous with a pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is located just a few minutes walk from the Souk. The entrance is off a typical bustling Marrakech street but as soon as you turn into the surprisingly clean and wide "alley" leading to the hotel you get a sense that you are about to enter a peaceful Oasis. The hotel does not disappoint. The hotel as its name alludes to is a large luxurious arab style house. The decor combined with the very friendly and attentive service it made us feel like we were guests being welcomed into the house of a Marrakech nobleman.    After being served mint tea and some interesting juice drinks we were taken to our room. We were upgraded to a large suite which was very tastefully appointed and even had a private verandah! The bed was great and the room had all of the modern amenities one would expect in a nice hotel. None of the street noise came through and we had a great nights sleep.    We ordered room service for breakfast. The traditional pancake with the works (olives onions etc.) was delicious and the pastry basket was good. I would also recommend the chicken tagine in the traditional Berber restaurant downstairs.    An enjoyable stay. I would definitely recommend La Maison Arab over the generic soul-less 4 and 5 star hotels that are becoming more prevalent in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: JoeAnne D wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: Really enjoyed the hotel spacious room and full of character. Great cooking classes given in a very professional setting.  The food in the restaurant was delicious  had the pleasure of 3 lovely dinners.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Fraser M wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: The hotel was beautiful. The welcome drinks were delicious. The staff were all really friendly and i loved my stay. This is hands down the best hotel i have ever stayed in. It was luxurious cosy and clean. The food and service was outstanding and it is in a great area for visiting the souks. Absolutely no complaints and cannot fault this exemplary establishment.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Morag S wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: This was the day before decision. My girlfriend arranged it all. We wanted some sun. I had no idea what to expect! I was a little concerned when our hotel taxi service arrived at an alleyway and got our bags out. la Maison Arabe is situated down an alleyway  the approach totally belies what lies behind the facade .The staff from start to end were friendly courteous and efficient. We were in a junior suite which had a large terraced balcony overlooking the outside restaurant. It was extremely comfortable. As was my bed. The restaurant in the hotel was really reasonably priced and the food delicious. The staff were attentive and could not do enough to ensure we enjoyed a good dinning experience with them. This was true of all our meals at the hotel. Breakfast was a "feast" really delightful. The only reason I would go back to Marrakech would be to enjoy another experience at La Maison Arabe. Thank you all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Lived up to expectation and more
Review_Text: So many of these Reviews say the same thing excellent staff stunning decor amazing location all i am going to do is reiterate every single compliment that people have made about this amazing place that I did not want to leave after 7 nights.    From Porters Front of House Restaurant Pool Bar Housekeeping every single person that works here is so friendly and are there to make your stay memorable for all the right reasons and they all succeeded.    Hotel Room: faultlessly clean daily housekeeping at all times of the day turn down service at night and a fresh bottle of water each day. Faultlessly clean. We had the most amazing private patio robes and slippers and in room safe. Coffee and mini bar are chargeable with a Moroccan beer being 60 dirham and half a bottle of white wine 100.    Moroccan Restaurant: Sumptuous surroundings excellent live music 3 choices of starter at 150 dirham and 5 choices of mains 3 tajines and 2 cous cous starting at 150 dirhams.    Restaurant by the Pool: a huge choice of moroccan cuisine and french prices start at the same as above I had the most tasty seared foie gras here that I've ever eaten. Again excellent live music too.    Room Service: A varied menu but you can also order from the restaurant menu to have that delivered to your room    Jazz Bar: i loved it in here pianist friendly staff the nibbles that you get with every drink cocktails are 100 dirhams after trying three different cocktails though i decided that there wasn't quite enough alcohol in them to hit the spot so I switched to G & T.    Wine: A varied wine list with only Moroccan wines to choose from which is fabulous bottles start at 200 dirhams.    Country Club: A tropical paradise in a bustling city 15 mins by private minibus upon arrival you receive a refreshing drink you can then order food and drinks as you wish where you see the chefs preparing and cooking the food and there is a small outside area where tables are set for dining the loungers and cabanas are luxury. Lunches here start from about 100 dirhams and drink prices the same as hotel of course it is exclusive to hotel guests and i think we shared with only 8 people max plenty of space. The large pool is colder than the hotel pool.    Hammam: this was a different experience for me I went for the royal hammam which was to last 45 mins you are given a locker robe and slippers and the tiniest piece of material held together with elasitic to wear for yout treatment. The hammam was a great experience and ladies they scrub evverywhere but one place! but the lighting in the room does not make it uncomfortable I did expect a 45 min treatment though but in actual fact it was 25 mins and then you get to lay on a bed in the spa for 20 mins. I also had deep tissue full body massage for 60 mins again this does not mean a 60 min massage but 40 mins with 20 mins laying on a bed in the spa this was my only disappointment the whole trip. Ladies be prepared they massage the whole body! And in my opinion was a good massage but nothing special.    Cookery School: what an experience watching bread been made and cooked in a wood oven making yourself two starters and then a tajine all in the most amazing kitchen with screens in front of you showing what the Dada is doing I would without question do this again. It cost 600 dirhams.    Please when budgeting for your trip here be aware that 10% is added to everything which is then distributed around the stagg they deserve every single penny of it.    Wifi throughout the hotel is efficient and very quick.    Location: easy 10 minute walk to souks or the oppostie direction 15 mins to the square perfect.    I am already planning a trip back once you've found paradise why keep looking!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gregory W wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We took a cookng class which covered chicken with preserved lemon and two Moroccan salads. The kitchen setup was excellent and the staff were very helpful and supportive. Best of all was eating my work for lunch!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed at La Maison Arabe located in the Medina close to the Souks and night market for 3 nights while we enjoyed the sights sounds and activities of Marrakech. The hotel is elegant comfortable quiet and without a doubt one of the nicest places I have stayed anywhere. We were upgraded to a wonderful suite (room 218) that had a living area a separate bedroom a private outdoor courtyard and a separate alcove sleeping area that our daughter used. We were surprised to discover that so much was included in what we first thought was a small Riad hotel including a marvelous hamam spa two excellent restaurants and a bar all with live music as well as a swimming pool surrounded by a courtyard restaurant and cooking school. The staff were very friendly and attended to our every need going out of their way to help us with guides reservations at restaurants and anything else we requested. Their goal was clearly to make us feel at home and comfortable. We would not hesitate to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kim R wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We stayed in room Ziad for 3 nights which was probably one of the less expensive rooms. We slept under a brick dome ceiling which was beautiful. The hotel staff were so kind to both of us especially when my husband had a cold. They organised for him to have a special drink to help with his cold which consisted of honey limes cumin ginger and cinnamon (plus other secret ingredients) and it worked a treat. The riad was an oasis of calm and sophistication. The location was perfect for seeing the medina and souks and only 10 mins walk to the famous square. Breakfast was excellent. We stayed in 3 riads in Morocco and this was our favourite.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Spent a week at the Maison Arabe and this proved to be a high point of our entire visit to Morocco. Its entry is extremely discreet and understated on an unassuming side street. Behind that entry lies an absolute jewel of a hotel. Impeccable taste distinguishes each room the scale is perfect and the location leaves the guest within easy walking distance of the Souk. Not that you'd ever want to leave the hotel. Two lovely restaurants a wonderful hamam pool bar...They have thought of everything. What really distinguishes the Maison Arabe though is its hospitality spontaneous and genuine on the part of everyone on staff. I have never been made to feel so welcome so genuinely at home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kanchan T wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: This is a truly beautiful hotel within the Medina. Lots of nooks and crannies to explore. Gorgeous furniture and carpets. As it was my birthday we were upgraded to a 3 storey de luxe suite with our own roof garden and guest bathroom. Wonderfully attentive staff who give a mobile phone so that they can come and rescue you if you get lost in the medina!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Philippe D wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Very friendly house with style and atmosphere, best location to visit the Medina
Review_Text: House with charme style and atmosphere very friendly and helpful staff wonderful breakfast buffet around the swimming pool a nice place to eat outside even when it's raining. An oasis of peace after touring around.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jane W wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 nights to celebrate my 50th. It was just lovely. The service was friendly and unbelievably helpful the atmosphere quiet and relaxed and the room we had (Sindhbad number 11) quiet and comfortable. The location is perfect for the souks and sightseeing. We ate at the Moroccan restaurant on our first night the food was excellent. We struck some great weather so headed out to the country club a few times - really relaxing and the same friendly quiet atmosphere. A perfect place for a luxury break and highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful, amazing hotel and experience! The best!
Review_Text: Beautiful beautiful charming hotel. The hotel has many nooks and crannies and is everything I had hoped for. We had the Jaafar suite which was breathtaking and charming. Huge bathroom with separate shower and tub toilet area and double vanity and sinks. Separate living room interior terrace another side area long hallway the suite was very large and spacious. The Jazz Bar in the hotel was very well designed and had a very comforting relaxing atmosphere. Staff from check-in to check-out took care of you very well. Breakfast is included and was very healthy plentiful and fresh. Two restaurants so no need to traverse back into the old medina after a day of touring when excellent restaurants are available at the hotel. I wish I was at the jazz bar right now.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Diana J wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: A truly outstanding hotel!!  Absolutely exceptional service along with such friendliness from the staff nothing was too much trouble.  We were upgraded to the best suite in the hotel which was a lovely surprise and provided us with excellent comfort and as other guests have commented the decor atmosphere and ambience was so Moroccan along with wonderful breakfasts and dinners what more can I say except a truly wonderful Oasis !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tracey S wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Visited with my Partner for his birthday. Service was fantastic. Free upgrade without asking was really special. Food was best in Marrakech. Would recommend the Hammam too. Amazing experience. No complaints at all and will definitely be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: First class service ! Would only stay here if I go back to Marrakech !
Review_Text: Amazing hotel excellent service with five star luxury yet in keeping with traditional decor and atmosphere five star luxury food is first class staff everywhere can't do enough for you to make your stay special Spa wonderful and fantastic range of treatments Jazz Bar had great ambience with piano player in the background. Great range of cocktails. Porters waiters reception managers all so friendly and go out of their way to help with any query Hotel Taxis not expensive and worth using for comfort and knowledge you have a ride home or to the airport etc without having to haggel with the price ! Manager was outstanding. Welcome drinks on arrival afternoon tea every day cleaners and housekeeping outstanding pool very clean and heated Sun deck on roof terrace of hotel complimentary WIFI available everywhere value for money is excellent. Coffee machine in room is chargeable as part of the mini bar which we didnt realise but wasn't expensive so not an issue. I could go on and on about this amazing hotel and how much we loved it but all I will say is BOOK THIS HOTEL you WONT be disappointed ! ITS FAB !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Jean-Pierre K wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Just excellent and great care for details
Review_Text: SERVICE is spelt in Capital letters and applies absolutely everywhere in this Hotel.  DINNERS and BREAKFASTS were awesome. Delicious food was served by very friendly staff.  ROOMS are luxurious furnished with good taste and express with their refinement true Arabic hospitality. The same applies for the decoration of all other parts of this Riad i.e. for the lounges restaurants and other common facilities. A truely quaint romantic and cosy place to be a place we can really recommend !  ... and - cherry on the cake - was receiving from the reception at the check-out the already fully filled imigration forms for the airport  To Management and Staff of La Maison Arabe Marrakech thank you for our two wonderful stays we certainly wll treasure in our memories.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Matt P wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: The Epitome of Service and Luxury in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: We had a wonderful 4 nights in this high quality hotel in the Medina of Marrakech. There is much to compliment the high standards which are provided by this 5 Star Hotel. This memorable experience began as soon as we arrived at the hotel reception area- our room was given a free upgrade to a suite with an adjoining private courtyard & seating area!!  The Fine Dining experiences provided at both the 'Morrocan' and 'Les Trois Saveurs' restaurants were exceptional with the excellent choices of local cuisine and a high standard of service. We did not dine at the Piano Bar during our stay but this also was a bar area of high ambiance and quality. Breakfast was served by the poolside with an excellent selection of local juices breads fruit and freshly cooked eggs and crepes!!  During our stay we had the pleasure of experiencing the delights of the Hammam & Wellness centre in the basement area of the hotel- the massages and skin treatments were truly worthwhile after a long day in the heat & hassles of the markets and we would recommend that you book well ahead of your stay. The hotel has its own pool area in the main building but for a much more relaxing experience a trip to the country club during the afternoon is a great way to relax the rest of the day away- a free mini luxury shuttle is provided every hour by the hotel for this 20 minute journey to the edge of town.  The very helpful reception staff and management were also able to provide a tailor made trip for us to the foothills of the Atlas Mountains as well as return transfers to the airport- both offered very good value with an excellent local guide called Abdullah provided throughout.  I was particularly impressed with the service and friendliness offered by the hotel reception team when my wife became ill one evening- an offer of specific medication and sustenance to help with her recovery was much appreciated and helpful at the time. These are the little extras that make the hotel the excellent place that it is.  All in all a great location and high level of luxury for a trip to Marrakech whether on business or for a holiday. Close enough to the tourist sights but within its own oasis of elegance.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mark g wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: We spent 5 days in Marrakech and had a wonderful lunch at La Maison Arabe. For me it was the best beef tagine I had on our trip- which includes the very expensive restaurant at La Mamounia. Service was prompt and attentive; the setting was poolside and beautiful; it was a nice respite from the hustle and bustle of the medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We visited here on recommendation from our friends and what a good choice! We started off at the Jazz bar and with some drinks and olives and nuts on the house. The best okives I have ever had! The staff are lovely and impeccable service. It was a cool night but we sat out side near the pool with the heaters. The food was fabulous! Recommend it to anyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Five star luxury in the medina
Review_Text: We stayed here four nights eating at the Jazz bar and also the Morroccan restaurant as well as the complimentary breakfasts and afternoon teas. We took the complimentary shuttle to the country club and my wife had a massage in the hammam.    Everything was pretty faultless. The food in particular was superb -- I'd be surprised if you could get better in Marrakech. Nice that you can get this quality of accommodation and food inside the medina. When you step out of the hotel entrance you are right in the thick of the rabbit warren of alleys that lead to the souks though it's only a short walk to the nearest taxi-friendly road. Maybe a little less authentic than some of the central riads but it's nice to have a pool you can swim in.    Hard to complain about the country club as it was free. Pool large and chlorine-free but unheated so for serious swimmers only (probably warmer in high summer). I think it is rather stretching things to describe it as a country club; more a garden with a pool.    My wife tells me the hammam was excellent -- peaceful atmosphere and great massage.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Juan B wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Perfect setting and great food and atmosphere
Review_Text: We dined at the International Restaurant at la Maison Arabe to celebrate a special occasion while visiting Marrakech. We chose the International Restaurant as there was a large group dining in the Moroccan Restaurant that evening. This information was provided to us when we visited the hotel earlier that day. When inquiring about making a reservation for the restaurant we were treated to a full tour of both restaurants as well as the kitchen where open cooking classes take place and also the spa where you can book a hammam and massage for 650dirham.  The International Restaurant exquisitely encircles a courtyard pool which provides for a very romantic ambience with ornate candlelight and traditional Moroccan musical accompaniment. The setting was perfect and the service was good. The menu offers a selection of both international as well as Moroccan dishes; so even when choosing to eat at the “international” restaurant you can still avail of a full Moroccan menu but without the option of tasting platters - which is only available in the Moroccan restaurant. Nonetheless it was a difficult choice to make from a very inclusive menu even when limiting ourselves to the more traditional Moroccan selection. The traditional salads to-start is most recommendable and there is also a generous range of lamb dishes as main courses as well as fish and vegetarian dishes.  We started the evening with a cocktail in the jazz bar which was recommended to us by the staff as well. Here we were amongst fellow tourists of course but the atmosphere was comfortable and the service excellent with fantastic drinks and the complimentary provision of olives and nuts as snacks. This was overall a very enjoyable experience in a relaxed environment. As a bonus we were given a calendar with recipes from the hotel kitchen at the end of our meal – a very special souvenir to remember a beautiful evening and hopefully a way of capturing some of those memorable Moroccan flavours in a meal of our own back home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Luxury, an oasis of tranquility in Marrakech
Review_Text: Great rooms excellent service. It is a high scale oasis inside the busy Marrakech caos. If you want to relax and forget about anything stay there ask for a mint tea and have dinner around that area surrounded by olive trees.  Make sure you call them to book with a lot of anticipation they are always full.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Keith H wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Fantastic week in Marrakech at this wonderful hotel.  Superbly located beautiful rooms excellent food and possibly the best service I've ever experienced.  Thanks team for all your hard work.  My only gripe is the disturbed sleep because of the call to prayer not that they could do much about that - apart maybe from earplugs.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed two nights in this delightful hotel. Started by being taken into a lounge area and given a refreshing drink. Just nice to have something different than the usual mint tea. The hotel arranged a guide at a very reasonable price Abdul (Abderrahmane Belmoudden) which made it lot easier to get around the first day. Would highly recommend letting them arrange a guide on the first day in Marrakech. The service and staff were excellent. The breakfast buffet by the pool is lovely and was a nice change from most of the riads. Enjoyed the piano- jazz bar. The drinks and the music were excellent. Eat at Les Trois Saveurs one evening which was very good but not as good as Gastro MK. Hope to be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Sara B wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Unforgettable weekend in a beautiful oasis
Review_Text: Staying at La Maison Arabe for our wellness weekend among 5 friends was the best choice ever. Discovering this authentic jewel in the narrow streets of the Medina was even better than the excellent reviews could describe. We were suddenly transported into another world a pleasure for all senses with attention to detail in every corner. The architecture authentic design and decorations are stunning. We stayed in the Royal Suite which was amazing spacious and with a private terrasse.    The welcome and service was excellent (thanks so much for the welcome bottle!) everyone was very friendly with smiling faces and most helpful.    The spa is beautifully decorated with majestic lamps and the traditional hammam  was a unique experience followed by a fantastic massage.    The restaurants are both very good and well situated. The first evening we had dinner at the Moroccan restaurant and were very impressed with the quality of the lamb melting in our mouths like butter. The food was delicious. The second evening we ate at the restaurant “Trois Saveurs” and really enjoyed staying by the pool next to the beautiful live and relaxing music. We had our first breakfast on our private terrasse which was a treat as we could soak the sun and see the roofs of Marrakech but the delicious breakfast served by the pool the next morning was even better with so much choice. Really loved the morrocan pancakes and fresh juices. The jazz bar was a great relaxing experience too with great music.    The location is perfect. Very close to the airport and an easy 10 minutes walk to the Jemaa e-fns square. We were accompanied by a local guide recommended by the hotel and we had an excellent afternoon in the Medina. The only regret I could have is that our stay was too short to try the cooking lesson and the swimming pool country club. Would love to go back and will definitely recommend La Maison Arabe.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Service in this beautiful hotel where each room is unique and the atmosphere happy respectful and friendly is shown in small but multiple acts of kindness. La Maison Arabe management could teach most European hotels a tremendous amount about how to train their staff to be unobtrusive but still enhance the client's experience and serve their needs.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Top notch accommodation, but retains character and colour
Review_Text: There are I'm sure more expensive glossier hotels in Marrakech. But I doubt any can compare to the experience enjoyed at Maison Arabe.    The accommodation itself is faultless. The rooms are highly equipped forensically clean comfortable and decorated to a high standard. We experienced two rooms - one for the duration of our stay and one for a late check out. Both were of a very high standard.    The food is wonderfully Moroccan with tagines chicken and couscous being firm favourites. The bar has a jazz pianist some evenings and Rachid the head barman will ply you with cocktails to your heart's content.    But it is the service which sets this place above others. The attention from staff is second to none (and without any obsequiousness). Adil Chaif the front office manager is a mult-tasker extraordinaire. Speaking umpteen languages he will arrange anything for you at any time.    We took advantage of the in house spa to have a hammam and deep tissue massage. A word to the ladies our (shared) hammam was given by a woman but unlike Turkish baths I've been to before they wash your entire top half (and will remove bikini tops or roll down swimsuits). Likewise the massage. I'd definitely visit the spa again but a word of warning would have been helpful !    We also went to the country club affiliated to the riad. Only riad guests can visit. It's about a 15 minute taxi ride away and you use the hotel shuttle. We were the only people there and it was beautiful. The unheated pool was still too cold in late Feb but we paddled and sunbathed. The ride there is any eye-opener in itself.    All in all we loved our visit. There aren't many easy-to-reach places within 3 and a half hours of the UK which are pretty warm in February but we had temperatures in the low 20s the entire time (but they plummet at night so you need a sweater).    Marrakech is exotic colourful and very un-European so it was an exciting three days topped off with flopping on sun beds at the country club.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lois B wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: This is the third time I have had a group at La Maison Arabe and the fourteen of us were there for four nights. None of us wanted to leave when it was time to travel on to Essaouira. They are the supreme example for all other hotels...from start to finish! Amazing! Thank you for an absolutely wonderful four nights.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It is wise to make a reservation here but because we we're early we had a table. We had the best tajines in a week and the good service excellent food and nice atmosphere made us come back another day in the one week we we're in Marrakech. It's also a hotel and a Spa.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Trevor D wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: This was an excellent hotel on all counts and a wonderful place to come back to after spending the day in busy bustling Marrakech. Room we were in was large and very comfortable. The riad generally was very well appointed and the food was good. The riad is close to the action of the city. The staff were helpful and very pleasant. we would certainly recommend La Maison Arabe to others.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A 5* Riad with a personal touch
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at La Maison Arabe at the end of Feb/early March for a week. As well as a city break and some sun we needed a much needed chance to recharge our batteries and the Riad ticked all the boxes. I booked directly and my emails were answered quickly. I had asked for a couple of items which were not standard in the rooms and when we arrived they were already there. Adil was always friendly and nothing was too much trouble for him!    Afternoon tea was served every day anywhere you liked and believe me there are lots of different places to have it! When we first arrived it seemed like a maze of little rooms but it added to the character. The decor was amazing and turning day into night was done with taste. We booked a deluxe garden room which was on the second floor and overlooked the pool. We were able to sit on the balcony and listen to the music from the restaurant but if we closed our windows we couldn't hear a thing. The room was very comfortable. The bed was one of the comfiest I have slept in. We ate in both restaurants and found them equally excellent and I have written a separate review. On our first night I was serenaded and presented with a birthday cake as the manager had seen from my passport that it had recently been my birthday. Breakfast by the pool was a lovely leisurely start to the day. The biggest problem was deciding what to have! Nothing was too much for the staff and they were attentive but not intrusive but always happy for a chat.    The country club was well worth a visit. It's very calm and food is just as good as at the hotel. The water was cold but heated up during the course of our week but I actually like cold water! The hotel was well situated for walking to everything and we felt safe. We did a trip to the Ourika valley with a driver called Abdullah who was tremendous. We did it on a Saturday and as a result visited a local market which was very different to the Souk! I could go on and on but other reviews say it all The staff deserve a special mention for their attentiveness and friendly service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Who could have thought that down this uninspired lane there was such an inspired hotel.  There was a real "soul" to the riad - the staff went out of their way to make you feel wanted without being patronising.  The Restaurants were great!  And unless you knew La Maison's 'hidden secret' you would never have found the Country Club. What an amazing hideaway. We more or less had this to ourselves - a great pool bar snacks and a haven of peace and quiet.  There were so many positives about the hotel - too numerable to mention; we didn't find any negatives.  Our first trip to Morocco and this riad made it memorable.  Thank you to all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Articulate A wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Truly wonderful hotel, I can't recommend it enough
Review_Text: I stayed here for a week in February and had an excellent time. The staff were incredibly attentive for example on the first morning I ordered a large black decaf coffee with my breakfast the following morning they greeted me by name and asked if I would like a large black decaf coffee. They also noticed that I walked with a limp and on my third day they said that a room without stairs had become free and asked if I would like them to upgrade me to that room free of charge. I left my key with reception when I went out and when I got back they had moved all my stuff for me.  One night I ate at a restaurant outside the hotel and not only did the doorman walk me to the restaurant so I didn't get lost but they also gave me a mobile phone programmed with the hotel's number so I could phone when I wanted to be escorted back to the hotel. They made it clear that it was safe for me to walk around on my own - the service was only to avoid me getting lost.  I decided mid-week that I wanted to do the hotel's cookery course. As I was the only person booked on that afternoon's course they offered me the option of taking the course at the hotel or their country club. I said that as I was the only person booked on the course then I was happy to change date but they inisted that they would run the course as it was my preferred date. I choose to take the course at the hotel. They said that the course finished at 6pm and people usually ate the food they had cooked at the end of the course however as they knew I preferred to eat at 8pm then they would keep my food and I could have it in the restaurant at 8pm.  I went out to the Country Club one afternoon and was planning to catch the 6pm hourly shuttle back to the hotel. The sunset at 5.15pm and I started to get very cold. I spoke to the member of staff there and he said that as the Country Club closed at 6pm and I was the only person there was a chance that he might be able to get the shuttle bus to come and pick me up early. He phoned the driver and he picked me up about 10 minutes later.  All these little helpful things really made my holiday one that will stay special in my memory.    Additonally the beds were exceedingly comfortable the showers nicely powerful and the location superb.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: My family have just enjoyed a fabulous 4 night stay in the Royal Suite with Roof terrace & spa bath... (well worth the extra). It was my wife’s 60th birthday treat & the service was exceptional throughout....nothing was too much trouble for the staff from arranging birthday photographer spa treatments & transport to places of interest. Dining was a enjoyable & interesting delight.  We were lucky enough to have great weather in early March & enjoyed the facilities of the Country Club including the exceptional Cooking School.  This is a hotel that we will definitely return to. Well done & thank you to all at La Maison Arabe
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Probably one of the best places I have ever stayed
Review_Text: With only 26 rooms and suites you can tell. The service and staff were unbelievable. We had the cheapie room compared to what you could have paid but apart of the square footage it made no  difference to the stay. My room is the only think I had any fault with. The breakfast was excellent as was the courtesy shuttle  to the out of town swimming pool lounge area.  Will definitely stay again.

Review_Title: make sure you use the Hammam
Review_Text: There has been lots written on Trip Advisor about this stunningly lovely friendly and unostentatiously luxurious riad-style hotel. As a very frequent traveller I'm often a bit cynical... but this place really delivers and there's nothing I would improve.    Highlights are these;    The staff who are unfailingly courteous helpful interested polite and anxious to ensure that you have all that you might need.    The rooms we overlooked the central (heated) pool in the middle of the building/s with a view of the nearby mosque. It was wonderful fresh flowers and fruit a huge and comfortable bed... every small luxury you can imagine.    The Hammam.... not something that would be "my thing" but I went with my wife. The room is underground is extremely pleasant and relaxing nice lights very chilled-out atmosphere and great treatments... we had a fairly basic massage and this was fabulous.    The food; both restaurants are great I probably preferred the Moroccan but both were good. Beware of the "set menu" unless you have a vast appetite all great but huge quantities.    The cookery course... great fun in a pleasant setting 100% suitable for non-cooks and fun for those who usually make dinner! Nice to sit under a tree eating the lunch you just made making new friends.    Trip to the Atlas mountains.... super.    Outside the hotel there's a zillion things to do and see... I would strongly recommend the old Koranic school for the architecture skip the museum the souk is what it is and is unavoidable.... all in all a great place for a great time... three or four days
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kathryn M wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at La Maison Arabe for 4 nights in December while on a 3+ week tour of Morocco. This was a fabulous riad away from the bustling medina but within close proximity. While the lobby was modest our room which was a suite was wonderful. It overlooked the pool and had a large balcony which we used to relax in the late afternoon after sight seeing. The service was first rate. The manager of the bar made great drinks and was very personable and warm clearly proud of his job. Each morning we were greater by a welcoming staff who made certain everything at breakfast was to our liking. One night we had dinner in their Moroccan restaurant and it was excellent with great service. To demonstrate how helpful the staff was a young man at the front desk downloaded an app to my husband's phone so we would not have to use the hotel phone. We also took a cooking class in their world class cooking school. Every step was thoroughly explained while we completed our tajines and Morrocan salads at our own cooking station later to eat our creations by the beautiful pool.  We would highly recommend this riad to anyone who wants to experience luxury at its best and fine dining.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John R wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: My wife and I have recently returned form our second visit.  There may be 1000 raids in Marrakech but for us there is only the best La Maison Arabe.  We suggest you try it. The ambiance the foodthe warmth of the welcome you will receive from all the lovely staff will make your stay a wonderful and rewarding experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great hotel, lot of charme and a bit on italian touch
Review_Text: We (family of 3) stayed in La Maison for four days mid-February and everything was perfect.  The Riad is well placed for all the amenities -casbah place Jamaa-el-Fna main buildings museums and Mosques- but in a calm and peaceful corner just outside the bustle of the city.  Starting from the car at the airport everything has been irreproachable: the check-in very fast desk personnel efficient and very gentle other personnel (from the cleaning ladies to the waiters as well the porters) always impeccable.  Our patio suite very spacious clean well equipped (though we missed a phone dock for some music) with a lovely small fitted patio where to enjoy a cigarette under the stars.  Food in the Moroccan restaurant was good the breakfast sumptuous with a huge variety of different foods (a special mention to the viennoiserie delicious).  A feel-at-home sensation which has made our stay hard to forget.  Last but not least I wish to thank all the front desk personnel for the help and support provided to extend my wife and son stay after I realised I messed up with the plane reservation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jonathan M wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: It doesn't get any better than this!
Review_Text: There are some beautiful hotels in the world. Then there is Maison Arabe. Its in a class of its own. The building is charming having been built by converting 6 riads and adding a new extension whilst maintaining the character of the original. However what sets this hotel above all others we have stayed in (including Palazzo Sasso and Le Manor aux Quart Saisons) is the fantastic staff. Nowhere have we met such dedicated and friendly staff who go out of their way to help ensure that your stay is the best it can be. The two hotel restaurants were superb and very good value for the quality and all the waiters ensured that our daughter had no nuts in anything she ate (due to her severe nut allergy) The hotel manager is very friendly and makes guest feel very welcome. Staying in Marrakech it is a real treat to return at the need of the day to such a fantastic hotel. We shall return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Alex R wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Fabulous high-quality riad run by charming people
Review_Text: We (family of five) stayed in this amazing hotel for 3 nights. It is an oasis in the middle of the bustle of the city. We were upgraded to two beautiful suites and were made to feel immediately welcome. The Moroccan restaurant served delicious food as does the international one and the breakfast is very special. Various Moroccan pancakes are made to order as are egg dishes and there is a huge selection of all sorts of delicious things. The pool was sadly not heated during our stay (end of February) but there is the opportunity to go to the country club 15 mins away to spend time at the pool.  I cannot emphasise enough how special the staff are. They were charming observant welcoming always at hand and took great care of our children.They gave us all possible support and really went out of their way to help.  The Hammam is beautiful and fulfils every possible wish.  This really is Morocco at its best!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A place of stylish calm, amidst the madness of Marrakech!
Review_Text: I'm so glad many other reviews of La Maison Arabe were really good - this place deserves them and it certainly helped my decision to stay there. My wife and I stayed for 4 nights at the end of February and we had a most enjoyable stay. There isn't much I can say that hasn't been said in other reviews but like those I would agree the place is simply stunning. The hotel is ideally situated from the main square and the souks (about a 10/15min walk) and it was just so nice to come back to a beautiful place after some dusty days walking. The owner has made a great job at blending the old part with the new and maintaining that rustic but sytlish Morrocan feel. Our room (garden/pool view suite) was very spacious extremely clean well equipment and was a great place to be and unwind. We found the restaurants to be very good the food the service and the price wasn't too bad. We had a drink (or two) in the Jazz bar on a few occasions and whilst it was fairly quiet for us it was still a lovely place to have a drink with the impecable service of the staff there (thank you). Above all else the staff at La Maison were wonderful. Nothing was too much of a problem whatever you asked for you got and their knowledge of the area was extremely helpful. My wife and I were celebratng our 9th wedding anniversary during our stay and we decided to have a hamman and massage - wow wee - it was simply amazing. The spa at the hotel is a lovely calm and well designed space.....a real getaway from the hussle and bussle of Marrakech. That evening we dined at the hotel's Morrocan restaurant and opted for the tasting menu - great idea as we got to taste a bit of everything. Good portion sizes and lots to eat washed down with some rather nice Morrocan red vino. We were then presented with a choclolate cake as a surprise for our anniversary - what a nice touch! After breakfast brought to our room on Thursday (another great touch - but having it outside is as equally nice) we decided to go for the Morrocan cooking session and chose to do this at the sister resort 15mins outside of the Medina. What a beautiful place. We loved the cooking morning and the staff and service (again) were impecable. My wife and I stayed for the rest of the afternoon and lazed around on the sunbeds by the pool - utter bliss! . I defy anyone who doesn't like this place - it's great and yes it may be more expensive than some but you get what you pay for and what we got we were totally happy with. Well done La Maison Arabe. You made our first trip to Marrakech a memorable one and hopefully not the only one :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: As good as the reviews say
Review_Text: Just returned from a long weekend visit to La Maison Arabe. The hotel is pricier than others but well worth the extra money. It's in an excellent location about 10 mins walk from all the action but far enough away to provide respite from the tourist spots. We stayed in a room in the old part rather than over the pool area. Our room was great- large with its own patio area. I am sure the pool ones would be good too but the pool area is the hub of the hotel providing the restaurant for breakfast lunch and dinner so I expect it might be noisy if you are an early to bed person. The pool area is very scenic though and you would get a view which we didn't have in our room.It was our first visit to Marrakech and the experience in the souks and walking on the roads with all the different types of traffic can be a little overwhelming so it is worth finding a good hotel that isn't too far away and that you are comfortable in.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely hotel in a great spot to visit the city. The restaurants are excellent albeit the price is more or less what you would expect in a nice place in Europe. Spa treatments are really quite good as well yet once again not cheap (the access to the hamman is not for free and must be reserved). Lots of stairs so those who have mobility issues should think twice. Reception and staff are extremely helpful though the restaurant is quite slow (it took over half an hour to have a sandwich)... No early checkin (we arrived at 11.30 and had to wait till exactly 2.00 before getting our rooms) and I strongly advise doing the checkout the evening before departure if you have an early flight.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Liz S wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: The staff were wonderful nothing was too much trouble. All the meals we had were excellent and our room was beautiful. The whole hotel was clean and welcoming with open fires in the public areas to take the chill off in the evening. The courtyard was a wonderful place for a cup of mint tea in the afternoon. It was an easy walk to the main square and souks. A guide is definitely recommended for visiting the souks or for a trip into the foothills of the Atlas mountains. A lovely few days away from the British winter.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for 4 nights at this fantastic oasis of well-run calm in a hectic and challenging city. It's bigger with better facilities than a normal Riad but smaller than a chain hotel. The staff did everything and more to make the stay an enjoyable one and from the moment we got there we felt like we were being looked after by old friends. It was a cold spell during our stay but the hotel was always warm with enough eating-in space as well as lots of heaters for outdoor dining too. Our room overlooked the pool and was large well-equipped with a nice bathroom. Room service was efficient and totally unobtrusive. Both restaurants at the hotel are really good - so much so that we only ate out once in the evening (La Sultana) choosing to eat at the Moroccan restaurant twice as well as once at the international restaurant. Breakfast had a lot of choice and the chance to sample some Moroccan specialities too. The hotel is well-located for most of the tourist spots being just inside the Medina.
