Review_Date: Nicola C wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Text: Excellent in every way very friendly staff reception organised all of restaurants and trips. Very helpful and more then accommodating. The spa is devine the Hammas is a must have experience. Definitely get a guide for the souks very educational and great fun. Put it on your list today!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed for just 48 hours but we were blown away by the superb service excellent rooms sumptuous Hammam and great food. The cookery school is an absolute must - I understand why it is famous: we really enjoyed the 4 hours including hands on cooking of authentic local cuisine visiting the local bakery and spice market - just fabulous. It helped that it was end January and yet 24 degrees centigrade though cool at night. La Maison is well located in a very traditional quarter with most attractions within reasonable walking difference.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My stay in the Riad was too short! I would return there tomorrow.The hotel is amazing and is a big bonus to your stay in Marrakech. The decoration is beautifulin such good taste the staff really helpful and the breakfast healthy and abundant. I didn't get a chance to use the Spa just because of lack of time. I would return there tomorrow.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed here for 5 days. The best of the best. Hotel 10 restaurant 10 emplyees 10. We love it and we will be back.

Review_Date: Josh L wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Text: Recently we enjoyed an elaborate lunch pool-side at Maison Arabe. It was the best meal we had in or around Marakech even though we had secured many of the most desirable tables in the region. We chose International Morrocan and Thai courses and each was expertly prepared. Service was highly professional and friendly. Having eaten at starred restaurants throughout France I am very surprised that Michelin has yet to bestow an etoile here. They should visit and rectify this omission.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family
Reviewer_Location: New York, New York, United States

Review_Date: John P wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Title: We're already looking forward to returning
Review_Text: I have always stayed in larger hotels but my wife insisted we stay here on our recent (and first) trip to Marrakech. I reluctantly agreed and have no regrets.  La Maison Arabe had everything I expect from a larger 5-star property (room service  efficient and knowledgeable concierge and front desk staff spa bar great restaurant) yet with a personalized service that even the best hotels in the world would have trouble matching. The General Manager made it a point of introducing herself and spoke with us several times during out stay to make sure everything was perfect. It was just that -- a perfect stay -- and my wife and I look forward to a return visit nex year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I attended La Maison Arabe for a hamam and cooking class in Dec 2011. The hamam was amazing the facitilites were impeccable and the staff very friendly. The cooking class was second to none facilities were great we visited a spice shop prior to cooking and the chef was hiliarious! Would highly recommend it if going for an up market experience in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I can't say enough about this wonderful hotel. A combination of 6 riads into one facility the hotel is a pleasure from the moment you walk in the door. The front desk staff is friendly helpful and welcoming and no request was problematic for them. The rooms were beautiful especially the lighting fixtures (the manager put us in touch with the designer and we visited his workshop coming home with some beautiful and original souvenirs). Our room (215) was on the smaller side but we had a private outdoor terrace with lounge chairs and a covered sitting area. Our kids were in very large rooms (211 and 213). We had 3 delicious breakfasts and one superb dinner (at the international restaurant but Moroccan dishes were available) outside near the pool. We also enjoyed the spa which is worth a visit if only to see the lighting and amazing use of candles. Drinks in the Jazz Bar with live piano music was also a highlight.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Fantastic Hotel - Best for Authentic Luxury Marrakech Experience
Review_Text: This was our first hotel in Morocco and La Maison Arabe set the bar very high. We are a family of 4 (two sons ages 8 and 10) and LMA was absolutely amazing. Not only was the hotel stunning -- a beautiful (and huge) restored riad on the edge of the medina -- but the quality of the service food and overall experience was incredible. We were in a 3-level "royal" suite which was perfect for our family and one of the nicest rooms we've ever been in -- perfectly appointed private and quiet. Even more striking however was the warmth and attention of the staff. In addition to graciously accomodating our last minute request to add 12 (!) people for Christmas Eve dinner (which was an incredible meal) the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome entertain the children and make sure no need was unmet. While there are certainly other luxury accomodations in Marrakech I think LMA is unique in that it provides an authentic intimate Moroccan riad experience without sacrificing any of the amenities found in larger more international hotels.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I took an amazing hands on cooking class at La Maison Arabe. The teacher was incredibly informative and knowledgeable. We cooked a delicious meal then enjoyed the fruits of our labor for lunch. The kitchen was a state of the art cooking kitchen and the class had only three students with a teacher and a chef! The hotel is magnificent. I only wish I had also stayed there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Barbara C wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Text: This was our first stop in Morocco. It was heavenly. The service was great the accommodations beautiful the food wonderful! Especially the home made yogurt. We have been thinking about that yogurt ever since! The location of this Riad is superb...nothing whatsoever negative to say. I agree that there couldn't be any better place to stay in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Boutique, with heritage and real service culture
Review_Text: Despite nerves about visiting with four children we had no need. LMA welcomes all equally. Fantastic few days in this atmospheric hotel - exotic and magical - beautifully furnished in traditional style.    There is a deep culture of excellent service with everyone showing real care for guests. Adil the Guest Relations Manager at front desk was truly excellent.    Location on western side of Medina is quieter although proximate to Mosque with early calls to prayer and the souk/street toward Bab Doukkala without the typical hawkers and feels very local.    Swimming Pool in Country Club a bit cold for use during our visit as unheated but spot was delightful and probably great in warmer months. The heated pool in the hotel is rather overlooked by the cookery centre and restaurant so scares away most potential users.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: On the far end of the Medina is an oasis of calm  with a welcoming staff great food and a hammass  for treatments. Rooms are pleasantly decoarted  with all the modern conforts of home. It meet any  "hotel snobs " requirements.  .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: My family has traveled extensively all over the world and La Maison Arabe ranks among the highest for us. We thoroughly enjoyed the ambiance the restaurant the spa & the staff. I don't think there could be any better place to stay in this fantastic city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: 3 generations on the same 4 day get away is a challenge but the staff at the hotel made it all possible. From hammam for mom (which made her very happy) to frenchfries and special attention to the 3 year old princess the staff were resilient and extremely friendly. Will certainly return to enjoy the rest of the hotel's luxuries: in room fireplaces oude & tea and the lovely swimming pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Located down a winding alley with high walls in the old quarter of Marrakech this exotic hotel is a hidden treasure. Wandering through the beautifully appointed public rooms and courtyards was like traveling back in time. The hotel feels both exotic and intimate. Our room looked through large windows and french doors onto a second story courtyard with a fountain and seating area. Beautiful fragrant climbing vines and flowers were everywhere. During breakfast we watched a Moroccan woman seated in a shaft of morning sunlight making the bread for our meal as if we were watching a beautiful film. In the evening the romantic ambience of the bar is luscious. The hotel's Moroccan restaurant is probably the most gorgeous dining room I have experienced and the food was magnificent. All aspects of the service were excellent. I would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrea L wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived at La Maison Arabe we were made to feel special. Everyone at the hotel is incredibly polite and attentive without being over the top or intrusive. I had an unfortunate self inflicted injury which left me with only one working leg (recovered now!). The staff couldn't have been more helpful from carrying me to our gorgeous suite (they kindly upgraded us so I could be near the lift) bandaging my foot calling to check on my progress to delivering a set of crutches to my room! They did all of this and more and without me even having to ask. The hotel is beautifully decorated giving you that sense of a world gone by and with candles and roses to meet you at every turn. It gives you the feeling of staying at somebody’s house as it’s so friendly warm and relaxing. That includes the country club which is a natural and peaceful “secret garden” surrounded by olive trees. The food throughout our stay was fantastic. The dessert in the hotel's Moroccan restaurant was the best I've ever eaten. La Maison Arabe is an incredibly special unique haven and they without doubt made our holiday to Marrakech a very memorable one. We would stay with them again in a heartbeat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Terence W wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Text: The hotel is furnished to a very high standard and the staff are very attentive and friendly
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: maria m wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Text: II was with my husband in marrakech how I love cook we took a cooking class in La Maison Arabe.  It was excellenta lot of fun I learned a lot about moroccan food this was fantastic the Dada Fahima was a super nice teacher and the other lady who was speaking english to us was so friendly. If you go there do not miss this wonderfull experience  Maria Moises
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We took a very insightful as well as fun cooking class while in Marrakech. I highly recommend taking a class with your stay.

Review_Date: James S wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Text: As I plan this year's New Year's celebration in Hokkaido I recollect last year's in Marrakesh at La Maison Arabe. From the moment we arrived very late and unexpectedly by train thanks to Royal Air Maroc vagaries we were greeted with warmth and openness from Rashid the first rate bar manager who allowed us to decompress in grand style (and hastily procured our excellent food). He was a real beacon of excellent service and fun throughout our stay. Indeed the consistent customer-focus attention gives one the perspective of being a resident of many months. Youssef provided the same level of attention with a kind gentle smile in areas of support with luggage front desk service and local directions. The entire staff is extremely well trained and attentive. As evidenced accurately on the website the beauty of the riad(s) overwhelm the senses and our New Year's Eve celebration was a delight.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Susan P wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Title: A truly wonderful experience for a would be cook
Review_Text: An excellent cookery class and inspiring pair of tutors. The tea we had on early arrival was beautifully presented in the attractive garden.  Lovely
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I have been fortunate in my line of work to have had the chance to live abroad in three locations as well as travel all over South America Europe Africa and the Middle East. I have stayed at some great and truly memorable properties while on my many business trips. So when on vacation and spending my own hard-earned money I also want to know I am getting something pretty special. I did an extensive amount of research on hotels before going to Marrakech. As my wife and I were traveling with our college-aged son and daughter we wanted to stay near the "souk action" but also wanted a place that offered more in terms of luxury and varied activities--a pool and place to enjoy the sunshine for instance. Of course the famous cooking school and the peaceful spa area added icing to the cake. Not disappointed here at La Maison Arabe we found all we had imagined and more. The staff were especially warm helpful and welcoming. I cannot imagine staying at another property when I return next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Potentially one of the best experiences I have ever had in a Riad or Hotel for that matter. It is an oasis. The service is exceptional the food is amazing and I cannot complement the design and environmental elements enough. Loved the cooking class - many of our classmates staying at other Riads or Hotels came back and spend the day here at Maison Arabe afterward as they were so enchanted by the place. The Jazz bar was perfect for meeting friends before dinner and then a nightcap.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter S wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Title: The best little hotel I have ever stayed in
Review_Text: I have travelled extensively and stayed at high quality hotels but I have never before stayed at such a characterful friendly relaxing and hospitable establishment.    We were looked after with great enthusiasm no request being too much trouble.    The consierge Adil knows everyone and every thing and will give you all of the inside information and best trips guides and the like.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Find your inner MasterChef at the La Maison Arabe Cooking School
Review_Text: Learn to cook delicious traditional Moroccan traditional dishes in a wonderful 5 star setting. Mohammed and Dardar Fathia offer a fun and informative class (in fluent English and French) and we had a lot of laughs and shared a lovely dinner at the end with our fellow chefs - Do not miss this experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Nathan Meyers wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Title: The most romantic hotel in Morocco
Review_Text: The hotel is superb the service is efficient and freindly and you are made to feel that you are a special guest.  The rooms are beautiful and the housekeeping is excellant.  The country club is an oasis away from the hussle of the city and the pool and facilities are top rate.  We bumped into the hotel's owner and he is utterly charming.  If you want a romantic hideaway but be within 15 minutes walking of the souks and main market square this is the place.  If ever we go back to Marrakech we will definitely go back to La Maison Arabe
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After we checked in got a tour of the gorgeous rihad and were welcomed with "Moroccitos" Adil the pleasant and kind concierge/front desk man helped my friends and I plan our entire weekend in Old Marrakech. We told him exactly what we were looking to experience during our stay and he had tons of suggestions and recommendations. From our tours to our meals Adil never steered us in the wrong direction. The restaurants he sent us to were excellent and all the tours we did were unforgettable. Besides the impeccable service La Maison Arabe is gorgeous. Our room was spacious clean and had a great balcony where we enjoyed breakfast every morning. The restaurants on the grounds are delicious. They also have a stunning country club about 15 minutes away where we enjoyed a light lunch poolside. Breakfast every morning and afternoon tea are complimentary. Unfortunately I did not have time to indulge in the hammam but it looked so peaceful and relaxing. If I ever go back to Marrakech there is no doubt I will be staying at La Maison Arabe.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Maison arabe Marrakesh is in top position 15 mins from square and very close to medina  modern city and monuments. wonderful friendly and helpful staff. Rooms spacious and interesting little parlors and tea rooms give a real morrocan experience. food is excellent and dining by pool a very calming experience. The hamman is a must and the out of town tranquil villa and pool a great escape from the bustle of Marrakesh. definitely top rating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: If there are 42 better hotels in Marrakech I would be surprised
Review_Text: Just came back from Marrakech where we stayed at La Maison Arabe.  We weren't sure about staying here as it is ranked 43rd hotel in Marrakech.  No problen though this is one of the best hotels I have every stayed in.  The quality of the rooms the decor and the feel of the place is great.  The staff were exceptional nothing was too much trouble.  We did the cookery course here which I recommend and we ate in the 2 restaurants here both good although I prefered the Moroccan restaurant.  Great location for the Medina about 10-15 minutes walk.  Stay here you will not regret it
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing atmosphere, people, food and location
Review_Text: We booked a cooking course at maison arabe to learn how to cook a tajine. The person in charge of the course was really helpful and gave us a very good overview of Morrocan food and culture. We went to a spice shop town oven where people bake their breads and pastries. The course itself was really good easy to make and the chefs were very helpful and patient.  The location is absolutely gorgeous we might stay there when we next come to marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great hotel/riad. Lovely room with private terrace. Great decor. Fantastic staff nothing too much trouble. Excellent food good pool (and country club) ... enjoyed cookery school too. Will return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Maison Arab is a gem of a hotel. Hospitable warm efficient and anxious to please staff. Rooms clean and spacious bathroom updated and more than adequate. Plenty of storage in rooms . Great porch off bedroom. Lovely pool nice communal areas in which to read have a tea or a drink. 2 good restaurants. Conveniently located. Stay at this charming small and intimate hotel: you won't be sorry.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad inside the walls of the city is a gem.  It is elegant and sophisticated in every sense.  The decor is in keeping with the best of Moroccan design  There are two restaurants one offering a truly international cuisine & the other a pre-fixe 3 course traditional Moroccan menu. This latter one is expensive but worth every bit. it was the best traditional meal we had there. The restaurant as well is elegantly decored with tables well-spread apart & quiet.  Breakfast is served by the pool. This is the only weak aspect of the hotel. The food was good but the serving staff at breakfast were inattentive & not around when needed.  However the rest of the staff were very professional friendly well-trained and helpful.  Our room was of the same high caliber.  If we were to return to Marrakech there is no question that we would stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We did a cookery course that wa sreally good (didn't stay at hotel) it was so nice we went back a few nights later and had dinner which was excellent
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: La Maison Arabe is a beautiful place: the attention to detail in the decor the intimacy of the laberinthine building the comfort of the rooms. While small it has its own grandeur in the quality of service the privacy of its common areas and the ambiance which highlight all the best that Morocco has to offer.. The restaurant is both original and of exceptional quality and the setting next to the pool is all you can ask for. The Spa is an experience all of its own a total delight for all your senses....once you go there you dont want to leave!!! And its located just a stone throw away from wherever you want to be in Marrakech. Dont think about it: book now stay there as much as you can and you will keep coming back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marina S wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Title: Brilliant place to stay in Marrakesh ...
Review_Text: This was our first visit to Morocco and first stay at La Maison Arabe. The staff were exceptional the food was wonderful in the restaurants the rooms were fabulous. We had a deluxe room which led out to a beautiful shared courtyard. Our girls had a triple which was very spacious! The decor of this beautiful riad is stunning! I highly recommend a stay here and would definitely go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is my second trip to Morocco and my second stay at La Maison Arab. The place is gorgeous and exceptional as always. I really like the new restaurant and the new pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Mike K wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: Great customer service. Very cheerful and accommodating staff. Room had good lighting great water pressure in the shower. Breakfast was plentiful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This place is really exceptional. It may not be up there with the La Mamounia's of this world but then again the cost reflects this.    We've just spent 5 nights there and we were continually delighted by the friendly and efficient staff who can't do enough for you.    Our room (a suite in the 'old' side of the hotel) was gorgeous! It halife 'old school Morocco' feel that only enhances the feeling that you're somewhere that no one else knows about.    The restaurant and jazz bar are also exceptional. We've been to Marrakech a few times and consider ourselves experts on where to eat - particularly the well renowned restaurants that are often recommended on Tripadvisor and elsewhere. Just eat here and you'll be very satisfied!    Finally but by no means least. Check out their country club. That place is stunning! I'll say no more than that but we will return and we wouldn't stay anywhere else in Marrakech if only for the country club!    Thanks to all the staff for making our anniversary very special. We'll be back!

The entire staff was extremely attentive. The place was gorgeous! The cooking class I attended was organized interesting informative and fun. I couldn't have asked for a better experience...perfect in every way. I highly recommend this property.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I spent four magical days here at Maison Arabe.  Last year my daughter and I were in Marrakech staying at the very standard Riu Tikida in Palmerie. A hammam and cookery class brought us to Maison Arabe where we ended up spending most of our time (and sadly had to return to the "prison camp" at bed time). I vowed then on a return trip to Marrakech it would be to Maison Arabe.  My husband for sure was not to be disappointed!  The elements Maison Arabe has make it so very special.  From the amazingly warm welcome from staff the hospitality of General Manager Toufik (spelling sorry Mr T!) and even the welcoming correspondance from the owner himself Fabrizio Ruspoli. This hotel is led by a superb management team and it shows in the staff and service.  Decor: There are no words to describe the decor of Maison Arabe. Every little nook and cranny is a mystical adventure with priceless pieces of Art which arouse the senses. One is surrounded by an ambience of relaxed beauty which immediately puts one into "chill out" mode.  This is not however a "stuffy" hotel. One can feel very comfortable arriving at breakfast in a robe after a morning dip in the pool. Yes you will want to dress for dinner in the evening but even at lunch one day we were happy to dine in our robes following a morning by the pool.  STAFF ; From reception to housekeeping it is rare to find a team of staff which is 100% perfect. Score ten out of ten Maison Arabe. Special mention to Abdullah (sp?) who looked after us a great deal and felt on many occasions like our own personal butler. Head Barman Rachid and his great team of barmen are excellent and add the fun element into Maison Arabe.  The girls by the restaurant smiling helpful and just a joy to spend time with.  FOOD- out of this world! The lamb tegine oooooh wonderful!!! I am gluten free and very rare do I get to enjoy bread. Maison Arabe made me very special breads which I will forever more yearn for!!!  Costs: yes we spent a little more than we intended. My husband however never begrudes us spends when we are 100% happy and enjoying ourselves. We did overdo the champagne.. but - ooooh boy did we have a good time :)  Rooms: We loved our room and were lucky enough to experience a beautiful suite on our last days. With a rooftop terrace to die for quite an awesome experience! To lunch on this rooftop and relax in the tub under the scorching Moroccan sunshine..aaaahhhh bliss!!  Our one regret was on the night we were staying in the suite we had already organised dinner at the Amanjena. We wish so much we had just stayed at Maison Arabe. The Amanjena was not up to par with my previous experience there. Food was poor and having paid £350 for a bottle of Bollinger we would expect not to have to pour it ourselves! Wont do that next time for sure! We wish so much we had stayed put in Maison Arabe but hey it wont be out last visit for sure.  Maison Arabe's country club is very beautiful. It could do with a better bar service but our Abdullah came to the rescue there quickly dashed over from Maison Arabe and ensured our day there was simply perfect!  We are "party people" and for that we grabbed a taxi through the day to Nikki Beach which we do love. But so nice at the end of the day to return "home" to Maison Arabe.  My husband can be hard to please at times he rarely comes back from a vacation ranting on and on and on about how good his time was. For sure he is already trying to plan another trip!  For a short haul flight from Scotland this is a real find for us. We know we can grab a last minute break whenever we have a window of opportunity. I think Maison Arabe will be welcoming us for many years to come..  See you soon Insha'Allah
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I visited maison arab last week leaving children and hushband to have a short break with a girlfriend. We had a great time.  The hotel is only 15 minutes from the airport. When first pulling up in the taxi we both thought"where have we come to!" as the surroundings to the hotel are run down however on entering the hotel we were very pleasantly surprised.  The reception staff were very efficient and friendly at all times and we were straight away given a tour of the hotel.  Our rooms were excellent with alittle courtyard in between which was ideal to have a pre dinner drink. I loved the decor very authentic and arabic.  We were woken up by the "Call to Prayers " at 3 and 5 in the morning but the way around that was to close the windows and put on the air conditioning.  I very much enjoyed the spa although my friend was not happy with one of her treatments. The manager apologised straight away and offered something to make amends.  The hotel is 10 minutes from the souk.  We took part in one of the cookery coursesrun by the hotel it was the highlight ot the holiday.  Beautiful clean kitchen a trip to the local bakery which was just an oven in the wall with locals coming in to have their own dough baked fascinating.  We had a couple of trips to the country club very nice relaxing surroundings and great to have the chance to swim off all the delicious food!    Overall a great hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Went for a light meal didn't quite turn out that way. We were persuaded to try a banquet and what a feast it was. The standard of food and cooking was quite superb.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful stay at La Maison Arabe in Marrakech's Medina
Review_Text: We decided to visit Marrakech for some late Autumn sun and some exotic North African flavour. We reviewed the available Riad style hotels and were impressed by the facilities of La Maison Arabe with their country club and the relative value for money against other properties.    La Maison Arabe could not have been more helpful with the booking process and arranging the airport pick up. On arrival we were welcomed very warmly and guided to our suite for the first night which was beautifully appointed with its own private patio. As the hotel was full and we had booked late for our second and third nights we were transferred to a junior room which was plenty big enough with a shared patio on the first floor.    The hotel’s location is ideal being some twelve minutes’ walk north of Djemaa El Fna and the souks. In addition the hotel has its own country club which is some fifteen minutes by complimentary shuttle where there is a large swimming pool restaurant/beverage facilities and beautiful gardens. On the Sunday of our stay we were fortunate enough to be the only guests enjoying these facilities.    We ate in both of the hotel’s restaurants – Le Restaurant (Moroccan) and Les Trois Saveurs (French Moroccan and Asian). Both were excellent with friendly and knowledgably service. Breakfasts were a real treat as there is a Moroccan Lady who makes local pancakes to order with a multitude of savoury fillings.    The hotel also offers its widely renowned cooking classes which one of us attended. These take place in the specially appointed teaching kitchen and include visits to a local communal baker and spice shop. Having each prepared a Chicken and Preserved Lemon Tagine with Moroccan Salad we then sat down and ate it – delicious!    In short this is an excellent choice for your base in Marrakech with the added bonus of being able to retreat to the country club should you feel the need for some additional R&R. Wi-Fi available throughout the entire property including the country club.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After a week travelling throughout eastern and southern Morocco in September we arrived at La Maison Arabe in Marrakech. It was like finding an oasis after slogging through the desert.    The riad is a beautiful old structure with a great sense of history. Room was lovely and I sat where Churchill would eat his dinner and smoke his cigars back when the riad was a well known restaurant. Too bad I didn't have a cigar.    We liked the restaurant and ate there twice depsite the multitude of choices in Marrakech. The lamb was great and the local Meknes wine was a good complement. The highlight for e though was the melt in your mouth ice cream - I recommend the pistacchio and the chocolate.    My wife loved the hamman and I felt par boiled ready for the plate after a half hour in the steam room. Loved that they had a cold shower inside the steam room to help keep from getting too hot.    Service from the front desk was very professional and they couldn't do enought to assist. The Jazz Bar was a pool of solitude after the Medina experience and the gin and tonics were a welcome sight.    Would happily recommend to all
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: mouna a wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: Peace and tranquility surrounded by a magic world of colors smell and taste
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: first time in the Arab World
Review_Text: This was my first time and my first night in the Arab World. After a 20 hour journey La Maison Arab was everything I hoped for. Perfect sized boutique hotel with the faultless service you'd expect from a larger 5 star group. The Hotel was perfectly located nothing was too much trouble for the staff the rooms offered character and ambience i felt relaxed and taken care of as soon as I arrived.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: T M wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Text: I had an excellent time. The service was perfect the staff was kind and helpful the decor was enchanting and the food and cooking lessons were superb. I will definitely go back and recommend it to my friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Lindsay P wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Text: We stayed at La Maison Arabe during a 3 day excursion to Morrocco. In the heart of Marrakech it is central to the markets medina and tourists sights. We experienced temperatures of 43 dgrees during the day but the hotel was so inviting cool and calming. A beautiful pool made the stay more enjoyable. The ambience meals room decor staff and facilities were fantastic. Would definitely recommend to anybody seeking a great place to stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We picked La Maison Arabe for a three-night stay in Marrakech and the hotel and city were the high point of our trip. I can't say enough about what an oasis of calm and luxury this hotel is! We were treated like royalty by the staff. We had a room (not a suite) and it was spacious very well appointed and was our 'palace' for our stay in Morocco. Everyone we met on the staff was warm and helpful. We had mint tea brought to the room and the staff delivered fresh flowers for Paige. We ate most of our meals in the hotel -- breakfasts were outstanding with fresh yogurt fruit eggs rolls/pastries and coffee (though I missed American-style coffee...). Dinner was a choice of two restaurants -- we opted for the one serving Moroccan French and Asian. There's another with a fixed-price Moroccan menu we didn't try. Meals were excellent and unhurried. The hotel's common areas including the restaurant were all beautifully decorated - I must have taken a hundred photos. I signed up for the cooking class (recommended if you want to learn to cook Moroccan food like tagines) and Paige did the hammam treatment. The location was within fairly easy walks of most of the old city's hotspots but beware of getting lost -- everyone we spoke with did at first. There's an excellent piano lounge in the hotel (with a colorful bartender). We also spent one afternoon at the hotel's 'country club' a short shuttle ride away with a pool and food service. All in all I highly recommend this hotel -- it's like a riad in terms of local authenticity and atmosphere but large enough to offer great dining and more.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful meal, fantastic cookery course but beware of glass in the hammam
Review_Text: We didn’t stay at the Maison Arabe but we were there most days for a spa treatment meal drink or cookery course.    The cookery course was brilliant we all managed to cook wonderful dishes and it was a real highlight of our Marrakech trip. The restaurant and jazz bar are also excellent. The one downside was our visit to their hammam. It all looks very pretty with candles burning in glass holders all around the dark steaming hammam although a little risk management would suggest that glass flames and steam are a dangerous combination. We paddled naked through the shallow water on the hammam floor and my husband and I each sat down on a bench. I felt a twinge in my finger and when I looked down there was blood pouring down my hand. I then started looking around the bench and floor and there were shards of glass everywhere. I told the masseuse that we were leaving and that we wanted to use the other hammam. I then carefully led my husband out as he is blind without his glasses.    The masseuse just didn’t understand what the fuss was about. She suggested that we try and pick up the pieces of glass and carry on. I was very insistent that the hammam be completely cleaned or we use the other hammam. We were offered tea while the hammam was cleaned and after about half an hour the other hammam became free so we then had a lovely invigorating treatment followed by a relaxing massage.    When we came to pay a 10% service charge was added to the bill and there was no apology for the hazardous state of the hammam. We were very lucky not to have been seriously hurt.    When we were back at the Maison Arabe a couple of days later for the cookery course we mentioned to the course leader about our dissatisfaction with the way the hammam incident had been dealt with. She was horrified and went and told the manager who immediately refunded the cost of the hammam. I hope that they no longer use glass in the hammams but if they do please be careful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When we arrived at this hotel I really wasn't well after coming from the mountains and the last thing I needed was a problem with the room which we got as Antatolian Sky advertise all rooms have bath and balcony or terracethis is incorrectanyway the hotel upgraded us for free they couldn't do enough and this friendly "go the extra mile" attitude prevailed throughout our stay.The breakfasts were wonderfuldinner was wonderful.If I hadn't been unwell I would have loved to try the cookery school too.We did hear the mosque but we heard it in the mountains and at the coast on our tourthat is the whole pointthat muslims can here the call to prayer so I don't think it is any louder here than anywhere elseoccupational hazard of visiting a muslim country I supposeok it's early but to us it adds to the experience.The wine and flowers on arrival were a lovely touch and we truely loved Marrakech but watch out for pick pockets in the square at night and go to the artisan ensemble to get an idea of prices before you go to the souks as quite often even when you have haggled down to about 20% of the asking price it can still be too much compared to the fixed prices at the artisanwe also really enjoyed the yves st laurent gardens.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wow 10/10 in every regard but one
Review_Text: This was just a 'time off' 3 days on a business trip and now I can't wait to go back.    Everything was good here - the friendly and personal service the atmosphere the meals the service the hammam ...    But first the only negative and its not part of the hotel. La Maison Arabe is very close to a major mosque and the ~dawn call to prayer and the PRE-call to prayer before that will wake you several times before 6am. I'm told that its hard to escape anywhere in Marrakesh (at least) but here you can rely on being woken. But it wasn't sufficient to offset an otherwise great time even though noise is one of my major issues in hotels.    The general atmosphere is welcoming cosy and very Moroccan; fresh roses and rose petals on water features cool courtyards clubby lounges all serene and charming.    The eating options are superb. Breakfast is served by the pool on a terrace and was delicious (fresh fruits yoghurt with honey pastries ... you get the idea). In the evening you can relax in a cozy bar with piano player a good wine list and attentive staff.    Rooms are well appointed and stylish; beds are a bit hard in the Arab style but not too bad.    The in-house hammam was a bit expensive but worth it to totally unwind.    Basically a marvelous experience but unless you are an early riser take ear plugs.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: The service was excellent from the time we arrived to the time we left. Trailfinders did us proud. Arrival at the hotel the staff could not be more helpful. The room allocate was on the small side but quite adequate. We were offered another room which was much bigger but this room did not have the terrace. Oh the terrance was a heavenly sunny spot and not overlooked by anyone else in the hotel. All staff were friendly from the reception restaurant and bar. The riad was excellent example of Morocco and was a very peaceful place to return to each day. The guide and taxi service were also arranged thru our Trailfinders agent and not a hickup in sight.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had a lovely time at La Maison Arabe. Staff were very pleasant and couldn't do enough for us. We went on sightseeing trips in the morning then went to the Country Club in the afternoon to relax. It was a good experience.  This was our first visit to North Africa and the hotel made it a very pleasant experience.  We found the Moroccan people charming.  We spent 4 days in Marrakech and 3 days in the Atlas Mountains. A good combination.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We loved our stay at La Maison Arabe having a room with a courtyard shared by one other room. Breakfast was good and plentiful and taken next to the outdoor pool. Service was great and the hammam was an experience (private but still invigorating).    Our one and only criticism is that it is located very near to a mosque so we were woken up at 4:30am. However this did add to the atmosphere!    It's in a good location not too far a walk from the centre but away from the traffic.    We would definitely stay there again if we return to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely, Exciting, A Perfect Moroccan Experience
Review_Text: It's hard to know where to begin. I had been working with Nabila the Manager and Fatima  the Director of Reservations for three years; arranging a 10-day "0" birthday event for 30 or  so guests. Never having been to Morocco before I was flying blind in a way. I'd scoured  the internet for hotels and riads to accommodate the group. First I thought I'd have the party  at La Mamounia as it is very beautiful and famous. But I finally decided that I wanted a  small riad in the Madina which was easy walking distance to the square.    La Maison Arabe is large for a riad but very small for a hotel. It is the best marriage of the two. It is made of of six riads which have been joined together; so there are many levels.  It is every bit a riad and decorated in beautiful Moroccan style. But it has all the services  that one wants in a hotel: Laundry spa pool two restaurants a bar A/C room safes  great water pressure an elevator in one section and room service. The hotel desk staff  will also arrange guides who are delightful and considerate of what each guest wants to  see or do.    Each room there are 26 in all is different and they range from two Royal Suites with  three levels to a few very small rooms which have the best patios. Most of the rooms  are very ample for two.    The location is prime. One can drive or be driven to the mouth of a rather shabby alley  only to step into this perfect Moroccan paradise. It's a gem and a surprise of great  beauty and charm.    Every member of the staff is kind helpful and knows his or her job. Nabila the general  manager knows what you need before you do. They are caring and helpful and make  the guest feel like part of an extended family. Also the gentlemen at the desk; Adil and  the others are the same. They know their business and are kind and friendly. This  applies to all staff from housekeepers to managers to the owners; who are there often  and make it a point to greet the guests and make sure everything is going well.    I did not take a cooking class but several of my guests did and they were all very happy  with the result. The classes are limited to 10 and the class is taken to the market to buy  the food and spices do the cooking and have the meal together afterward. The kitchen  or classroom is new modern and ultra clean.    I was a bit worried about what I would find not being able to go to Marrakech to check  out the hotel/riad first but I needent have worried. Everything is first rate. I am beyond  thrilled that I chose La Maison Arabe for my party. I almost forgot to mention what they  call "The Country Club". This is a large romantic garden with a very large pool about  ten minutes away by shuttle. This is an hourly free service. One can enjoy lunch drinks  and a swim. There is also a large stationary party tent for special events. The staff  at the hotel organized a beautiful perty for my birthday. They put so much time and  effort into what turned out to be a magnificent event.    This was truly a magical ten days and the staff and owners of La Maison Arabe were  largely responsible. Marrakech is full of gorgeous and/or charming places to stay but I  could never find a better place.    I have only two caviats: There are stairs; sometimes just a few and sometimes many.  If a person cannot use stairs at all it will be a problem. Also though all ages are  admitted. This is not a place for children. People go there for an ambience of peace  and quiet. Even in the brochure parents are told that children must be quiet.    All my guests are world and worldly travelers and can be quite fussy. Every one of them  were extremely pleased with La Maison Arabe and their extraordinary staff. They have  a very complete and beautiful web site in which they show all the rooms. That alone is  a very good sign.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Wow this place is fantastic. We stayed here on our first night in Marrakech. It's exactly as you'd picture a riad. Amazing people amazing rooms (which are a maze to get to but pretty awesome) amazing restaurant amazing sleep. Loved every second here even though it was short because we slept a lot to get caught up from jet lag. It's a 10 minute walk from the medina and square.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: We didn't stay but had a fab meal.
Review_Text: We didn't stay at the Riad but had a lovely meal beside the pool. well worth a visit in Marakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Except for a day of bad weather my wife and I had a wonderful time in Marrakech our first time there. This hotel was a great choice. It isn't that big something like only 20 rooms but it has a large spa restaurant pool and bar. There are no gym facilities though. Wifi worked well in our room and by the pool. Food was excellent both at lunch and dinner. Very efficient and friendly staff. The front desk and the concierge were tops very helpful arranging sightseeing and a sidetrip to Essaouira on the coast. The hotel is beautiful it felt like we were staying in a private home or club. Great location around a 10 minute walk to the main square.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel was absolutely beautiful. The guest rooms with fresh flowers were so clean and the bathroom was huge and so comfortable. The entire hotel which is quite large is so tastefully decorated. There is also a lovely pool.    The food was delicious. We had both dinner and a very plentiful breakfast every day. This was the nicest hotel we stayed in in Morocco. Can't wait to go back...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Your own luxurious haven of peace after the streets of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed for six nights at La Maison Arabe and thought that perhaps we were staying in the city for too long - but we could have stayed at La Maison Arabe for the rest of our lives... Every single member of staff was helpful happy unobtrusive warm and friendly. Eating the most lavish of breakfasts overlooking the tranquility of the pool started each day in a haze of calm and the hotel offered a perfect home to return to after a long day walking. After 4 days sightseeing we felt we deserved a rest and spent the two remaining days at the hotel's "Country Club" relaxing by the pool being cared for by Mohammed and his staff. On the days we went there were at most only three couples using the whole club so we had almost our own private pool gardens staff and chefs. What an experience - definitely one we shall want to have again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment we arrived at La Maison we were treated like royalty. The staff was very friendly accommodating and fun! They recommended places to go and see as well as great restaurants besides their own. We truly felt we had the overall Moroccan experience we were looking for. Bravo to the management and the staff. I can't wait to go back! We have told all our friends to go and only stay at La Maison. Fabulous!  Thank you Ibrahim!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Honestly this is one of the finest hotels I have stayed in. We were on spring break from USA 2 mothers and 17 year daughter. Our friends thought we were reckless to be traveling to Marrakech with the current political situation. Our concierge Ibrihim was extraordinarily qualified kind and kept an eye on us every step of the way. He booked dinners drivers mountain climbing guide cooking class spa services and souk guide (all very good english speaking). Rashid the barman was easy going and friendly without being "overly-friendly". (He has been there 5 years and they still have english classes for employees to stay sharp) The hotel was so spectacularly decorated like being in a palace. Fresh flowers and candles everywhere. The food was very good and the service everywhere was very attentive. One night while we were at Le Foundouk (great place) and running late to the belly dancing show (Comptoir Bar) Ibrihim called our driver and asked to speak to me to be sure that we were okay (since we were late). It was 11 pm! The cooking school was marvelous. My 17 yr old daughter doesn't cook and it was very easy for her. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel the spa cooking school and restaurant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A fantastic retreat in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: Maison Arabe is the most beautiful Riad set in a great location near to the Souks and about a 15/20 minute walk to the main Square. It is near a mosque and the early morning call to prayer can be a little loud but you soon get used to that and it is all part of Marrakech . The staff simply cannot do enough for you and always with a smile. Our suite Aladdin was very well appointed and serviced every time we left the room with beautiful thick towels and the toileteries always replenished. The hamman was gorgeous. The set dinner in the main restaurant was delicious but there was too much food and a little expensive. We didn't eat dinner in the "cafe" restaurant but were told the food was delicious as was breakfast. I cannot recommend this highly enough and had tears in my eyes when I left. I will return to Marrakech if only so I can stay at this Riad again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing quality , perfect service and cool ambiance.
Review_Text: Loved this hotel although when we first arrived the foyer smelt a bit musty (sorry being picky). Other than that it was perfect. The food was amazing and everything was always done with a smile and o my god what a breakfast. X wicked morrocan lights x

Review_Date: Alexandra D wrote a review Mar 2011
Review_Title: Marrakech at its best: comfort, location, service
Review_Text: It's impossible to be overly flattering about this hotel. It is small (26 rooms) a converted huge private house with a large variety of lounges and spaces inside and out. Its location is ideal on the edge of the Medina 10 minutes walk from the Jemaa el Fnaa square and ideally located to visit traditional Marrakech. Most rooms have a small terrace and are beautifully appointed with traditional craftwork throughout: hand-embroidered curtains tiled fireplaces traditional Morocco stucco walls. It has a beautiful heated swimming pool that is large enough for real exercise. The dining areas are pleasant and the food is good without being outstanding: menus do cater for all diets. The hammam is exceptionally comfortable quiet and well services: you won't find better. Service is exceptionally good discreet and diiverse. Questions are always met with solutions.    It is not a good place for people with mobility problems as there are lots of stairs. Apart fro
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Maison Arabe is fabulous! The level of service is on par with any 5 star hotel we have ever stayed but the kindness and generosity of the staff is unique.    The bed linens are high thread count crisp clean and comfortable. The towels were large thick and soft. Water and soft drinks are free from the minibar and breakfast is included. The breakfast each morning was delicious and included fresh squeezed juices croissants jams honey yogurt eggs and coffee.    I did not eat in the restaurant but did take the cooking class which was delightful and the food we made was delicious. I highly recommend La Maison Arabe.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: the hotel was wonderful warm romantic and cozy/friendly at the same time. Families and lovers work well together. The food is divine the service sublime. The level of service in fact was the best I have ever experienced and the staff from manager/concierge to maid/guides were all superlative. We had an issue with our flight and the entire staff flew to assist and went above and beyond what you would expect. I would recommend this hotel as a reason to actually travel to the city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: There's almost no reason to leave the hotel. Most refined & deluxe experience.
Review_Text: La Maison Arabe is simply one of the most beautiful and unique experiences in Morocco. One feels the blast from a time gone by a culture vastly different from western countries and yet a level of service friendliness and beauty surrounds you. The restaurants have the BEST food in the medina area. The cooking class is great fun one prepares and eats a huge lunch; which includes kneading the bread and taking it to the communal oven and going to the spice market to better understand the exotic spices used in the tagines and vegetables. NOTE: The Country Club in the Palmaraie area is now called Coin Cache. The hotel will arrange the 20 minute ride to this "country club" which has a great swimming pool gardens wonderful food and some indoor spaces that would be a blast for a big party/celebration.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David W wrote a review Mar 2011
Review_Text: generally reasonable to good. Breakfasts were good snacks in the bar were good food in the Moroccan restaurant too much and maybe expensive at £55. Room was fine. Positioned near a mosque so there are loud calls to prayer. About 20 minutes walk to main square. Cookery course was fun. Hammam was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Maison Arabe inside Marrakesh's Medina is a very special hotel. Everything about it from the decorations with beautiful courtyards our room which included a peaceful patio area and sumptuous wall hangings and furniture the layout with lots of areas including an attractive dining area where we enjoyed lovely breakfasts inside but where in warm weather you could sit outside made a perfect stay in Marrakesh. At first the walk from Maison Arabe to the centre of Marrakesh was a bit daunting with hectic traffic and pavements but that in itself became part of the charm of the place creating a haven of peace when we returned. The staff were always friendly and helpful. We would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Marrakesh
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My son and I stayed at this hotel for 3 days and it was the most amazing experience of our life! The hotel is beautiful and the staff are very wonderful people! One of the receptionists Hicham went out of his way to make sure our stay was pleasant. He gave us a complete tour of the hotel and recommended his favorites at one of the restraunts before he accompanied us to our room. He also went out of his way to make my son comfortable and happy which means everything to me!! Thank you soooo much for a wonderful experience!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Everything about this delightful hotel is wonderful! We loved everything about this charming hideaway. The rooms are each unique and special the food delicious and the service is outstanding and very warm. We loved the cooking class at the hotel. The instruction was terrific and the dishes we made were delicious. This experience really allowed us to fully appreciate the unique flavors of Moroccan cuisine. If you are traveling to Marrakech I wholeheartedly recommend this special gem of a boutique hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: the hotel is very nice indeed staff friendly prices expensive food good but not fine dining.  did not like being woken up very early by prayer calls from nearby mosque.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: The Arabe was like an oasis. The staff is incredible waiting on you hand and foot. The restaurants were lovely and food delicious. Music at dinner was delightful. THe piano bar was a great touch. Couldn't have asked for a more wonderful place to stay to experience Marrakech. Convenient too. Spa was fantastic - great chance to experience a hammam and scrub - massage was one of the best I've ever had.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Stunning hotel, helpful friendly service and brilliant location
Review_Text: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at La Maison Arabe and were so impressed with it! It is probably the nicest place I have ever stayed. The hotel/riad itself has been lovingly furbished not even the smallest space had been forgotten. The lighting gave a wonderful authentic ambience and it was really everything you would dream of for a stay in Marrakech. We had a beautiful suite overlooking the pool with a balcony there are only 26 rooms so I imagine every room is as nice. Fantastically clean everytime we went out someone went to tend to the room. It is located very centrally near the local markets and a 10 minute walk to the plaza. They have 2 restaurants downstairs and we ate in both and it was the best food we had tried in any other restaurant around the world. Amazing. The staff were all lovely without exception. We also had the traditional hammam there and massage and that was also fantastic.  Room service was great we ordered our breakfast in our room everyday which was a lovely luxury.  It was a very quiet place when we were there as this is low season now. You do get woken at 4am and 5am with the local mosque prayer over loudspeakers.  It was a wonderful stay and we will definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is really fantastic!!! Great atmosphere and perfect service. Breakfast is something that you'll remember for a long time! I suggest to spend also some hours in The garden and pool area... Wonderful!!!

Review_Title: Authentic, Lovely Guest House with 5 star service, attentiveness and design
Review_Text: I would highly recommend La Maison Arabe. This boutique hotel with under 40 rooms runs like a 5 star hotel. La Maison was recommended to me by a close friend who stays often and the recommendation did not disappoint. The staff is friendly helpful and well versed in restaurants shopping and touring. My room was lovely - a suite with a balcony overlooking the garden and swimming pool--the perfect place to relax after the chaos of Marrakech. I stayed for 6 nights and the staff knew me my likes and dislikes. My only (very minor) request would be fitness equipment. I missed my regular exercise.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: La Maison Arabe Cookery School - Fantastic!
Review_Text: My husband and I attended the cookery school at La Maison Arabe during our trip to Morocco in February 2010. It was one of the true highlights of our trip and certainly our favourite part of our time in Marrakech. A thoroughly enjoyable way to spend a morning!    Mohammed our translator / cooking guide for the morning was excellent - a wealth of information on Moroccan cooking and Marrakech in general. He directed us to the best eateries in Marrakech - away from the usual tourist traps where we enjoyed almost our best meal whilst in Marrakech.....our favourite meal was the meal we prepared for ourselves at La Maison Arabe. It was the best tagine we had during our whole trip!    Highly recommended for a great cooking school with experienced and engaged staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What an amazing hotel. The service is outstanding. The decor is magnificent. The location is perfect.  We just spent 3 nights with another family and their two teenage children and I know they will all say that La Maison Arabe is one of their favorite hotels ever. Located within walking distance of Jemaa El Fna (great square) this quaint (26 rooms) hotel is one to be remembered.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This hotel was perfect. An excellent hotel in Marrkech--great location excellent service and the quaint hotel made my family and I feel very welcome and comfortable.    Definitely Recommend! Best hotel we stayed in in Morocco!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Great in every way, and a much better experience than any large hotel
Review_Text: Our group switched to this hotel last minute from one of the larger hotels in Marrakech and we were really glad we did so. The quaint feel really gives you a taste of Marrakech culture and because there are so few rooms the service was really great. Our group had three rooms all of which were different and nice.    We also did the cooking class that the hotel is known for and absolutely loved it. Really put the rest of our eating on the trip in perspective and I would highly recommend doing the cooking class. Hotel management was also very friendly and wanted to please its guests and ask for any ways to improve the hotel. We had nothing to say to him as the stay was fantastic.    We also had dinner one night at the hotel restaurant and really enjoyed the food.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I can only recommend this place it's perfectly located very elegant and sophisticated with great facilities a fantastic restaurant and the most charming and helpful staff one could ask for. They were particularly nice to our children who felt welcome and well received. The suite was big cozy with a super romantic balcony where we had a nice glass of Moroccon wine offered by the hotel. The riad has many warm and beautiful living rooms a nice pool and a great hamman. It was the best place we stayed in Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My familly of 4 loved this riad. We spent our first 4 nights in Morocco here and it was an excellent choice. Ours rooms were a little small but very charming and comfortable. The location was ideal for exploring the medina on our own and with a guide. The staff were extremely helpful with retreiving our lost luggage at the airport and with restaurant recommendations. The in house restaurant was expensive but excellent. We also took a 4 hour cooking class which my teenage children think was the highlight of the trip. Would definitely recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Adam H wrote a review Dec 2010
Review_Text: La Maison Arabe was our home for 5 nights while in Marakech. Warm welcomes at the door staff to answer every question and fulfill every need. The Hammam was an unforgettable experience which left us feeling awesome refreshed and cleansed (maybe a little violated but that's ok).  All the meals we had were incredible. Music and ambience in the restaurants was perfect.  My girlfriend was sick during our stay and the staff did everything to help get her better. They sent people to the chemist for me and brought tea to our rooms.  They really went over and above.  The fact that we received complimentary upgrade to a suite definitely doesn't hurt their case for a great review either.  Was sad to leave and would love to go back.

Review_Title: No better place for a honeymoon! Can't wait to go back!
Review_Text: My husband and I got married on December 4th and decided to go to Morocco for our honeymoon. When we arrived at Maison Arabe we couldn't stop smiling - it was romantic and beautiful on every level and in every sense. From the amazing room with fireplace and balcony to the wonderful breakfast poolside and the delightful heated pool to the gorgeous and sexy hammam and jazz bar we are planning to try and come back every year on our anniversary. The staff were all kind and extremely accommodating and the location was terrific. We can't say enough extraordinary things about this place and are so happy it was part of our honeymoon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: You will leave feeling like royalty!
Review_Text: From the time we got to the riad to the taxi leaving we were greeted with the best service you could imagine! The small riad is home to a maze of winding stairs with two great restaurants enchanting live music and memories you won't forget! After having a great meal one of the nights we decided we wanted to have the tea back in our room. After asking if the tea in our room was possible the server replied "For you all is possible!" (We decided that was the motto at this riad!) We left the restaurant then noticed one of the servers at the restaurant door waiting for us to leave to follow us with tea and cookies. We arrived to the room and to our surprise noticed for the second time in one day the room was cleaned! After we sat down to enjoy our tea we busted out laughing because we really did feel like a king and queen!    The riad does have a really nice hammam but is very pricy. The hammam (spa) is something you absolutely have to experience! Just look in some guide books to tell you the best one to go to!    Walking distance to the medina was not bad at all and we found it very safe! There is not much nightlife we found outside the riad but the riad is complete with a piano bar and plenty of room to enjoy the riad and friends at night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Having never dreamed of going to Marrakesh I can safely say it was an experience and this hotel was the best part of it all. Set down an unassuming alley way you walk through a beautiful doorway into an delightful reception area and then it only gets better - a beautiful restraunt by the pool the jazz bar the Morrocan restraunt the hamman the staff - I could go on and on about the place but in short it is a magnificent place to stay.    My partner and I did the cookery course which is a must. A tour around the local souks and then making new foods was excellent. Aida and Mohammed the chef were brilliant and Mohammed spoke in more excellent english than I.    If you want a luxurious yet unassuming place to stay then this is it. The staff are polite accomodating and most of all lovely with no request to much. Also if you have the opportunity there hamman is glorious and a true taste of luxury.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I attended a half day cookery course at Maison Arabe. It starts with an introduction to Morrocan cuisine followed by 45 mins out and about visiting a local bakery and spice store. You then head to the kitchen to cook your own fabulous chicken tagine and two different Moroccan salads. All of the instruction is given in French and English. Whilst things are cooking you are given more information and the chef demonstrates a few extra dishes. You then head off to sit in the courtyard by the pool and enjoy the delicious lunch you have made. You get complimentary water and dessert plus are given a lovely tagine dish to take home. There were eight people on our course 4 english speakers and 4 french ( 6 female 2 male). It started at 10am and we were still there at 3.30pm enjoy a chat and drink with some of the other attendees.    The course ( everything included) cost us 500dh - about £40 per person which we felt was excellent value.    We were also given a tour of the hotel and returned that night to the jazz bar where you can enjoy live music tapas and wonderful cocktails.    Great course in a stunning hotel. Also a really good way for solo travellers to meet new people.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I didn't actually stay at this hotel but wanted to learn more about Moroccan cuisine. The tour agency we used set me up for a one-to-one cooking lesson with Chef Mohammed Nahir at the La Maison Arabe. The teaching kitchen is beautiful and fully equipped for up to 10 students! After a quick review of the basic ingredients used in Moroccan food Chef Mohammed and I took a walk to a nearby spice shop to get a first hand look and sniff at the fresh spices. I had to have just a few!! Back in the kitchen Chef Mohammed and his sous chef taught me step by step to make a basic tajine and some fresh salads to go with it. I learned a few new skills and now can't wait to make these dishes for my family and friends!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Our home and we didnt even stay there!
Review_Text: I surprised my daughter with a trip to Marrakech. Being two blonde females we played safe and stayed in an all americanised RIU..big mistake! The Riu was "OKAY" but La Maison Arabe was our home:)  We had pre arranged a hammam here followed by lunch and a cookery school. What a wonderful place. I can only compare it to exotic boutique hotels we have stayed in in Kenya. This beautiful gem is simply a palace! Having had our hammam which was the best bonding duaghter and I have had we went to beautiful lunch then cookery school. For us we just had to keep going back. Despite being in an all inclusive hotel we dined more in Maison Arabe. It was Maison Arabe who arranged a local guide for us and also Maison Arabe who had our custom for the best part of our stay. Fanida if you meet her she is a treasure!!! I LOVED this rhiad its just one of those places you know you will return to. Thank you to the beautiful staff exquisite surroundings gastronomic food oh...and Mohammed and Ida our chefs from the cookery school...just treasures. Love you guys you are on our DEF RETURN list!!!
top notch hotel in marrakech really great stay staff all well trained and attentive. would reccomend to anyone
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in a suite in the old building. Very nice large room. The wifi (free) worked well here and throughout the building. The restaurant besides the pool had excellent food and a nice setting. The jazz bar is outstanding. People very friendly. Only downside is morning wakeup call at 4AM with the call to prayer. However it does provide local atmosphere. I definitely recommend staying at the La Maison Arabe.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Imogen B wrote a review Oct 2010
Review_Title: A lovely hotel with friendly helpful service and delicious food
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The smallness of the room was well compensated for by a beautiful private rooftop terrace complete with plants and lanterns. We ate in both restaurants and had delicious food in both with really helpful and friendly service.Front desk staff were charming and very helpful. Added bonus is the delightful "country club"were we relaxed every afternoon. A free taxi service takes you about 15 minutes away to a delightful villa with huge pool which is exclusive to guests.Delicious lunches served under trees on the courtyard. We also had a very good massage in the atmospheric spa in the basement of the hotel.This hotel is highly recommended and when we return to Marrakech this is the place to stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: It just doesn't get any better than this
Review_Text: We have stayed at La Maison Arabe several times over the years and each time we return there have been new additions and surprises. Originally a private home it has been continually enlarged and expanded - since our last visit 7 years ago an addition with a large heated pool restaurant with terrace over looking the pool new very well appointed rooms have appeared. Always well staffed with friendly and well trained people they have added even more. The Spa is world class according to my wife who has visited them all over the world.  The hotel is hidden from the busy streets and yet is only a minute walk to the covered souk/market.  One outstanding offering is their fabulous garden compound reached by their own car service about 15 minutes away in the palm gardens on the outskirts of the town. This facility includes a beautifully maintained garden growing vegetables for their restaurants plants palms and fig trees a huge outdoor pool with open cabanas. There is a fig tree shaded garden restaurant and a tent-like pavilion for evening parties {we had our wedding reception there years ago}. The main building has a large reception area and on the second floor their own cooking school. A wonderful way to relax after visits to the inner city of Marrakech.  All meals were excellent at the main hotel and the gardens.  This trip we returned with our 3 children and two nannies. The children were adopted by the staff and enjoyed their stay. We also spent a day at the Garden Pavilion where they were fee to chase the kittens and roan inside the walled gardens.  It really doesn't get any better than this in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel was just beautiful beautifully decorated I was overwelmed with the sights [sounds & smells]. We had the best meal on our trip (we were in Rome & Madrid so we ate very well!) here too. The Lamb "tagine" was soooooo good .... I don't know how to make it at home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed 2 nights in this lovely place that is based around a traditional riad but carefully and tastefully modernised so offers a number of addtional hotel services without loosing its authentic Morrocan feel. Everything was excellent and it was probably the best hotel we have stayed at anywhere. We stayed in a suite in the old part of the building which was spacious extremely comfortable and interestingly laid out around its own mini courtyard. The jazz / piano bar adds an extra dimension where we happily spent one evening being entertained by the pianist and the lively bar staff. The Morrocan Restaurant is superb - the food the service and the decor and is worth a visit even if you don't stay at the hotel. The same is true of the cookery school which we did in the lovely setting of the hotel's country club where we learnt to cook a delicious chicken olive and lemon tangine which we then ate in the delightful Berber tent in the grounds. The class is suitable for any level of cook from beginner to the more experienced as the cooks and translator are very friendly and offer as much help as you want. Service throughout our stay was outstanding. We will definitely return when we can.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We decided to stay at La Maison Arabe following quite a bit of web research. We decided we wanted to stay at somewhere larger then the typical Riad but smaller then a full blown hotel. La Maison Arabe fitted the bill perfectly both in terms of size (around 30 rooms/suites in total) and facilities (Spa restaurants country club cooking school etc). We had a fantastic break and would highly recommend this boutique hotel.    Accommodation - we booked a junior suite (patio side) and were upgraded on arrival to the slightly more expensive garden sided junior suite.    We stayed in the Nada suite and I would recommend you look at the accommodation section on La Maison Arabe's website as the pictures are a true representation of the rooms.    Our room was very spacious and comfortable with 2 large plasma TV's and a lovely balcony overlooking the pool. The bed was firm and comfortable and the hotel was very efficient at responding to our request to replace the oversized pillows supplied with slightly smaller ones.    The bathroom was more than adequate with a separate shower/bath and a large and powerful shower head.    There is also free WiFi throughout the hotel.    It is about a 10/15 minute walk to the main square/Souk so during the day it is possible to get around on foot.    Finally be aware that there is a local mosque nearby which does its 1st call-to-prayer at 4am (!) - that if nothing else makes you fully aware that you are in Marrekech!    Country Club - one of the attractions for us was the use of the hotel's country club on the outskirts of the city. Although there is a pool in the hotel the country club gives it something extra - it allowed us to spend a day relaxing by its pool and is the perfect opposite to the hustle and bustle of Marakkech. The weather in early October was still warm enough for us to swim in the pool and we really enjoyed the 4 or 5 hours we spent there. The hotel runs a regular free shuttle to/from the country club.    Spa - the spa seems newly refurbished although offered a relatively small range of treatments. While my wife and I both had treatments which we enjoyed I found it quite expensive and with hindsight should have booked the well-rated "Les Bains de Marrakech" in advance (- we tried to book on arrival but they were fully booked...).    Cooking School - the on-site cooking school was another reason for us booking this hotel. My wife enjoys cooking and spent a great afternoon learning about Moroccan cooking.
